loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en el Chaco, ella estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, está estudiando la carrera de Administración agraria, es una persona muy luchadora y emprendedora.
Él quiere ir abriéndose camino todo eso por medio de su profesión y su vida de profesional. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ramón is 23 years old. He lives with his parents and brothers in Chaco. He studies and works at the same time. He is studying agricultural administration. He is a very hard working and entrepreneurial person.

He wishes to open doors through his profession and professional life. He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his course fees and thus be able to keep up with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima es de la Ciudad de Villarrica, ella sigue con su carrera de odontología, comenta que esta luchando y se esfuerza por ser una profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas con su trabajo. Su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera.
Hoy ella pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder volver a cubrir sus cuotas y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de luchar por sus metas.
texts.en:
Fatima is from the city of Villarrica. She continues with her dentistry course. She tells us that she is working hard to become a professional who can help other people with their work. Her previous loan was used to cover tuition costs.

Today she is requesting a new loan to be able to pay her fees again and thus be able to continue with her education as she has been doing. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving to fight for her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru: Рахат, 46 лет, замужем, 4 детей, образование среднее. Она 20 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Акмарал есть лошадь, корова, 30 овец. На 2,0 Га земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль - около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и 10 овец. Акмарал намерена и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Rahat is 46 and married with four children. She has a high school education and started working in animal husbandry and agriculture 20 years ago. She has a horse, a cow and 30 sheep on her farm as well as 2 hectares of land where she grows beans for sale. Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS.

With the goal of increasing her head count of livestock, Rahat has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 130,000 KGS to purchase two cows and 10 sheep. She intends to increase the size of her herd even further.

loans.use: to buy two cows and 10 sheep to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Inam

texts.en:
Inam is a 57-year-old married woman from a village near Tulkarm City. She lives with her husband and five kids in a small house. Inam’s husband works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low and unstable income. Inam has a sewing workshop where she makes different types of clothing that she sells in the local market.

Inam is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop. Her loan will help her increase her productivity and her income. Inam appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 37-year-old married woman from Jabalia City. She lives with her husband and two kids in a small house. Samar’s husband works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low and unstable income. Samar has a sewing workshop where she makes different types of clothing that she sells in the local market.

Samar is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop. Her loan will help her increase her productivity and her income. Samar appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en: Rahma is 48 years old from Minia. She is married to a part time farmer and has four children, who are at school. She has a long experience in raising sheep and started a sheep business with a small capital. Her project is very successful but the increase in prices and in the needs of her family members encouraged her to request a 5000 EGP loan to buy more sheep, goats and lambs.

loans.use: To buy more sheep, goats and lambs to meet the needs of her family.

loans.name: Intesar

texts.en:
Intesar is a 45-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She lives with her husband and four kids in a small house. Her husband works as an employee in a local firm, where he gets a low and unstable income. 

Intesar has a sewing workshop where she makes different types of clothes. She sells her products in the local market.

Intesar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop. This will help her to increase her productivity and also her income.

Intesar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Leopao

texts.en:
Leopao is a 43 year old married woman with 8 children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Leopao needs a loan to buy new flippers, goggles, a new spear and a new canoe. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. Leopao has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy new flippers, goggles, a new spear and a new canoe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su primer ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, es una zona que aún se encuentra en crecimiento, eminentemente rural. 
La Señora Porfiria,  es una de las integrantes, ella es duela de una Despena donde vende todo tipo de productos de primeras necesidades. Con este trabajo ella ayuda a su familia a salir adelante, desea que  por medio de las reuniones de capacitación todas las personas su grupo y  de su zona puedan ir mejorando.
Solicita  este préstamo para la compra de carne, verduras, frutas, panificados  y bebidas, para que pueda seguir ofreciendo a la gente  y así generar más  ingresos para ella y toda su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas is in its first loan cycle with the Women's Committee program. This group is from the city of Curuguaty, a rural zone that is still growing. 

Porfiria is one of the group members. She is the owner of a store where she sells all types of basic goods. With this business, she is able to help her family get ahead. She hopes that, through the meetings and trainings, all the group members from her region are able to improve. Porfiria is requesting this loan 
in order to buy meat, vegetables, fruits, baked goods, and drinks so that she may continue offering them to her clients. In this way she will generate more income for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, fruit, baked goods, and drinks to stock her business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is the mother of a 16-year-old son, from Badian, Cebu. She is married and works hard to help the needs of her family. She has been engaged in making mats and rugs for the last five years. Her mat is made of burri (palm leaves) which she sells in the downtown area. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more burri leaves, cloth and dye to color her mats. Marissa is confident that a loan will help her come a long way and she can make a better return of her investment. Her income will be for her son's education and family's healthy meals.

loans.use: to buy burri (palm leaves), cloth and dye, to support her son's education

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Mbarete  está en el 10º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, además se encuentran dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Graciela ella se dedica a la venta de comidas sobre pedidos y ya tiene una clientela formada. Es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que ya ha ido creciendo en su pequeño emprendimiento. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carnes, hortalizas, condimentos y otros, y seguir de esta forma con la elaboración de sus comidas. También se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación, que hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
texts.en:
The Kuña Mbarete group is in their 10th cycle with the Women’s Committee Program, where they work together to get ahead. They have banded together in order to help one another. They are also participants in the Poverty Elimination Program so they might be able to give their loved ones what they were not able to have.

One of the members is Sra. Graciela. She has been selling food to order, and she has an established clientele. She is very good at what she does and her small enterprise has grown because of that. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy vegetables, meats, condiments and other supplies to continue making her foods. It should also be noted that the foundation continuously monitors and verifies.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, condiments and other supplies to make food.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is a married woman from Badian, Cebu, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer. They have three children ages 17 to 12. Rosalia and her husband work hard to provide for them. She has been raising hogs for 16 years. She is asking for a loan to buy quality feed for her animals. Rosalia knows how important it is to provide them quality feed so they grow fast and healthy. Her income will go towards her children’s education, healthy meals, savings and reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: to buy feed to raise pigs

loans.name: Mamdouh

texts.en:
Mamdouh is 26 years old and is from Baniswef. He is single and takes care of his aged and sick father who has some medical issues with his leg. He has a younger brother and a sister. Mamdouh runs a small cattle-fattening project and sells milk and cheese in the market.

Mamdouh is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy cattle to expand his cattle business. He will use his loan to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Siiae

texts.en:
Siiae is a 23 year old single woman with 1 child. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Siiae needs a loan to buy bags of flour, icing sugar, coconuts, large pots, barrel of cooking oil and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. Siiae has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, icing sugar, coconuts, large pots, barrel of cooking oil and a new oven

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Agustin está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cuatro señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en un nivel de pobreza extrema.
La Sra. Carmen se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, es una mujer muy luchadora y muy buena en lo que hace. Está luchando y esforzándose cada día para poder ser mejor y dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, pollo, jamón, queso, hortalizas, y otros, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group San Agustin is in its 2nd loan cycle with the Women's Committee program. Each of its members are doing a survey to eliminate poverty, on which four of the women were identified as living in extreme poverty. 

Carmen makes a living selling foods that she makes herself. She works each day making these very early in the morning. She is a hardworking woman who is very good at what she does. Carmen is fighting and dedicating herself each day in order to improve and giver her family what she never had. 

Carment is requesting this loan in order to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese, greens, and other items that will help her to continue her work. She is grateful for this opportunity to improve each day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese, greens, and other items.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleiman is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rogo Yanoko village in Nigeria. Suleiman joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, Suleiman no longer has to worry about having insufficient income to educate his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the yield of an average smallholder maize farmer in Nigeria. This year, Suleiman has ambitious goals of harvesting 35 bags of maize per hectare. With increased yields and incomes, he plans to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en: Dahiru is a maize farmer from Rogo Yanoko Village in Nigeria. Dahiru joined Babban Gona to improve the life for his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dahiru will have access to quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This year, Dahiru is optimistic and hopes to harvest 60 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dahiru would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved inputs that will increase the yield of his farm.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel es un productor de café del norte de Nicaragua. Desde pequeño ha estado relacionado con las actividades agrícolas, para él y su familia es la principal fuente de ingresos, por lo que cada día se esfuerzan por implementar las buenas prácticas agrícolas con lo cual ha logrado mejorar año con año la producción de su cafetal.

En este ciclo, Abel está solicitando un financiamiento para compras los abonos que requiere su café para poder asegurar una buena cosecha, lo cual se ha propuesto ir incrementando para tener mayores ingresos que le ayudarán a tener mejores condiciones para su familia. 

El sueño de este pequeño productor es lograr que su finca sea cada vez más rentable y sostenible, y potenciar este recurso para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Abel is a coffee producer in the North of Nicaragua. Since he was small he has been tied to farming activities. For him and his family it is the main source of income. So each day he tries to implement good agricultural practices with which he has year by year improved the production of his coffee plantation. In this season Abel is requesting a loan to buy manure that his coffee crops require to assure a good harvest which he hopes will continue to increase. That will help him to have better living conditions for his family. The dream of this small producer is to get to where his farm is ever more profitable and sustainable and boost this resource for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure that his coffee plants need to assure a good harvest.

loans.name: Tagiilima

texts.en:
Tagiilima is a 45 year old mother of 8 children. She had a small business of sewing clothes and sell them in her community to earn a living. 

Tagiilima requested for a loan to buy printing materials, needles, sewing machine, tape measure to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She will use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy printing materials, needles, sewing machine, tape measure

loans.name: Avalua

texts.en:
Avalua is 41 years old, with 2 children. She runs a business of selling taro and bananas at the market to earn a living. 

She has this experience for more than a year. Avalua requested for a loan to buy taro seedlings, banana seedlings, backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, hand gloves to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015 and she will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy taro seedlings, banana seedlings, a backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, hand gloves, to expand her business

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
Rosa Mística está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo muy unido que se formó con lo unión de amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano R. Alonso, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Justina solicita de este préstamo para invertir en su negocio de venta de comestibles y poder comprar verduras, carne, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir creciendo. Ella comenta que con su esfuerzo y su lucha ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante en vista a una mejor vida para sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Rosa Mística is in its first loan cycle of the Women's Committee program. It is a close-knit group that formed between friends and neighbors in the city of Mariano R. Alonso. The group is participating in the poverty elimination program. 

Justina is requesting this loan in order to invest in her business selling foods. She will buy vegetables, meat, greens, and other items so that she can continue expanding her business. Justina comments that with her efforts she has been able to help her family and loved ones. Justina is putting her whole self into her business in order to grow and get ahead. She is inspired by a vision of a better life for her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, greens, and other ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system and water tank

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a 40-year-old Babban Gona maize farmer. 

Yakubu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having insufficient income to pay his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan Yakubu will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yakubu has the chance to increase his earnings and, in the future, he would like to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase this farmer’s yields

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 29 years old with 3 children. She runs a business of selling bananas and taro at the market to earn a living. 

Dorothy requested for a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, taro seedlings, banana seedlings, a backpack sprayer, to help her run her  business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, taro seedlings, banana seedlings, a backpack sprayer,

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia is 45 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Nemesia works very hard to provide for them.

Nemesia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, spices and personal care products.

Nemesia has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, spices and personal care products.

loans.name: Percelina

texts.en:
Percelina is 36 years old and married. She has one child.

Percelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, coffee and personal care products.

Percelina has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Percelina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, coffee and personal care products.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is 30 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Tomasa works very hard to provide for them.

Tomasa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, spices, coffee, milk and personal care products.

Tomasa has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, spices, coffee, milk and personal care products.

loans.name: Misorminda

texts.en:
Misorminda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Misorminda is 58 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Misorminda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Misorminda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Misorminda has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Garba

texts.en: Garba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rogo Yanoko Village. Garba joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Garba will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Garba now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is 43 years old and married with three children.

Zeny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like cooking oil, coffee, canned goods, spices and personal care products.

Zeny has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from raising cattle.

Zeny aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like cooking oil, coffee, canned goods, spices and personal care products.

loans.name: Yunusa

texts.en: Yunusa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rogo Yanoko Village. Yunusa joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yunusa will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yunusa now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en: Basiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Nasarawan Doya Yanoko Village. Basiru joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Basiru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Basiru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Ahelen

texts.en:
Ahelen is 47 years old and has six children. Ahelen is married and has four children who are presently in school.

Ahelen is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Ahelen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Ahelen has been in this business for 12 years now. She also earns additional income from a general store and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rogo Yanoko Village. Abdu joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Abdu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Abdu  now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies which he will use on his coffee crop.

loans.name: No'man

texts.en:
No'man is 27 years old from Baniswef. He is single and has had an electric supplies store for three years. 

He wishes to expand his business, so he requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE to buy modern electric supplies, such as cables and lamps to attract more customers and increase his sales, to save for his marriage.

loans.use: To buy modern electric supplies such as cables and lamps, to save for his marriage

loans.name: Ropeta

texts.en:
Ropeta is a 23 year old unmarried woman with 2 children. She makes and sells pancakes and mince pies in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Ropeta needs a loan to buy a sack of mince, large bags of flour, a barrel of cooking oil and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Ropeta has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of mince, large bags of flour, a barrel of cooking oil and a new oven

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 37 years old, married and has two children who are currently in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Roselyn has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs, so she can send her children to college

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 41 years old, married and has ten children, of which nine are currently in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Imelda has been in this business for 21 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig, to help fund her children to college

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita works hard to support her family. Elenita is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Elenita requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Elenita has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Elenita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and also earns ncome from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional sacks of charcoal to offer for sale through her charcoal retailing business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.name: Evangelisto

texts.es:
Evangelisto, es un hombre de cincuenta y siete años de edad, entregado a su trabajo como productor de granos básicos. Él se ha dedicado a esto, desde los doce años de edad, cuando su padre le empezó a llevar al campo para que trabajase con él. Ahora cuenta con sus propias parcelas de tierra, las cuales trabaja en compañía de su hijo de diez años, el cual asiste por la mañana a la escuela y por la tarde ayuda a su padre a sembrar. 
Este ejemplar hombre, comercializa su producto en su comunidad y entre los compradores que llegan a la zona, en estos momentos sus clientes le demandan más, es por eso que Evangelisto recurre a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita comprar los  insumos necesarios, como por ejemplo pesticida, abono y semillas, para poder sembrar más, por lo tanto producir más.
texts.en:
Evangelisto is a fifty seven year old man who is devoted to his work as a producer of staple crops. He has been doing this since he was twelve years old, when his father began taking him to the field to work with him. Now he has his own parcels of land, which he works accompanied by his ten year old son. His son attends school in the mornings and in the afternoons helps his father with the planting.

This exemplary man sells his products within the community. His customers are increasing their demand, and for this reason Evangelisto is returning to Kiva and MiCrédito to request that they grant him another loan. This will allow him to buy the necessary supplies such as pesticide, fertilizer and seeds for example, in order to be able to plant more, and therefore produce more.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Alh. Tukur

texts.en: Alh. Tukur is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rogo Yanoko Village. Alh. Tukur joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, Alh. Tukur no longer has to worry about having insufficient income to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alh. Tukur will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will increase his household income significantly. Thanks to Babban Gona, Alh. Tukur has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is 29 years old from Baniswef. He is single and has a clothing store. He wishes to increase his monthly income.

Kamal is a former client of TADE, as he requested a 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on the due date.  Kamal requested another 5000 EGP loan to buy more clothing for his store, to increase his sales and also to save for his marriage.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for his store, to save for his marriage

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a Samoan citizen. She is 45 years old with 1 child. She runs a business of selling Samoan kava (traditional drink) at the market to earn a living. Lita requested for a loan to buy plastic bags, containers, kava, to help her run her business. 

She joined SPBD in 2015 and she will use her profit to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, containers, kava (traditional drink) to help support her family

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 60 years old, married with two children.

Elma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack food, noodles and other groceries.

Elma has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack food, noodles and other groceries

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 56 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending.

She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Sally has been running the general store for six years and has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children, two of whom are in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling bamboo.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Emily dreams of one day being able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 34 years old, married and has six children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming corn in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers, corn seeds, etc.

Evelyn has been farming corn for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, corn seeds, etc to expand her business

loans.name: Rang

texts.en:
Rang lives in a community in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. She is a construction worker and earns, on average, an income of USD 5.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for eight years.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine.

In this way, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Cerlita

texts.en:
Cerlita is married and works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling firewood.

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Cerlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a repair shop business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials for her repair shop business.

Aurora has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from a boarding house.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her repair shop.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nonita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jebelyn

texts.en:
Jebelyn is 37 years old and married. She fattens pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Jebelyn requested her third loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Aracelli is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aracelli is 55 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Aracelli has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Aracelli would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 25 years old and single with no children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for one year.

Rosalia has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, material, new stencils, wooden carved designs, and brushes.

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, material, new stencils, wooden carved designs, and brushes.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is 47 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are factory workers and one of whom attends school. She is a rice farmer, which she has been doing for 35 years, and lives in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. Her husband is a construction foreman. Together they earn approximately $18 per day. 

Chanthy’s house is old and she would like to buy construction materials to renovate it. She does not have enough finances to renovate, so she requested a loan, which she will use to have a proper house for her family. In the future, she wants to save money to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house and support her child to earn a high education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Taimoana

texts.en:
Taimoana is a 30-year-old married woman with 4 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business.

Taimoana needs a loan to buy a large urn, loaves of bread, block of butter, paper cups and plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Taimoana has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a large urn, loaves of bread, block of butter, paper cups and plates

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 70 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Perla is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Perla has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 52 years old and widowed with ten children, two of whom are in school. Magdalena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as bread, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc.

Magdalena has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as bread, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a new usable latrine, since the current one is in not in good condition and is therefore unhygienic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom with a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is a mother of 7 children and the age of 57. She wants to earn a living to support her family's needs.

She engaged in a sari-sari (convenience) store business to also help her husband in supporting her family's daily needs. Melita aims to increase her income so that she can be able to sustain the needs of her family, so that's why she decided again to borrowed a loan to buy more goods for sell in her store.

Melita wants to save money for the future out of her business so that she can renovate and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy more goods for selling in the store

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rona is 36 years old and three of her children are in school.

Rona has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Rona has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 46 years old and married, with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelfa runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as snack food, noodles, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Adelfa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tulipe

texts.en:
Tulipe is 25 years old and married with 4 children. She makes and sells elei (a printed cloth) material to earn a living and has been doing this for 1 year.

Tulipe has requested a loan to buy a large stack of rubber designs, stencils, cutters, a wooden board and paint brushes. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a large stack of rubber designs, stencils, cutters, a wooden board and paint brushes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.to increase her productivity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair an external wall that is leaking and change the pipes of her bathroom.

loans.name: Devi Joy

texts.en:
Devi Joy is 18 years old and single. She wants to help her parents with their living expenses so she has engaged in a transport business. Her motorcycle is rented by someone and she receives a rent income from it. But she is the one who bears the burden of motorcycle maintenance. To continue her transport business and to cater to more passengers in the community, she needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for motorcycle repair.

Devi Joy wants in the future to save money from her business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom in her mother's house.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Rizalina is 48 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Rizalina has a buy and sell mango business in the Philippines. Rizalina requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional mangos to sell on her fruit stall.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rizalina has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional mango to sell on her fruit stall so she can send her children to college

loans.name: Efigemia

texts.en:
Efigemia is 44 years old and married, with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Efigemia has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling recycled materials.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Luisa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Luisa is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 37 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pig in the Philippines. Annabel requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed. Annabel has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Annabel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 59 years old and married with six children.  With four children in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. Elizabeth has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, and other personal care products. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amelita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Amelita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Amelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 35 years old from Baniswef. He is married and has 3 children one of them is still in school. He also takes care for his aging father. 

He is one of our creative and committed clients. He wants to add car accessories sales to his business. So, he requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy car accessories such as sun roof deflectors, floor mats and light covers to increase his sales and his income for his family.

loans.use: To buy car accessories such as sun roof deflectors, floor mats and light covers, to increase his income for family support

loans.name: Ni Putu

texts.en:
Ni Putu, 32, is a housewife with 2 children. Her first child, 10, is in 4th year and the other is too young for school. Her husband works as a welder. 

Ni Putu has a business as a pastry maker. She has been in this business for 5 years. She makes many types of cakes and sells them. Everyday she needs 80.000 IDR to buy ingredients, such as powder, sugar, chocolate, etc. Ni Putu can makes profit 30.000 IDR per day or depending on the number of orders. To expand her business, she needs a loan and she will use it to buy a larger mixer, more ingredients and tools to make cakes. 

She’s also use the loan to purchase superior feed for her pigs. Now Ni Putu has 7 fattening piglets. She hopes all the best for her both businesses and will use all the profits for supporting her children's education

loans.use: to buy a larger mixer, more ingredients and tools to make cakes. She will also use the loan to purchase superior feed for her pigs, so she can educate her children

loans.name: Palomitas Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca existe una comunidad que todavía atesora rasgos de la cultura indígena mazateca. Uno de los simbolos distintivos de la localidad es la presa, que también brinda es una gran fuente de empleo pues en sus límites se ubican varios puestos de venta de mojarras fritas, empapeladas, enchipotladas, en caldo, sólo por mencionar algunas de sus presentaciones. De esta manera se puede disfrutar de un excelente platillo y una inigualable vista panorámica de la región.
   Palomitas es un grupo integrado sólo por mujeres, son siete: Julia dedicada a la venta de zapatos; Paloma y Araceli, a la venta de comida; Floribertha y Margarita, a la venta de refresco; Amairani, a la venta de ropa y Griselda quien maneja una estética. 

   Paloma siempre se distinguió por tener un gusto nato por la cocina además de un gran sazón. Por tal motivo, desde hace doce años decidió iniciar un negocio de antojitos típicos y tamales; por las mañanas vende en una escuela cercana y por la tarde regresa a casa en donde continúa ofreciendo sus ricos platillos. 

   Ella vive con sus padres y sus tres hermanas, toda la familia apoya con los gastos de la casa, todos son muy unidos por lo que no es extraño ver que entre ellos se ayuden con las actividades de los demás; “gracias a mi familia que me apoya incondicionalmente en mi actividad, sin mi madre y hermanas nada sería igual” comenta Paloma con una sonrisa en los labios. 

   Para Paloma no hay mejor motivación que saberse una persona productiva, de esta forma obtiene las ganancias necesarias para satisfacer sus necesidades y las de quienes más quiere. Con la posibilidad del préstamo planea comprar carne, chiles, manteca, queso, media crema, aceite, servilletas y platos desechables, sin duda material e ingredientes básicos en su actividad. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el local de Paloma quien viste blusa color rosa y short azul.
texts.en:
In Oaxaca, there is a community that still treasures the traces of the indigenous Maztec culture. One of the distinctive entities in the area is the prison, which provides a major source of employment. On its outskirts are many stalls of fried fish, wraps, "enchipotlada" dishes and soups, just to mention a few. There, one can enjoy an excellent meal and an unrivalled panoramic view of the region.
Palomitas is a women-only group of seven: Julia sells shoes; Paloma and Araceli sell food; Floribertha and Margarita sell drinks; Amairani sells clothing; and Griselda has a business as an aesthetician.
Paloma was born with a love and taste for cooking. For this reason, two years ago she started a business selling traditional appetizers and tamales. In the mornings she sells at a local school, and in the afternoons she returns home to continue selling her rich dishes.
She lives with her parents and three sisters. The whole family helps with the household costs. They are all very united, so it is not unusual to see them helping each other with their businesses. "I give thanks to my family, which supports me unconditionally in my business. Without my mother and sisters, nothing would be the same" says Paloma, with a smile on her lips.
For Paloma, there is no greater motivation than to become a productive person. This is how she obtains the necessary income to satisfy her needs and provide for those she most loves. With this loan, she will purchase meat, chillies, butter, cream, oil, napkins, and disposable plates. These are basic ingredients and supplies for her business.
*The photo was taken in Paloma's store. She is pictured wearing a pink shirt with blue shorts.

loans.use: to buy meat, chilis, butter, cheese, cream, oil, napkins, and disposable plates.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 30 years old, married and has 5 children. Farming is her source of living, She is engaged in buying & selling of livestock. She buys goats and sells them in the community. 

She wants to increase her income for her family, so she decided to borrowed a loan again to buy more goats to sell in the market. And also to have more sales and come up with more income.

Maribel wants for the future to save money from her business to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sell so she can build her own house

loans.name: Ragab

texts.en:
Ragab is 22 years old from Baniswef. He is single and has been working with his old father in raising poultry.

He decided to start his own poultry business, prepared the place and bought equipment for the project. With the outstanding amount, he bought some ducks. He requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE to buy more poultry, such as hens and ducks to increase his income and save for his marriage.

loans.use: to buy more poultry such as hens and ducks, to save for his marriage

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 30 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rona requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rona has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Valusia

texts.en:
Valusia is a 19 year old single woman with no children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Valusia needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Valusia has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, strainer and yeast

loans.name: Inolvidables Group

texts.es:
Marioli es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, decidida, emprendedora, alegre, independiente, feliz,  amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por la colonización de migrantes; tribus ayoreas nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente se apropiaron del lugar e iniciaron la manufactura y el comercio en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Marioli es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física delgada. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada; la primera de la izquierda, viste solera color lila con rayas horizontales blancas). Su vida la realiza en casa de sus familiares que es propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su sueño de superación para el bienestar de su hijo la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de pollo a la broaster, venta de verduras, comercio de artículos de limpieza, venta de embutidos, librería, carnicería, venta de ropa de segunda mano y venta de carteras, para solicita run préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, leche, huevos, galletas, refrescos, fideo, arroz, etc., actividad que realiza en horas del dia durante todos los días de la semana, “abrí mi tienda por la necesidad de pagar los gastos de mi niño, es una actividad esclavizadora pero a la vez no nos falta el alimento diario…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la atención es continua durante toda la semana por eso los clientes la escogen, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para mantener el negocio abastecido. Su sueño es abrir un mini supermercado, ella dese ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad para abastecer la tienda y abrir un mini supermercado. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marioli solicita un préstamo para abastecer su tienda de barrio y abrir un mini supermercado y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de su hijo.
texts.en:
Marioli is a single 20 year old mother of 3 children. Her business is selling food and daily use items in her neighborhood store. She is a good mother, decisive, enterprising, happy, independent, friendly, responsible and hard-working. Her business takes place in the 'Plan 3000' area which is characterized by it's colonization by immigrants. Ayoreas Native tribes from the area and miners relocated from the West and settled in this place and started manufacturing and commerce of all types. The climate is hot and tropical with a daily temperature that varies during the day between 18 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Marioli is dark-skinned with dark eyes, long black hair she ties back in a pony tail, short in stature and thin. Her native language is Guaraní that she speaks in her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. (in the photo she is the first to the left wearing a lilac colored shirt with white strips). She lives her life in the house of family members build of brick and cement with a metal roof, electricity, running water and sewage.

Her dreams of excelling for the well-being of her son led her to form a communal bank with people with businesses like selling roasted chickens, selling vegetables, a cleaning product business, selling cold cuts, a bookstore, a meat shop, selling used clothing and selling handbags to request a loan to improve their businesses.

Her business is selling food and daily use items like bread, sugar, milk, eggs, biscuits, soft drinks, noodles, rice, etc. She does business during the day every day of the week. “I opened my store out of the need to pay for my child, it is an enslaving business but at the same time she don't lack our daily food.” she commented. The advantage of her business is she is open continuously during the week so clients choose her. Her disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest to keep the store stocked. Her dream is to open a mini-supermarket.

She wants to expand her business by buying food and basic use items to stock her store and to open mini-supermarket. This is her first loan with the institution in the 3 years she has been in this business. For these reasons Marioli is requesting a loan to stock her neighborhood store and open a store to pay for the expenses of her son.

loans.use: to stock her neighborhood store and open a mini-supermarket and with the profits pay for her son's expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business, to give her income

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a hard-working mother from the town of Badian in Cebu. She has two children ages nine and twelve. For a decade now, Ellen has relied on direct selling to provide for her family. She sell items like shirts, shoes and sandals. Her income provide her children food and school fees. 

She is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy more supply of sandals, shirts and shoes. Ellen hope to buy stocks in bulk so she can provide her customers' orders. In the future, she hope to make her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy sandals, shirts and shoes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish-vending. Josephine is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Lorlyn

texts.en:
Lorlyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store. 

Lorlyn dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es: Danilo tiene la edad  de 50 años, está casado, vive con la esposa y tres hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Danilo is 50, married, and lives with his wife and three children who are his greatest priority. With his loan he plans to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, and to pay the labourers to tend to his coffee crops. He also plans to buy other plants to re-plant when the rainy season starts. This will increase the density of plants in the area. His soil is very fertile, and he will take advantage of this and of the good climate and conditions favouring the growth of coffee.
With these improvements, he hopes to obtain some income in order to improve his family's living conditions. He plans to invest a bit more in cultivation and reach some goals. This is his first loan from Fudecosur. He did not have loans previously with state banks, but Fudecosur has offered him a loan with good options and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene la edad  de 53 años, está casado, vive con la esposa y dos hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende  pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Luis is 53, married, and lives with his wife and two children, who are his greatest priority. With his loan, he plans to pay labourers to work on his coffee crops. He also plans to buy some plants to re-plant when the rainy season begins. His goal is to increase the density of plants in the area. With these improvements, he hopes to obtain some income to improve his family's living conditions. This is his first loan with Fudecosur. He has not had any loans from state banks, but Fudecosur has offered him a loan with better options and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy copperwood.

loans.name: Los Carambolos Group

texts.es:
El árbol del carambolo es común en una región de Oaxaca, sus frutos llevan el mismo nombre y asemejan a una estrella si se ven transversalmente. En la casa donde se integró el grupo Los Carambolos existen tres árboles de este tipo, razón por la cual los miembros decidieron identificarse así. Los catorce integrantes son: Isabel y Ana que venden antojitos típicos; María, cerdos; Agustina, Alicia y Sonia, pan; Rosalía, cosméticos; Blanca, artículos de plata recipientes de plástico; Gerardo, pan y refrescos; Hugo, herbicidas; Samuel, pan; Valentín, fertilizantes; Ma. De Lourdes, plásticos y Oscar quien maneja un auto lavado. 

   La familia de Doña Sonia está integrada por Leopoldo, su esposo, y tres hijos; todos ellos continúan con sus estudios. El objetivo de brindar un mejor futuro para su familia es lo que la motivó a iniciarse en el oficio de la panadería desde hace diecisiete años, su esposo ha sido su maestro y juntos manejan esta actividad ahora.

   La panadería de Doña Sonia inicia sus operaciones desde las cuatro de la mañana. Así mientras su esposo e hijo preparan la masa y los demás ingredientes, ella prende los hornos y alista los utensilios necesarios. Una vez que está todo listo comienza la elaboración delicada de cada pieza de pan. Cabe destacar que en las celebraciones como el Día de Muertos y el Día de Reyes su oficio es de suma importancia pues elaboran el famoso pan de sal y la tradicional rosca de reyes en cada ocasión.

   Doña Sonia además tiene la vista fija en seguir creciendo profesionalmente “no sólo quiero  continuar haciendo pan, quiero hacer pizza y volovanes; ya estoy tomando cursos en una institución" así, podrá ofrecer a sus clientes más opciones.

   Anteriormente, Sonia ha invertido en equipo y materia prima para la óptima elaboración de pan. En esta ocasión pretende comprar harina y azúcar ya que son los ingredientes más demandados en su actividad.
 
*La fotografía fue tomada frente a la casa de doña Isabel, doña Sonia viste blusa color verde.
texts.en:
The starfruit tree is common is the region of Oaxaca. Its fruits have the same name and resemble a star if they are seen crosswise. In the house where “Los Carambolos” (“The Starfruit”) group meets, there are three trees of this type, which is why the members decided to call themselves by this name. The fourteen members are: Isabel and Ana, who sell traditional snacks; Maria, who sells pigs; Agustina, Alica, and Sonia, who sell bread; Rosalía, who sells cosmetics; Blanca, who sells plastic containers; Gerardo, who sells bread and drinks; Hugo, who sells herbicides; Samuel, who sells bread; Valentín, who sells fertilizers; Ma. De Lourdes, who sells plastics; and Oscar, who manages a carwash. 

The family of Sonia is made up of Leopoldo, her husband, and three children, all of whom continue with their education. The goal of providing a better future to her family is what motivated Sonia to start a bakery seventeen years ago. Her husband has been her teacher, and together they manage this business now. 

Sonia’s bakery starts its work from 4 in the morning. While her husband and son prepare the dough and the other ingredients, she starts the ovens and prepares the necessary utensils. Once this is all ready, she delicately begins making each piece of bread. It should be noted that during celebrations, such as the Day of the Dead and the Three Kings Day, her job is very important, since they make the famous bread rolls and the traditional king’s cake pasty for each occasion.

Sonia also has a fixed vision of continuing to grow professionally. She says that she doesn’t only want to continue making bread, but she also wants to make pizza and vol-au-vents; she is already taking courses in a school. Thus, she will be able to offer her clients more options.

Previously, Sonia has invested in equipment and raw materials for the best way to make bread. At this time, she plans to buy flour and sugar, since they are the ingredients that are most needed in her work. 

* The photograph was taken in front of the Isabel’s house. Sonia is in the green shirt.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fish to sell.

Donna has been in this business for ten years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 43 years old from Baniswef. Her husband is an officer and makes very little income. She has 3 children and helps her husband with the family income with a poultry business. She even helped her older son in his marriage expenses. 

She wishes to expand her project, so she requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE to buy more poultry, such as hens and ducks, to increase her income and help her children resume their education.

loans.use: To buy more poultry such as hens and ducks, so her children may resume their education

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion works hard to support her family. Presentacion is widow and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like linen, threads, etc.

Presentacion has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Presentacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like linen, threads, etc

loans.name: Vaipanoa

texts.en:
Vaipanoa is a 54-year-old woman, who is married with five children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has five years of experience with this business. 

Vaipanoa has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janet is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Janet has a general store business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, ice cream, noodles and other groceries.

Janet has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, ice cream, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Juliet works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store. Juliet is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ingredients like fish, vegetables, spices, etc for her restaurant business.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ingredients like fish, vegetables, spices, etc

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 55 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo tiene la edad  de 53 años, está casado, vive con la esposa  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, y materiales para hacer un vivero de hortalizas. El desea  poder vender las hortalizas a sus vecinos  y en algunos negocios y con ello  espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, who is his main priority. 

With his loan, he hopes to purchase fertilizers and materials to make a vegetable garden. He wishes to be able to sell the vegetables to his neighbors and in some businesses, and with them he hopes to make a little profit. This will improve his family’s living conditions and also invest a little more in his farm and also accomplish some goals. 

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan to him with great ease and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy oil, beans, rice, soup, eggs, cheese, and sodas.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia has been engaged in toiling the land for more than 20 years. She grows and sells rice. She is a 55-year-old, married woman with three grown children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice seedlings and fertilizers. These will help Delia sell more rice and it will improve her earnings. Thus, she will be able to set aside some savings for emergency purposes. Slowly, she will be able to balance her finances and be able to pay her obligations. Delia hopes that with the capital she borrows, she will be able to improve her rice farming business, to become sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 67 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Delma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Delma has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Delma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Cerelina has been in this business for 5 years. Cerelina earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to to expand her general store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Joeserie

texts.en:
Joeserie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joeserie is 54 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Joeserie has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Joeserie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene la edad de 37 años, está casada  y vive con el esposo y dos hijos   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de hortalizas  que quieren iniciar. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 37 years old. She is married and currently lives with her husband and two children.
