She wants this loan to purchase materials and fertilizer and to give help to a vegetable farm that they want to begin. She hopes to provide maintenance to the crops to allow her to have a greater yield and so have a higher economic income. She hopes in the future to provide her family a better quality of life and more economic stability, and so continue growing as a person and as a producer. 

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her the loan with great ease and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for vegetables.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 52 years old from Baniswef. She is married to a farmer and has 2 sons and 2 daughters. One of her daughters is married and one of her sons is getting married soon. 

She helps her husband with the family income by a small sheep project so she requested 5000 EGP loan to buy 5 animals such as goats and lambs to expand her project and increase her income for her family.

loans.use: To buy 5 animals such as goats and lambs, to help increase the family income

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 62 years old and a single woman. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Gilda has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries.

Gilda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Gilda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Amelan

texts.en:
Amelan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for fishing like gasoline, fishnet, bamboo, etc. Amelan has been in this business for 11 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase mateials for fishing like gasoline, fishnet, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Puavai

texts.en:
Puavai is 23 years old and single with two children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for four years. Puavai needs a loan to buy a new freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned items and candy. 

She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned items and candy.

loans.name: Kimleang

texts.en:
Kimleang is 30 years old and married with two young children. She lives in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory since 2010, earning $5 each day. One of her two children attends school. Her husband is 31 years old and he earns the main income to support the family from buying and reselling recyclable junk. He has been in the business since 2011, earning $10 a day. 

Kimleang would like to take out a loan, because she needs finances to buy two cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy cows and improve her family’s finances. For her future plans, she is going to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house and support her children to earn high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy two cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 26 years old and single. To help his parents for living, he owns and manages a transport business. He carries passengers around his community. He drives his own motorcycle to earn more income instead for renting to others to drive and only receive a rental income. 

To continue his business and also as part of motorcycle maintenance, he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for the motorcycle repair. This is why he borrowed a loan again from GDMPC amounting  to PHP 4,000.00.

Jessie wants for the future to buy a new motorcycle for his business expansion.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the motorcycle repair and to buy a new one to expand his business

loans.name: Ma. Elsie

texts.en:
Ma. Elsie is 39 years old and a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Elsie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judy is 53 years old and has four children who are in school.

Judy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Judy requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

She has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Judy would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell, to expand her business and send her children to school

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 35 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, chips, etc.

Elvie has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, chips, etc to be able to send her children to college

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Sokhim is a 37-year-old married factory worker with three children in her care, and she lives in Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. She has been a worker in a factory since 2014, earning around $5 each day. Her husband is 37 years old, and he works as a construction worker, earning approximately $7 each day. 

Sokhim would like to buy lumber and zinc sheets to build her house, but she is short of the money, so she needs a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to build her house and have a proper house to live in. For her future, Sokhim wants to save money to buy farmland, build a bathroom with toilet, and support her children in earning Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to buy lumber and zinc sheets to build her house

loans.name: Taloa

texts.en:
Taloa is 48 years old and married with nine children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for five years. 

Taloa needs a loan to buy a large display freezer, snacks, frozen goods, shoes, canned items and diapers. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a large display freezer, snacks, frozen goods, shoes, canned items and diapers.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad de Oaxaca los campesinos aprovechan la fertilidad de la tierra para sembrar diversos productos. Al recorrer los caminos se pueden observar los campos llenos de caña de azúcar y de árbol del hule que son los más cosechados; pero también hay sembradíos de limones, frijol y maíz, esto da una idea clara de la riqueza del suelo. 
   
En esta comunidad se formó un grupo de nueve mujeres, todas con las mismas características; trabajadoras, comprometidas, honestas, responsables y, sobretodo, alegres, he de ahí el nombre de su grupo: La Alegría. Ellas son: Reyna,  Rosa, y Teresa quienes se dedican a vender abarrotes; Reyna, antojitos; Andrea, productos de papelería, abarrotes y refrescos; Yazmin y Karina, dulces; Rufina, manualidades y pan y finalmente Marcela quien vende pescado. 

   Al ser madre soltera desde hace seis años, Doña Teresa tuvo que buscar la manera de solventar los gastos de su casa y la educación de sus cuatro hijos, dos de ellos menores de edad. En un inicio comenzó a vender pan, pescado y tamales, sin embargo le restaba mucho tiempo con su familia pues vendía de forma ambulante, así que decidió iniciar con la tienda de abarrotes, actividad que ha mantenido desde hace cuatro años. Al principio sólo ofrecía los productos sobre una mesa y actualmente, con las ganancias obtenidas y con el apoyo de su familia ya construyó un local de madera lo que la pone contenta “la tienda es el patrimonio de mi familia, por mis hijos me esforzaré todo cuanto pueda” muestra de ello es que sus hijos continúan estudiando.
 
   A Doña Teresa le da satisfacción el poder obtener ingresos propios gracias a su actividad por eso piensa invertir el préstamo en más mercancía sobre todo en refresco de distintos sabores, galletas y botanas.

*Doña Teresa es quien viste blusa color rojo, la fotografía fue tomada en su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
In a community in Oaxaca the farmers make the most of the fertility of the land by sowing different crops. Walking along the tracks, one can see the fields full of sugar cane and rubber plants, which are the biggest crops, but also crops of lemons, beans and maize. This is a clear indication of the richness of the soil. 
   
Within this community a group of nine women formed, all of whom have the same characteristics: hard-working, committed, honest, responsible and, above all, happy. This is where the name of the group came from: La Alegría [Happiness]. The members are: Reyna,  Rosa and Teresa, who sell groceries; Reyna, who sells Mexican snacks; Andrea, who sells stationary products, groceries and drinks; Yazmin and Karina, who sell confectionery; Rufina, who sells handicrafts and bread, and finally Marcela, who sells fish. 

When she became a single mother six years ago, Teresa had to look for a way to cover the costs of her house and educate her four children, two of whom are minors. She started by selling bread, fish and tamales as a travelling sales person, but this didn't leave her much time to spend with her family so she decided to start a grocery store. She has now been doing this for four years. To begin with she offered her products on a table and now, with the earnings that she made and with the support of her family, she has built a wooden shop, which has made her very happy. “The shop is the heritage of my family, for my children I will work as hard as I can”, she says. This is demonstrated by the fact that her children are still studying.
 
Teresa finds being able to earn her own income thanks to her business very satisfying, so she wants to invest the loan in buying more merchandise, in particular drinks of different flavours, biscuits and snacks.

*In the photo, Teresa is dressed in a red top. The photo was taken in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy flavoured drinks, biscuits and branded snacks

location.town: Localidad Corrales, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa Oaxa

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia hails from Badian, Cebu. She operates a sari-sari store for three years now, earning her a monthly income of 4000 PHP. Lydia sell items like sugar, canned goods, noodles, rice, soft drinks and candies. 

She is asking for a loan to buy stocks for her store such as rice, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, biscuits and eggs. The additional funds  will allow her to make her business more profitable if she can refill her shelves in time. 

In the future Lydia hope to sustain her business and buy more merchandise that she does not previously carry. Her income will pay for her 17 year old daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her store such as rice, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, biscuits and eggs

loans.name: Grupo No Me Olvides Group

texts.es:
Ubicada entre cañales, en el estado de Veracruz, se encuentra una comunidad anteriormente conocida como “No me olvides”. Es un lugar apacible en donde se disfruta de igual manera el canto de las aves, la pureza del aire y  las hermosas puestas de sol.
  Aquí se consolidó el grupo No Me Olvides cuyas integrantes se consideran una familia quienes se dedican al comercio. Lucía vende comida; Julia, recipientes de plástico; Lorena, hot- dogs; Sara y Mena, antojitos típicos; María, calzado por catálogo; Lorenza, calzado por catálogo y de perfumes. 
   El matrimonio de Doña Julia con Don José se ha mantenido desde hace veinte años y son padres de tres hijos menores de edad. Es una familia que trabaja incansablemente por mantener la tranquilidad económica, ya que mientras José trabaja en el campo produciendo caña, Julia decidió comenzar a vender recipientes de plástico por catálogo. La condición de su hijo más pequeño es delicada pues sufre la enfermedad de Blount que impide el desarrollo normal de sus piernas, por lo cual son necesarias terapias cada semana. 
   Doña Julia, lejos de abatirse se ha decidido a trabajar más fuerte para que nada falte en su hogar. “Una madre hace todo por sus hijos y ahora más que antes continuaré vendiendo”. La actividad que realiza le permite estar al pendiente de la casa y generar ingresos al mismo tiempo, sobre todo para el tratamiento de su pequeño. 
   En esta ocasión con el préstamo podrá comprar recipientes de plástico para líquidos, mismos que son amigables con el medio ambiente pues reducen el consumo de productos desechables. 
  El grupo No Me Olvides agradece la oportunidad de los préstamos además del excelente trato que han recibido en VisionFund.

*La fotografía fue tomada frente a la casa de Doña Julia quien viste playera blanca y short negro con amarillo.
texts.en:
Located among canals, in the state of Veracruz, is a community previously known as “No me olvides” (“Forget Me Not”). It is a calm place, where one can enjoy—in equal parts—the singing of the birds, the pure air, and the beautiful sunsets.

Here, meets the group “No Me Olvides” (“Forget Me Not”), whose members consider each other a family and who are dedicated to business. Lucía sells food; Julia sells plastic containers; Lorena sells hot dogs; Sara and Mena sell traditional snacks; Maria sells footwear by catalog; and Lorenza sells footwear by catalog and perfumes. 

The marriage between Julia and her husband José has lasted for twenty years, and they are parents to three young children. This is a family that works tirelessly to maintain their financial stability. While José works on the farm producing reeds, Julia decided to begin selling plastic containers by catalog. Their youngest son has a very delicate condition; he suffers from Blount’s Disease, which impedes the normal development of his legs. Because of this, he needs therapy these week.

Julia, far from becoming depressed, decided to work even harder so that nothing would be lacking from her household. She says that a mother does everything for her children, and that now, more than before, she will continue selling. The work she does allows her to look after her house and generate an income at the same time, for her youngest son’s treatment.

At this time, with the loan, she will be able to buy plastic containers for liquids—ones that are environmentally friendly, since they reduce the consumption of disposable products.

The group is thankful for the opportunity for the loan, in addition to the excellent training that they have received from VisionFund.

* The photograph was taken in front of Julia’s house. She is in the white t-shirt and black and yellow shorts.

loans.use: to buy plastic containers.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is 26 years old, a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ronalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles and personal care products.

Ronalyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ronalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles and personal  care products.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 53 years old and a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

Ma. Lourdes has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and ingredients for her bakery. She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 39 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. Lorena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Lorena requested her eighth loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jestel

texts.en:
Jestel is 25 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jestel has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly is 37 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Dolly has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Dolly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a hardworking entrepreneur with four children. She operates a general store in the Philippines. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Alona requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, etc. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 73 years old, married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, spices, snack foods, and other groceries.

Felomina has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Felomina aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, spices, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene la edad de 40 años, está divorciado y vive con la madre  actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jorge is 40 years old, he is divorced and at the moment he lives with his Mom. 

Jorge is seeking a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer to get a coffee plantation started that he wants to grow.   He wants to properly look after his plantation so that it produces a high yield and thus Jorge's earnings increase. 

Jorge wants to offer his family a bright future and more economic stability, and he wishes to continue developing both as a farmer and as a person.

This is the first loan that Jorge will receive from FUDECOSUR. Jorge has never had a loan from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better conditions and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy supplies and seedlings.

loans.name: Melenalenuu

texts.en:
Melenalenuu is a 48-year-old, married woman with five children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Melenalenuu needs a loan to buy new shoes, a large freezer, snacks, canned items, cooking oil and drinks. 

She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. Melenalenuu has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy new shoes, a large freezer, snacks, canned items, cooking oil and drinks.

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es: Noemy  tiene la edad de 32 años, está divorciada   y vive con  tres  hijos   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unos cerdos pequeños y el concentrado para su alimentación .Ella espera poder engordarlos y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Noemy is 32 years old. She is divorced and currently lives with three children. She wants the loan for the purchase of some small pigs and the pellets for their feed. She hopes to be able to fatten them and sell them at the ideal weight to have a higher economic income. 

She hopes in the future to provide a better quality of life and better economic stability to her family, and be able to continue growing. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She had not previously had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her the loan with great ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Yolly

texts.en:
Yolly is 31 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries.

Yolly has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from fish vending. Yolly aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries.

Ninfa has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like rice, canned goods, shampoo and other groceries. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ninfa would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:

Bienvenida requested a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:

Reynalda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like foot-wear and home products

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:

To earn a living and help her husband make a  living, she has been engaged in a banana production business and has been selling the bananas in their community and other markets near to their place. 

It is a good business for the family because it helps them a lot with their daily needs, and most of it is used for the financial needs of the family. 

Thelma wants to increase their family income. That's why she decided to borrowed a loan again to pay labor costs for harvesting the bananas.

Thelma wants for the future to buy a new vehicle for delivering her bananas to the market.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for harvesting the bananas.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fattening pigs.

Elenita dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

texts.es: Gerardo tiene la edad  de 45 años, está casado, vive con la esposa  y un hijo que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unas herramientas para el taller mecánico .El desea con estas herramientas poder hacer mejores trabajos y dar un mejor servicio  con ello  espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y  también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 45 years old. He is married and he lives with his wife and one child who are his main priority. 

With his loan, he hopes to purchase some tools for his auto mechanic’s garage. He hopes with these tools to be able to do a better job and provide better service. With these, he hopes to make a little profit and so improve his family’s living conditions and also complete some goals. 

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not previously had any other loans from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan to him with great ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase tools for an auto mechanic garage.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

Angela has been in this business for 26 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell

Judy dreams that one day, She will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Milagros is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Sagynbubu

texts.ru: Сагынбубу, 44 года, замужем, 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством. У Сагынбубу есть 2 коровы, 10 овец, в сезон занимается полеводством, выращивая арбуз и хлопок на 1,20 Га земли. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сагынбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку рассады и удобрений для полеводства и выращивания органических продуктов. Доходы от кредита Сагынбубу будет использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также она хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Sagynbubu is 44 and married with four children. She has a high school education and works in farming. She has two cows and 10 sheep and works seasonally in agriculture, growing watermelon and cotton on 1.2 hectares of land. 

In order to further develop her business, Sagynbubu has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase seedlings and fertilizer so she can grow organic produce. She will use profits from the loan to develop her farm and also wants to save toward her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers to grow organic produce

loans.name: Taua

texts.en:
Taua is a 31-year-old woman with one child. She has a small stall selling niu (coconut drink) in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Taua needs a loan to buy lots of niu, timber for the stall, three large coolers, a machete, and straws. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Taua has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy lots of niu (coconut drink), timber for the stall, three large coolers, a machete, and straws

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 27 years old and married. She wants to help her husband make a living, so that's why she engages in banana production while her husband  is the one who sells the bananas in their community and nearby market. 

She wants to increase their family income and hopes to have a good harvest in their banana farm to come up with a better income. She decided again to take a loan to buy fertilizer for her banana farm.

Marivic's plan for the future is to buy a vehicle to use for her banana farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Vanuvanu

texts.en:
Vanuvanu is 39 years old, married, and has five children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community, which she has been doing for six years.

Vanuvanu requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy a new oven, two large frying pans, cooking oil, yeast, food coloring, and a strainer. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Vanuvanu has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven, two large frying pans, cooking oil, yeast, food coloring, and a strainer

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie is 42 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Lennie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lennie requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Lennie has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lennie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Agnes

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs and farming rice.

Agnes dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Nida has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Nida would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice and pig fattening.

Ameliza dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

texts.es: Leonardo  tiene la edad  de 25 años, está soltero, vive con la abuela  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes para asistir una plantación de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his grandmother who is his main priority. 

With his loan, he hopes to purchase fertilizers to help their coffee harm. With these improvements to his farm he hopes to make better profits and so improve his family’s living conditions. He also hopes to invest a little more in the farm and also achieve some goals. 

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan to him with greater terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to help his coffee farm.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Thugi Shg Group

texts.en:
The person seated on blue chair in the photo is Pauline, a member of Thugi SHG Group. She is 27 years old, married and has two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 to be trained and to understand business better and also gain economic power. She acquired enterprise skills that enabled her to start a beauty salon business. Her main purpose for applying for the Kiva loan is to buy a blow dryer and more beauty products such as hair gel and shampoo for her salon business to increase her returns. She will thus be in a position to meet her family's needs.
Pauline is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy blow dryer, hair gel and shampoo that will improve salon services.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa is a 42 year old married woman with 5 children. She makes and sells cooked taro and bananas in her community to earn a living. She has 4 years of experience with this business. Lisa needs a loan to buy sacks of taro, coconuts, large pots, a new oven and a bottle of gas. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Lisa has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy sacks of taro, coconuts, large pots, a new oven and a bottle of gas

loans.name: Faalafi

texts.en:
Faalafi is a 72 year old widow with 3 children. She runs a small handicraft business in her community to earn a living. She has 7 years of experience with this business. 

Faalafi needs a loan to buy loads of coconut shells, carving tools, blocks of wood, a machete, gloves and a new chainsaw. In the future, Faalafi hopes to pay for her families weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy loads of coconut shells, carving tools, blocks of wood, a machete, gloves and a new chainsaw

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is the mother of two children and is aged 48. She owns and manages a transport business to earn for living and help her husband to provide for her children needs. 

For motor maintenance she needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for the motorcycle repair to continue to be able to cater for more passengers and earn more income. So she decide to borrowed again a loan to repair her motorcycle.

Gina wants for the future to save money out from her business and sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Fuarosa

texts.en:
Fuarosa is a 43 year old married woman with 5 children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Fuarosa needs a loan to buy mutton, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Fuarosa has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy mutton, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates

loans.name: Emma

Emma is 49 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell .

Emma has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mercy

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mercy dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like rice retailing.

Rowena dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, spices, soft drinks, chips, coffee, etc

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Analiza works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business business in the Philippines, and also earns income from fish vending. Analiza is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 43 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of  charcoal to sell.

Carolina has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Carolina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of  charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mbogoini Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in this photo is Rachael, 60 years old, married and a mother of four children. She is a member of Mbogoini Women Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) training in 2013 and has successfully undergone the enterprise development training offered by HiH EA.
Rachael is a dairy farmer and is borrowing from Kiva to build a better cow shed and also buy feed for her dairy cows. This will boost productivity and increase her income. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed and to pay for construction of a better shed that will help keep animals healthy.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila , 56, raises and sells hogs to earn for a livelihood. Almost 5 years now that she has been raising hogs.
She is a married with five children. Two of them are still attending school.  She lives in San Miguel, Bohol.

She  is asking for a loan to buy pig feeds and piglets. With  these, Cirila, could now improve the way she raises hogs. She would be able to sell quality hogs and able to handle her finances. Slowly, she will be able to settle her obligations. Thus, she could now set aside and able to expand he existing business. She could also continue finance the schooling of her children for a brighter tomorrow.

In the future, Cirila is hoping that she could purchase a rice field to have other source of income and to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds and piglets

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge  tiene la edad  de 55 años, está casado, vive con la esposa y una hija   que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jorge is 55 years old, he is married and lives with his wife and their daughter who is his biggest priority. 

With his loan he aims to purchase fertilisers, fungicides and pay labour workers for work related to coffee production. With an improvement in his harvest he hopes to earn a slightly better income and be able to improve the living conditions of his family. 

This is the first loan he will recieve from FUDECOSUR. He has not obtained any state bank loans previously, but FUDECOSUR have provided him with the loan much easier and with an lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 55 years old, married with seven children.

Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries.

Norma has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Norma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family. She has a internet cafe business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a butcher shop.  

Daisy is requesting her eighth loan from NWTF for 28,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase an additional computer and other spare parts for the maintenance of her computer for her internet cafe business. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and other spare parts for the maintenance of her computer

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 68 years old, married, and has four children. She is engaged in a banana production business to help her husband for a living. It is a good business for the family because it helps them in providing for the family's daily needs. 

Julieta needs financial assistance to pay for the labor cost of harvesting the bananas and to be able to deliver them to the market. That's why she borrowed a loan again.

In the future, Julieta plans to buy a new motorcycle, to use in delivering the bananas to the market.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of harvesting bananas.

loans.name: Ellen Joy

texts.en:
Ellen Joy is 24 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ellen Joy has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
Cherry Ann is 38 years old, married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

She has a selling veterinary products business in the Philippines. Cherry Ann requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of veterinary products to sell.

Cherry Ann has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Cherry Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of veterinary products to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 51 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, soft-drinks and other personal care products. 

In the future Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa is 41 years old with five children. She runs a business selling cabbage, cucumber and eggplant in her village to earn a living. Lisa requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds for cabbage, cucumber and eggplant, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel and chemicals to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds for cabbage, cucumber and eggplant, a  wheelbarrow, rake, shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is thankful that her previous loan was able to suffice for her business needs. Through the amount, she was able to buy additional grocery products for her sari-sari store. As a result, she earned higher profit which she used for meeting her family expenses. 

However, she wants to expand her business more. That is why she is requesting another loan. With PHP 30,000, she can fill her store with enough supplies of groceries, toiletries and other products for sale. She can use this to gain more profit, which, for sure, will be a great help for her family.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Dorilyn

texts.en:
Dorilyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by selling firewood in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Dorilyn dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Mareohel

texts.en:
Mareohel is 32 years old and  with five children, four of whom in school, Mareohel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, egg, noodles, etc.

Mareohel has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Mareohel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, egg, noodles, etc

loans.name: Cricel

texts.en:
Cricel is a 35-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cricel has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant.

Cricel has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ma. Erna

texts.en:
Ma. Erma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a charcoal retailing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending and tricycle passenger.

Ma. Erma dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Joeann

texts.en:
Joeann is 32 years old and married, with one child who is in school.

Joeann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Joeann has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running a general store for three years and also earns an income from personal products.

Joeann aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 38 years old with two children. She operates a small business providing transportation services to people to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Tina requested a loan to buy seat covers, new windows, new wheels and pay for painting to help her maintain her good service. She hopes to use the profit to buy another taxi and support her family. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy seat covers, new windows, new wheels and pay for painting.

loans.name: Peka

texts.en: Peka is 34 years old with six children. She operates a business selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. Peka requested a loan to buy banana tube and taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, backpack sprayer, chainsaw, chemicals and hand gloves to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2011, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube and taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, backpack sprayer, chainsaw, chemicals and hand gloves.

loans.name: Vinnie

texts.en: Vinnie is a 38-year-old mother with 2 children. She runs a business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Vinnie requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a chainsaw, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a chainsaw, and hand gloves

loans.name: Tuna

texts.en: Tuna is a Samoan citizen. She is 53 years old with 3 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Tuna requested for a loan to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2012, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is a 53-year-old mother with 3 children and had a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. Elisapeta requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, and hand gloves to assist her in running the business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profits in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2002.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, and hand gloves

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga is 56 years old and married with 8 children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Aiga needs a loan to buy new overalls, chemicals, fertilizer, a sprayer and a new wheelbarrow. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Aiga will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new overalls, chemicals, fertilizer, a sprayer and a new wheelbarrow

loans.name: Foketi

texts.en: Foketi is 20 years old and single. She operates a business selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. Foketi requested a loan to buy banana tube and taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, hand gloves and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy banana tube and taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, hand gloves and chemicals.

loans.name: Geneza

texts.en: Geneza has started her small sari-sari (general) store business and it has become profitable, helping to support her husband in raising their family. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales because she has good salesmanship and characteristic good effort. Recently, she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock her store with more basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with more basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 46 years old, married and has four children. She is engaged in a garden business. The nature of her business is to sell plants and flowers around her community. Lorna wants to have more flowers and plants to sell. That's why she needs financial assistance to buy fertilizer for her gardens. This will result in good planting and having more flowers on her plants. She decided to avail herself of a loan again to finance this.

Lorna wants, in the future, to save money out from her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her gardens.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 31 years old and married with one child, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like milk, coffee, sugar, can goods, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like milk, coffee, sugar, can goods, etc

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one children.

She has a business fruit juice retailing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of fruit juice to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Rona dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home

loans.use: to buy supplies for her fruit juice business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 45 years old, married and has four children.  

She is in the agricultural business selling seedlings in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers, plastic bag etc.

Margie has been selling seedlings for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, plastic bag etc

loans.name: Chrisantha

texts.en:
Chrisantha is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Chrisantha is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Chrisantha has a food production business in the Philippines. Chrisantha requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Chrisantha has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Chrisantha would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Anabel is 30 years old and has one child who is in school.

Anabel has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Anabel requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing business.

Anabel has been in this business for three years. In the future, Anabel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Solar Solution for her Business and want to increase her income

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is a 28-year-old mother with 2 children. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches in her community to earn a living. Rachel requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned tuna fish, plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Rachel became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned tuna fish canned, plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 27-year-old mother with 2 children. She runs a small business of selling ice cakes in her community to earn a living. Margret requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bags, and coolers to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business in her community. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bags, and a cooler

loans.name: Taaitulagi

texts.en:
Taaitulagi is 33 years old, single, and has one child. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market, which she has been doing for five years. 

Taaitulagi requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy seeds, fertilizer, insect poison, sprayers, shovels, and a new wheelbarrow. She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insect poison, sprayers, shovels, and a new wheelbarrow

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is a 24 year old single woman with no children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Antonina needs a loan to buy a new pair of flippers, a spear, a new canoe, bait and a large fishing net. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. Antonina has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a new pair of flippers, a spear, a new canoe, bait and a large fishing net

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 32 years old and unmarried with 3 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 3 years. Elena has requested a loan to buy material, cutters, new stencils, gloves, fabric paint and rubber designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, cutters, new stencils, gloves, fabric paint and rubber designs

loans.name: Anne Jane

texts.en:
Anne Jane is a 40-year-old resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is currently engaged in selling frozen goods in a market near their vicinity. She is married to Rodrigo, who is a detachment commander in a factory, and they have two kids. Only through selling frozen goods does Anne Jane help her husband in providing for their family needs. Thank God that together they make a stable life for their household. 

Anne Jane would like to take out an amount of PHP 15,000 for a loan. It's because she needs enough capital to buy more stocks and supplies of frozen products and other related goods for her business. She is hopeful that this will be a good start for a better increase in income for her family. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks and supplies of frozen products and other related goods for her business.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
From Oroquieta City,  Florenda earns a living as a massage therapist and reflexologist. She needs to have enough supplies of herbal oil to be used in her massage activity to offer continuous service to her clients. This will provide her a good income, enabling her to help support her husband for their family.  

Since she wants to earn more, Florenda decided to sell herbal oil. For her capital needs, she approached PMPC to finance her project. She applied a loan to purchase more bottles of herbal oil to sell and utilize for her chosen business.  Florenda hopes to live comfortably with a stable financial status.

loans.use: to purchase more bottles of herbal oil to sell and also utilize for her massage therapy  business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 44 years old, married and have five children. She is engaged in a sari-sari store business to help her husband for living. She wants to earn a better income for her family. 

She decided to borrowed a loan again to buy more goods for sell and able to increase her store inventory and generate more income.

Jocelyn wants for the future to save money out from her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie wants to send her full thanks to the lenders who have assisted her previous request loan worth PHP 12,000. Without the help of these people, Rosemarie wouldn't have bought additional stocks of dried fish for her business. This became a great help for her especially in providing for the basic needs of the family. 

Again, she wants to avail a PHP 14,000 loan that she will use for buying more supplies of fish to sell. She assures you that your help will not be put to waste as she does her best to improve her inventory. 

Rosemarie simply wants to have a better life for her four children. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of dried fish products needed in her business.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

Olga requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

Olga has been in this business for 8 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. 

In the future, Olga would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Margarita dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.es: Marilyn tiene la edad de 30 años, está casada y vive con el esposo  actualmente. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para hacer un gallinero y además comprar las gallinas y el alimento para las mismas. Ella desea vender los huevos a los vecinos y en algunos negocios y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marilyn is 30 years old, married, and lives with her husband at present. She wants the loan to buy materials to construct a chicken pen and, in addition, to purchase hens and chicken feed for them. She wants to sell the eggs to neighbors and to some businesses, thereby bringing in a greater income.

Marilyn hopes to offer her family a better quality of life in the future and greater economic stability. She also hopes to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

This is the first loan she has received through FUDECOSUR. Marilyn has had no previous loans from sate banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with the best facilities and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: purchase building supplies to construct a chicken pen and buy some hens, plus chicken feed.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Petronella

texts.en:
Petronella is 35 years old and separated with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Petronella needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new gloves, a spade, a crowbar and crops.

Petronella has been a member of SPBD since 2010. She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new gloves, a spade, a crowbar and crops

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 44 years old with six children. She operates a business selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Maria requested a loan to buy banana tube and taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chainsaw, hand gloves and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2010, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy banana tube and taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chainsaw, hand gloves and chemicals.

loans.name: Semillitas De Pacallal Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Semillitas de Pacallal” conformada por 05 socias emprendedoras y solidarias con ganas de progresar.Jackelyn de 32  años es casada con 04 hijos dependientes. Ella  se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.jackelyn se siente orgullosa porque gracias al préstamo podrá mejorar su negocio. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de labiales, perfumes, talcos y colonias. El deseo de Jackelyn es de mejorar el negocio. El grupo “semillitas de pacallal” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Jackelyn  es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo blanco.
texts.en:
This is the new group "Semillitas de Pacallal", comprising 5 enterprising and united members with the desire to progress.  Jackelyn is 32 and married with 4 dependent children. She sells cosmetics and is proud that, thanks to the loan, she will be able to improve her business. The loan she requested will be used to buy lipsticks, perfumes, talcum powders and colognes. Jackelyn's wish is to improve her business.  

The group "Semillitas de Pacallal" are grateful to the people who made this loan possible.  Jackelyn is the third from the right wearing a white t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, perfumes, talcum powders and colognes.

loans.name: Niagai

texts.en:
Niagai is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She makes and sells food in her community, which she has been doing for one year. 

Niagai requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy a case of chicken leg quarters, a box of sausages, tomato sauce, a sack of rice, and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Niagai has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to purchase a case of chicken leg quarters, a box of sausages, tomato sauce, a sack of rice, and a new oven

loans.name: Rodalisa

texts.en:
Rodalisa works hard to support her family. Rodalisa is married and has a buy and sell crude oil business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more gallons of crude oil to sell.

Rodalisa has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Rodalisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of crude oil to sell, to be able to send her kids to college

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ginalyn is 32 years old.

Ginalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Ginalyn requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Ginalyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ginalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Eva Fe

texts.en:
Eva Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, sticky rice, etc.

Eva Fe has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Eva Fe would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, sticky rice, etc

loans.name: Tilia

texts.en:
Tilia is 38 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Tilia has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Tilia would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 47 years old and married with four children.  With two children in school, Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Liza has been in this business for 21 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Liza would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling veterinary products.  

Jocelyn is requesting her sixth loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as coffee, rice, sugar, etc. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as coffee, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Solar Solution for her business and she also wants to increase her income.

loans.name: Jonavie

texts.en:
Jonavie is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells frozen foods in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from food vending. 

Jonavie is requesting a loan from NWTF for 23,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stocks such ase bacon, ham, etc. to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bacon, ham, etc. to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita would like you to know her full appreciation and thanksgiving because her previous loan has indeed helped her in buying additional products for her business. She faithfully repaid an amount of PHP 8,000 which she had used in buying additional products for her inventory. 

But still, she would like to improve her sales more. Because of this, she is humbly requesting another PHP 15,000 which she will use to purchase more merchandise, particularly gallons of mineral water.  Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. 

Some time in the future, she wants to renovate their house and be able to earn for her children's education. If they finish their studies someday, it will give them great security for better lives ahead. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y a la crianza de ganado, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus os hijas, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young lady in the picture with her face pixellated is 28 years old and lives in a high risk area. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her two daughters.  

For 10 years she has cultivated corn and raised livestock, and she sells her produce in the local area.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control, herbicides, etc. in addition to improving the land shown in the photo.  Thus she can continue cultivating, as this is her only source of work, and receive a better income.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control and herbicides, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Murika Group

texts.fr:
Gerase  fait partie du groupe  Murika et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 64 ans et est marié à Félicité ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant.

Il fait le commerce de  bière  de banane et de la bière industrielle  depuis  4 ans. 

Il est à son troisième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Gerase is a member of the Murika group and lives in Gitega. He is 64 years old and is married to Félicité, a farmer. They have one child together. 

He has been trading in banana beer and industrial beer for four years.

He is on his third loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he receives, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of beer to resale for profit.

loans.use: to increase his capital and to buy a large quantity of beer to resale for profit.

loans.name: Royal

texts.en:
Royal is 21 years old, a single freshman from the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in literature at a university in the city. His father is a construction worker and his mother is a homemaker. Royal has decided to take out a loan because he is short of the money to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year. 

With this loan, he will be able to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. After graduation, he dreams of having a proper job with a reasonable salary, and he also wants to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is the mother of nine children and is aged 44. She owns and manages a motorcycle shop. Her nature of business is to repair motorcycles and at the same time to sell motor parts, accessories and other items for motorcycles. She wants to improve her business and make a better income, so she needs financial assistance to buy more motor parts to sell.  This is why she took a loan.

Alma wants for the future to expand her business and have another branch of her motor shop.

loans.use: To buy more motor parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy banana seedlings, taro seedlings, a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, chainsaw, backpack sprayer,

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is a 29-year-old single mother of 5 children. For the past year, she has operated a small barber shop business at the village market to cater to the public. Rosalina needs a loan to buy 10 new clippers, hair coloring products, towels and hair softener products. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Rosalina joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy 10 new clippers, hair coloring products, towels and hair softener products

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Eva dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening.  Analyn is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a married woman with two children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sandra is 31 years old..
