Sandra has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Sandra requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Sandra has been in this business for two years. In the future, Sandra would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Helen has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice and vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jonna is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jonna is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jonna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jonna requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Jonna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jonna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jenely

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jenely works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell frozen food. Jenely is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear to sell in her clothing business.

Jenely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 39 years old, married and has one child in school.  

She is in the business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jessica has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jessica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Muyisa Group

texts.fr: Bernadette est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Muyisa», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un enseignant, âgée de 48 ans, mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des divers produits manufacturés dans un marché de la ville depuis 3 ans. Elle va acheter du sucre, sel et savon en poudre(Omo). Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leur bébés.
texts.en:
Bernadette is a saleswoman and president of the loan group "Muyisa", a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. She is 48 years old, mother of 6 children in school, and married to a teacher. 

 She began her business with funding from her husband. She has been selling various products manufactured in a city market for 3 years. She is going to buy sugar, salt, and powdered laundry soap (Omo). This way, she wishes to grow her capital, to buy a plot of land, to educate and to feed her children.

 Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support raised for non-bankable entrepreneurs. We must note that certain clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, and powder laundry soap (Omo).

loans.name: Kiletien Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Pauline, a member of Kiletien Women Group. She is 46 years old, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. 

Pauline does maize and beans farming and also rears poultry. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to run her enterprise better and profitably unlike before. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and poultry feeds. This will increase her farm production, meet the demand for cereals, earn her more income, and hence go a long way in supporting her children’s education and her family's basic needs.
 
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds, seeds and fertilizers that will help improve her farming and thus earn her more income.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée et âgée de 42 ans. Ablavi habite dans le quartier de Mayakopé avec deux enfants à sa charge. Très entreprenante et dynamique, Ablavi vend des coussins en coton en se déplaçant aux besoins de ses clients afin de trouver son gain. Ablavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des coussins, Ablavi demande ce crédit pour réaliser sa commande et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire pour aider ses enfants
texts.en: Ablavi is a 42 year old married woman. Ablavi lives in the Mayakopé area with two children in her care. Very entrepreneurial and dynamic, Ablavi sells cotton pillows while moving about as needed by her clients in order to seek out her profit. Ablavi resupplies twice per month at the market. Ablavi is requesting this loan to fulfill her order of pillows and to increase her profit margin to help her children.

loans.use: to buy eight pillows.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is the mother of four children and aged 44. She wants to earn for a living and help her husband in providing their family needs. She wants to increase her family income and give her family a better life. So, Lolita decided to take a loan again to purchase additional good items for sell and be able to increase her store inventory and generate more income.

Lolita plan for the future to expand her business and make her sari-sari store building bigger.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items for sale.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is 25 years old and married. He is engaged in a business transporting passengers around his community. Felix needs to increase his income to help his parents with their family needs. He needs financial assistance to pay for repairs to his side car so that he can transport more passengers in this way. Felix's plan for the future is to have a new motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: To repair the side car of his motorcycle

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Linda works hard to support her family.

She has a sugarcane business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Linda is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers for her sugarcane business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Linda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory is a 50 year old, widow with four children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Lory has borrowed and paid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of new Ruma agents, Anita. Anita lives in Magelang, Central Java, a city located about 1 hour and 30 minutes flight from Jakarta. Anita is a young lady who has a big spirit to become a successful entrepreneur. She owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks. Anita is known by her neighbors as a cheerful and kind woman, that’s why it’s really easy for her to attract customers. As a woman, she began to realize that she needs to improve her life with increasing her income. Therefore, almost a year ago, she decided to join Ruma and provide the services that allow her customers to buy mobile phone credits.

As the business grows, Anita is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Anita improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Anita is the one who is standing in front of her own stall. She is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta is a married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Greta is 53 years old.

Greta has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Greta requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her dried fish making.

Greta has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Greta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dried fish making business.

loans.name: Faletusi

texts.en:
Faletusi is a 57 year old widow with no children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business.

Faletusi needs a loan to buy paper plates, a new boiler, loaves of bread, a toaster and sliced ham. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Faletusi has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy paper plates, a new boiler, loaves of bread, a toaster and sliced ham

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is a 27-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. 

He works as an employee where he gets a low income. This income is not enough to cover all his family's needs. Basel wants to find an additional job to improve his family living conditions.

Basel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to start transferring goods on it. By taking this loan, Basel's income will increase.

Basel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to start transferring goods on it

loans.name: Repeka

texts.en:
Repeka is a 33 year old unmarried woman with 2 children. She makes and sells Samoan Taro chips in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Repeka needs a loan to buy 2 large pots, a large gas burner, a gas bottle, taro and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Repeka has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy 2 large pots, a large gas burner, a gas bottle, taro and plastic bags

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 33-year-old married woman from Ramallah city. She lives with her husband and two kids; a son and a daughter. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Suha studied web design and she wants to open her own business.

Suha took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a modern laptop and some programs to start her new web design business. By taking this loan, Suha will be able to increase the family income.   Suha appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a modern laptop and some programs to start her new web design business.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a food vending business in the Philippines for 20 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Leila is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ingredients for her business.

Leila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ingredients for her business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina laboraba como empleada doméstica en la vivienda de una señora que elaboraba bollos (productos a base de masa de maíz envueltos en hojas de mazorca o en hojas de plátano), ella le colaboraba con la elaboración de éste producto y en una ocasión su jefa se incapacitó, por lo que temporalmente tomó las riendas del negocio y se volvió una experta.  Luz Marina decidió iniciar su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de bollos, en la actualidad tiene 10 años de estar funcionando; su clientela está situada en el barrio donde vive en el municipio de Soledad quienes son fieles consumidores de sus bollos, los cuales son consumidos a cualquier hora del día pero preferiblemente en los desayunos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para invertir en maíz, queso, anis en grano y demás insumos necesarios.  Esta inversión activará la producción y con ello responderá a la demanda de sus clientes. Luz Marina es una emprendedora mujer de 39 años, que tomó clases de modistería  y desea a futuro comprar una máquina de coser para tener otro ingreso alterno, ella es madre de cuatro hijos a quienes con su trabajo ha logrado ofrecerles bienestar y desea continuar educándolos hasta la educación superior.
texts.en:
Luz Marina worked as a maid in the house of a woman that made 'bollos' (corn dough products wrapped in the husks of corn cobs or banana leaves). On one occasion, she helped in the making of this product when her employer was ill.  Through temporarily taking the reigns of the business she became an expert. 

Luz Marina decided to start her own business producing and selling 'bollos'. She has now been working for 10 years; her customers come from the neighbourhood where she lives in the town of Soledad.  They are loyal customers who buy her 'bollos' at all times of the day but prefer them for breakfast.  

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first funding made by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in corn, cheese, aniseed and the other supplies necessary. This investment will boost production and let her respond to the demands of her customers.  
 
Luz Marina is a 39 year old business woman. She took dress making classes and in the future hopes to buy a sewing machine in order to have an alternative income.  She is a mother of four children and through her work has been able to give them a good life.  She hopes to continue supporting them through to a higher education level.

loans.use: to invest in corn, cheese, aniseed and other necessary supplies.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 56 years old and married and works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a direct selling Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like lotions, colognes, etc. to sell.

Merlinda has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like lotion, cologne, etc. to sell

loans.name: Andi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Andi. Andi lives in Solo, a city located in Central Java, around six hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Andi lives there with his wife. He owns a stall where he sells mobile phone accessories and mobile airtime credits. He learned about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive, who came to his house. Andi's community sees him as a friendly and trusted mobile provider. Andi feels happy that he joined Ruma because he can now contribute more to his community.

As the business grows, Andi is hoping to get working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and bill payments for members of his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Andi improve his business and, accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. 

Andi’s goal, in the near future, is to serve as an e-commerce business for his customers by offering Ruma's latest product, called Mapan. 

In the photo, Andi is standing in his own stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments for members of his local community.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome, 54 year old, is married and has 7 children. For the past year, she has run a small tailoring business in her community. Salome has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Salome joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy handbags

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Here is Vilma, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Recently, she received a loan of PHP 10,000, which she used for her computer shop business within her vicinity. Vilma is able to sustain all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. This is why she would like to give her gratitude to those who previously lent her assistance. 

To improve sales, Vilma would like to apply for a new loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business. This would certainly allow her to improve her livelihood and eventually grow with the grace of God. For now, it is her desire to have people like you to assist her in her prospect. 

In the future, Vilma hopes to give her family a more favorable kind of living and simultaneously drive her inventory into progress. She would also like to see her children complete their studies. Vilma meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 31-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He is the father of two daughters
He works as an employee where he gets a low income. This income is not enough to cover all his family's needs. Adham wants to find an additional job to improve his family living conditions.

Adham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to start transferring goods on it. By taking this loan, Adham income will increase.   Adham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to start transferring goods on it

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen, 60 years old, is married and has one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 16 years, Carmen has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Carmen would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jiji Group

texts.en:
Sara is the featured borrower for Jiji Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and a living at the same time.

Sara is a 18-year-old single lady. Due to the low financial situation of her family, Sara started selling makeup to cover her needs and expenses, while she is also continuing her studies. She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady, who is trying hard to develop her business, without affecting her studies. 

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her school tuition fees. She hopes to finish her studies and start working in the field she loves to build a better life for herself and her family. She is the first lady on the right of the photo.
 
With respect to the other group members, Jinan, in the center, is a 26-year-old single lady who works in a company and wants to maintain her car, while Samia, on the left, is a 43-year-old divorced lady, who works in preparing food from her house and wants to pay her mother's medical expenses.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees

loans.name: Mavil

texts.en:
Mavil is a 22 years old, married and has two children to provide for. She wants to give her children a better life and also to help her husband to earn income for their family. 

She is engaged in a vegetable garden and she aims to have a good output and at the same time to harvest more vegetables, so that she can sell more vegetables in the market and generate more income.

Mavil wants in the future to save money out from her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her vegetable plants.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa works hard to support her family. Nelfa is widow and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Nelfa has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Nelfa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Patisepa

texts.en:
Patisepa is a 30 year old unmarried woman with 4 children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Patisepa needs a loan to buy soya sauce, paper plates, a new grill, sausages, mutton and lamb chops. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Patisepa has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy soya sauce, paper plates, a new grill, sausages, mutton and lamb chops

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 33-years-old married man from Dora, a village near Hebron city. He is the father of five small kids. Fadi works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income due to the demand. Fadi would like to improve his family living conditions, so he decided to start his own business

Fadi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy chicks and prepare the barn. This will enable him to start his own business and improve his family living conditions.   Fadi appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy chicks and prepare the barn, to start his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This is Margaret, a 38-year-old mother and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She has been managing her own sari-sari store and her income from this helps in supporting the household.
 
Having faithfully paid back her previous loan amounting PHP 22,000, she would respectfully like to avail another loan worth PHP 22 000 which she will use to purchase more grocery items like shampoo, biscuits, condiments and other relative products. Surely, this will help her improve her profit at no given time. By now, she sincerely lets you know her thanksgiving for your deep rooted generosity and kindness.   

Someday, Flor dreams of being successful with the current inventory.    By then, she will be able to earn for her children’s education. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and direct-selling personal products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 34 years old, married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

Nilda has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael  tiene la edad  de 69 años, está casado, vive con la esposa actualmente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia de siembra de papa . Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Misael is 69 yeas old, married and living with his wife. He wants to use his loan to buy fertiliser and fungicide, and to pay for manual labour to help him sow potatoes. He hopes that these improvements in his farming will give him a little profit and so improve living conditions for his family.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't had other loans with state banks before. However, FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan on better terms and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing potatoes.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Handrian

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Handrian. Handrian lives in Purwokerto, a city located in Central Java, around 7 hours by train from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Handrian lives there with his wife and his son. Handrian owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products, mobile airtime credits and provide bill payment services for his community. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. His community sees Handrian as a friendly and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Handrian is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits to his communities and bill payment services for his communities. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Handrian improve his business and accordingly, his community which needs access to such services. Handrian’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his customers, a Ruma latest product called Mapan. Handrian it self is the one who seen in the photo. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Marizel

texts.en:
Marizel is 25 years old and married with one child. Marizel works very hard to provide for them.

Marizel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marizel has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, shampoo, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Marizel would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell and be able to expand her business

loans.name: Iftikar

texts.en: Iftikar is a 35-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. While her husband is the main income provider in the family, due to bad financial conditions, she also works in order to offer her family additional financial support. Iftikar opened a clothing shop in 2012, where she offers a great variety of clothes at good prices. Today she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business operations and offer new fashions for sale. In this way she will be able to increase her sales revenue.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita raises and sells hogs and has been doing so for a long period of time. She is a 59-year-old married woman with nine children and is from Alburquerque, Bohol. Four of her children are still attending school.

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and piglets. With these, she can raise healthy hogs and will be able to improve her livelihood, thus providing her children with good food and better living conditions.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and piglets.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary is a married man with five children. He is a police office within the capital city of Kenya. He has been able to acquire some plots within the informal settlement in the city where he works as a community policing officer.

A plot has more than 10 units and this is the reason as to why he needs to install a Fresh Life Toilet. He learned of the franchise though community policing. The toilet will make his plot very hygienic which hence would increase the rent which will go towards the repayment of the loan. Also he has a salary which will subsidize the payments in case the income from the rental units are not enough.

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit is 52 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in Senaki district. Davit grows nut trees on the family-owned agricultural land and sells the harvested nuts. In addition, he has pigs and sells piglets. Davit wants to start a new business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3800 GEL. Davit will purchase cement and will start producing bricks to sell locally. This will increase his income and will enable him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement and start producing bricks to sell

loans.name: Thodory....

texts.en:
Thodory who is in his mid 40s is married with three children, two boys and one daughter and all of them are still at school.  He has been buying and selling cattle for ten years now.  He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Thodory's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase on the cattle stock, managed to sell to many customers and has paid back all his loans successfully. 

He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment, opened a retail shop and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy cattle and sell to more customers. He dreams of opening another business. 

Thodory will make sure he pays back the loan in the scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sell to more customers. This will help pay school fees and to open another business.

loans.name: Loifofogamaligi

texts.en: Loifofogamaligi is 42 years old and married with 1 child. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 1 year. Loifofoga has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers and rubber designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers and rubber designs

loans.name: Fuapepe

texts.en: Fuapepe is a 45-year-old woman who is married with 7 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Fuapepe has requested a loan to buy 2 new sewing machines, rolls of material, needles, thread and zippers. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy 2 new sewing machines, rolls of material, needles, thread and zippers

loans.name: Aitupe

texts.en:
Aitupe is 41 years old and unmarried with 3 children.   She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Aitupe needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new spade, a wheelbarrow, crops and a crowbar. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Aitupe will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new spade, a wheelbarrow, crops and a crowbar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalinda dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carsiyan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Carsiyan. Carsiyan lives in Pekalongan, a city located in Central Java, about 2 hours from Jakarta by plane. Carsiyan owns a stall that sells stationeries and provides photocopy & mobile payment services for his community. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn more about how to improve his business using technology. His community sees Agus as a friendly person, that’s why it’s really easy for him to attract customers.
 
As the business grows, Carsiyan is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Carsiyan improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services.  Carsiyan’ goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce service for his community. As seen in the photo, Carsiyan is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a Solar Solution for her business and wants to increase her income

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en:
Norlyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Norlyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies to build her business

loans.name: Tuyết

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyết works in agriculture farming food.

Tuyết is 59 years old and she is married with 1 child.She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.Tuyết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years

This is Tuyết first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 40 years old and married with four children who are in school, Sally works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, oil, etc. to sell.

Sally has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Sally would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Donald

texts.es: Donald, tiene la edad de 37 años, está casado, vive con su esposa e hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de papa de buena calidad y que se adapte adecuadamente a las condiciones de suelo y clima de la zona, además que tenga una buena característica de cosecha adecuada al igual que el rendimiento del producto final, además de algunos fertilizantes para aplicarle al cultivo de papa, también realizar algunos trabajos de labores culturales como lo son la conservación de suelos por medio de realización de canales a nivel para que el agua de lluvia no pueda realizar lavados, principalmente en las partes con más pendientes, con estas nuevas prácticas de trabajo espera cumplir con el objetivo de tener una plantación con mejor sanidad y un suelo con más fertilidad y por ende una mejor cosecha. Con esta compra de productos adecuados tendrá una calidad mejor de producto para el consumidor. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Donald is 37 years old and married. He lives with his wife and children, who are his first priority.

With this loan, he intends to purchase high-quality potato seeds that properly adapt to the area's soil conditions and climate, and that have the good characteristic of producing an adequate harvest and final product yield. He will also buy some fertilizers to apply to the potato plants, and carry out some cultural projects such as soil conservation.

The soil conservation project will be done by creating level canals so that the rain can't wash through, mainly in the most sloped areas. With these new work practices, he hopes to achieve his goal of having a healthier plantation with more fertile soil, and therefore, a better harvest.

With this purchase of the necessary products, he will have a higher quality product for the consumer. This is the first loan he has received from Fudecosur. He has never had other loans from state banks, but Fudecosur has given him the loan more easily and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for potato farming

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta  tiene la edad de 50 años, está casada   y vive con el esposo  actualmente. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de unos cerdos pequeños y el concentrado para su alimentación .Ella espera poder engordarlos y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marta is 50 years old, married, and currently lives with her husband.

She wants the loan to buy some small pigs, as well as pig feed. She hopes to fatten them and sell them at the ideal weight in order to have better income.

In the future, she hopes to provide a better quality of life and more economic stability for her family, and she wants to continue growing.

This is the first loan she has received from Fudecosur. She has never had other loans from state banks, but Fudecosur has given her the loan more easily and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Blessing School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Paul. He is the head teacher of Blessing Junior School, a mixed school with 610 students in the urban area of Masaka. Blessing School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Blessing School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Paul ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio  tiene la edad  de 49 años, está casado, vive con la esposa y un nieto  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Julio is 49 years old, married and lives with his wife and a grandchild who are his greatest priority. With the loan he hopes to buy fertilizer, fungicides, and pay for labor to assist his coffee crops. He also wants to buy a few seedlings to reseed at the start of the rainy season with the objective of increasing the plant density to .take advantage of the high fertility of the soil, climatic conditions and others that favor the growing of coffee.

With these improvements he hopes to obtain a bit more profit and thus improve the living conditions of his family plus also invest more in the growing area and also fulfill some goals. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans from the State banks and FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with favorable conditions and much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen  tiene la edad de 20 años, está casada y vive con el esposo  y tres hijos  actualmente. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para hacer un gallinero y además comprar pollos de engorde  y el alimento para los  mismos. Ella desea venderlos a los vecinos y en algunos negocios y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Carmen, 20, is married and lives with her husband and three children.  She is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to build a chicken coop and the rest to buy chickens and feed for fattening them for market.  She plans to sell the chickens to neighbors and local shops and says the investment will increase her income.  She hopes to provide her family with greater financial stability and a better quality of life.  She hopes too to grow as a person and as a businesswoman.  This is Carmen's first FUDECOSUR loan.  She has never borrowed from a state-run bank before, but FUDECOSUR combines low interest rates and a straight-forward loan process.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her poultry business.

loans.name: Quyết

texts.en:
Mrs Quyết works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.She is 55 years old and she is married with 3 children.  Mrs Quyết lives with 3 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2003, she joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business and she has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Mrs Quyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain  a successful business, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Tapaauaunoa

texts.en:
Tapaauaunoa is a 46 year old married woman with 6 children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Tapaauaunoa needs a loan to buy mutton, sausages, chicken leg quarters and plastic cups and plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tapaauaunoa has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy mutton, sausages, chicken leg quarters and plastic cups and plates

loans.name: Kevin

texts.es: Kevin tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas  para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia  y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Kevin is 18 years old and single. He lives with his parents and siblings, who are his first priority.

With this loan, he plans to purchase fertilizers and fungicides for coffee plants. He will also buy some copperwood trees to re-sow when the rains begin, in order to increase the density of plants. With these agricultural improvements, he hopes to obtain a little income in order to improve his family's living conditions and achieve some of his goals.

This is the first loan he has received from Fudecosur. He has never had other loans from state banks, but Fudecosur has given him the loan more easily and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee-farming supplies and copperwood trees

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra  tiene la edad de 39 años, está casada y vive con el esposo  y cuatro hijos  actualmente. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de una novilla, ella ya tiene dos y deseas poder aumentarla s  para poder reproducirlas y así poco a poco ir aumentando de animales y con ello en un futuro poder generar ganancias  y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como ganadera. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Mayra, 39, is married and lives with her husband and four children.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a heifer for her cattle business.  She has two heifers now and wants to add more when she can.  The investment will increase her future earnings and provide her family with greater financial stability and a better quality of life.  She hopes too that the loan will help her to grow as a person and as a businesswoman.  This is Mayra's first FUDECOSUR loan.  She has never borrowed from a state-run bank before, but FUDECOSUR combines low interest rates and a straight-forward loan process.

loans.use: to buy a heifer for her livestock business.

loans.name: Berenice Jhoselyn

texts.es:
Berenice tiene 21 años, tiene una hija con el cual vive en la parroquia de San Antonio de Ibarra en casa arrendada desde algunos años; ella vive en un sector de producción de artesanías en la cual la parroquia es reconocida por la elaboración de figuras hechas en madera y las ofrece en diferentes provincias del país así mismo hay personas que se dedican a la elaboración de prendas de vestir y al turismo que hay en la ciudad de Ibarra como la Laguna Yahuarcocha.
Berenice es una joven que desde hace 2 años atrás viene realizando ventas de productos naturales, la actividad que ella realiza ha sido su medio de sustento en el hogar para seguir dando lo mejor a su hija.
Ella es una persona optimista que día a día demuestra dando todas las ganas que hay para que todo le vaya bien.
El crédito que solicito lo va invertir en la compra de más productos y así seguir con el comercio y seguir incrementando más el negocio, por lo que agradece a KIVA por todo el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Berenice is 21 years old, lives with her daughter in the Parroquia de San Antonio de Ibarra in a rented house for some years now.  She lives in an area of ​​craft production.  The parish is known for the preparation of figurines made of wood and available in different provinces of the country.  Likewise, there are people who are dedicated to making garments and to tourism in the city of Ibarra like Laguna Yahuarcocha.

Berenice is a young woman who has been making natural product sales for two years.  The work that she is involved in has been her livelihood, and enables her to continue to provide the best care for her daughter who has had no support from the father. 

She is really optimistic, and she shows a lot of enthusiasm day a day. 

The loan that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more products and thus continue to trade and continue to increase her business, she is really thankful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise and products that she offers

loans.name: Jesús En Ti Confio Group

texts.es:
Carol es una mujer de 37 años de edad, separada madre de 5 hijos de las siguientes edades 16,12,10,8 y 2 años,trabaja en su negocio de imprenta, donde hacen todo tipo de tarjetas,como de invitación,recuerdos,anuarios,empastados y demás. Carol inicio su negocio gracias a su hermana quien le enseño todo acerca de ese rubro,sobre todo hacer los recuerdos que es lo que mas le apasiona,sus principales clientes son los colegios cercanos a su negocio,Carol se siente entusiasmada por el préstamo que ha adquirido y agradece a los inversionistas  Kiva por la ayuda prestada,por que así va a poder implementar mas en su negocio y en el mantenimiento de las maquinas que utiliza, y poder darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que todavía están en el colegio,Carol pertenece al grupo "Jesús en ti confío" la relación con los socios es buena y amena ya que son conocidos de la zona.
Carol se siente comprometida y agradecida por que todavía existen en el mundo gente como los inversionistas Kiva que la ayudan en su negocio y pide que sigan apoyando a mucha gente que lo necesita y hacen bien al prójimo.
texts.en:
Carol is a 37 year old, separated mother of five children who are 16, 12, 10, 8 and 2 years old. She works in the printing business where she makes all types of cards such as invitations; memorabilia; yearbooks; bound items; and other items.  

Carol started her business thanks to her sister who taught her everything about the work, especially the memorabilia that she is the most passionate about. Her main customers are the schools close to her business. 

Carol is excited about the loan that she will acquire and is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help because she is going to be able to invest more in her business and the maintenance of the machines she uses – and be able to give her children that are still in school a better quality of life. 

Carol belongs to the group, “Jesús en Ti Confío” [Jesus, I Trust in You.] Her relationship with the members is good and enjoyable as they are known in the community.  

She feels motivated and grateful because there are still people in the world like Kiva lenders that help her with her business. And, she asks that they continue supporting the people who need it and do good for others.

loans.use: to expand her business and maintain her machines.

loans.name: Victoria Virginia

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer 47 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo varón de 22 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 18 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la urbanización ‘Cafetaleros’ lugar donde el comercio ha prosperado en los últimos años, antiguamente, el comercio se reducía a bares, quioscos  y farmacias; pero ahora incluye bancos, institutos, paradas de taxis, baños públicos, tiendas, ferreterías, y otros. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Victoria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; su hijo trabaja como constructor, las hijas estudian en la escuela y ayudan en el negocio de comida, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; Plato paceño (choclo, habas, papas todas hervidas con queso frito y acompañado con ají), Fricasé paceño (sopa de cerdo con maíz, chuño y ají amarillo), Chairo paceño (sopa de chuño con carne de cordero y trigo), y otros, actividad que realiza de lunes a sábado en un cuarto con salida a la calle en su domicilio; “anteriormente tenía un taller con mi ex pareja, a raíz de nuestra separación me dediqué a la venta de comida…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra sobre una avenida principal donde existe mucho tránsito, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la apertura de otro puesto de comida. La razón para solicitar el préstamo es que ella quiere abrir un puesto de comida para independizar a su hija en el negocio. Su sueño es tener su casa propia, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para abrir otro puesto de comida. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Victoria solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para abrir un puesto de venta de comida para independizar a su hija en el negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 47-year-old woman.  She is single and has one 22-year old son and two daugthers, ages 18 and 16.  Her business is selling traditional food.

She is a good mother, enterprising, understanding, patient, responsible, and hard working.  She carries out her business in the “Cafataleros” residential area, a place where commerce has been prosperous in recent years.  In the past, commerce was limited to bars, kiosks, and pharmacies, but now it includes banks, schools, taxi stops, public restrooms, stores, hardware stores, and others.  It has a cold, dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0° and 12° Celsius.

Victoria has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long dark hair that she wears in a braid, short stature, and a robust build.  She wears traditional dress (hat, shawl, and skirt).  Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and the business that she carries out.  She shares her life with her children.  Her son works in construction.  Her daughters are in school, and they help her in her food business.  They live in a rented house, built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof, that has potable water, electric energy, and a sewage system.  Her business is selling traditional food, such as “plato paceño” (sweetcorn, fava beans, and potatoes, all boiled with fried cheese and accompanied with yellow peppers), “chairo paceño” (a soup of freeze-dried potatoes, lamb meat, and wheat), and others.  She carries out this business from Monday to Saturday in a room of her home that exits onto the street.  “Before, I had a workshop with my ex-partner, but as a result of our separation, I started selling food,” she comments.  The advantage of her business is that it is located on a main avenue where there is a lot of traffic.  The disadvantage is the lack of investment capital to open another food stand.  She is requesting a loan because she wants to open a food stand so her daughter can be independent in the business.  Her dream is to have her own house.  She wants to buy chairs and tables to open another food stand.  This is her first loan cycle with the lending institution during the eight years she has been independently carrying out the business.

For these reasons, Victoria is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to open another food sales stand to make her daughter independent in the business.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to open a food sales stand, to make her daughter independent in the business..

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora CLAUDIA  de 26 años de edad,  tiene 1 hijo  ella tiene el apoyo de su esposo, qué trabaja con la secretaria de seguridad, radica en la ciudad  de Choluteca al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 3  años  al negocio de venta de ropa usada, juguetes y lociones. Ella vende en su casa y también sale a vender de forma ambulante también es amiga de bequi y comparten lugar de ventas.
Claudia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva como blusas, camisas, pantalones, toallas y sandalias, con estos recursos también quiere alquilar un local en el mercado para tener otro punto donde vender sus productos. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella  desea salir adelante con su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos para darle una mejor vida a su hijo.
Claudia su sueño es comprar un local en el mercado para no tener que rentar y con estos fondos invertir más en su local.

Choluteca, Honduras - Abril del 2015.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 26-year old woman who has a son and lives in the city of Choluteca, in the south part of Honduras. She counts on the support of her husband, who works for the Security Secretary, and has worked in the second-hand business for 3 years. She sells clothes, toys and lotions at her house and in the streets. She shares her selling space with her friend Bequi. 

Claudia is requesting a loan to buy new clothes, such as blouses, shirts, pants, towels and sandals. She also wants to rent a space in the market to sell her products. Thanks to this loan, she would be able to get ahead with the business and to improve her income to provide a better life to her son. 

Claudia's dream is to buy a space in the market so that she would not need to pay rent and could invest that money in the store. 

Choluteca, Honduras - April 2015

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, towels and sandals, and to rent a space for her business.

loans.name: Minasmayo De Garavito Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MINASMAYO DE GARAVITO”; Este banco se ubica en el sector de Garavito, distrito de Santa Ana, provincia de La Convención, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Adela ella es soltera y tiene 52 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, cafe, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "MINASMAYO DE GARAVITO" community bank. This bank is located in the Garavito sector, Santa Ana district, La Convención province, in the department of Cusco.

One of the members is Adela. She is 52 years old and has 3 children, and works in her fruit farming business. She has a plot of land where she grows plantains, coffee, tangerines, and oranges. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. With this business, she wants to get her family ahead. She has already had this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her land for farming. She is applying for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

In the attached photo you can see a member that took the photo after the meeting, because he ask for permission for work reasons.

The other members make their living in animal sales, agriculture, a grocery store, and food sales.

The member is grateful to all those who form part of her dream through this loan, and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco se sigue dedicando al negocio de peluqueria,el socio hace cortes de cabellos y tintes,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante.El socio solicita le crédito para comprar tintes y tijeras. (Francisco tiene otra opcion sexual). 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisco continues to work in his hair-cutting business. He cuts and dies hair. He wants to get ahead using this loan. He is requesting the loan to buy dyes and scissors. (Francisco is transgender).
He is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of the installments.

loans.use: to buy dyes and scissors.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 42años, vive en la comunidad de Quichinche de la ciudad de Otavalo, él vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Aprobó la primaria y no pudo seguir estudiando porque sus padres no contaban con recursos económicos.
Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura cultivo de moras la cuales la expende en ferias cercanas y en las guarderías de la comunidad, las moras que el cultiva no necesitan ser fertilizadas con químicos son productos 100 % naturales, es por eso que tiene clientes que van al domicilio hacer compras de moras, además cría amínales como chanchos, pollos, cuyes y con estas actividades puede solventar todas la necesidades de sus hogar.
Luis tiene 4 hijos a los cuales les está dando educación para que no queden en las mismas circunstancias que él, quiere que sus hijos no pasen las mismas necesidades que el paso cuando era niño.
El tuvo la iniciativa del cultivo de moras hace 22 años por que en esos tiempos no había personas que le guíen para un emprendimiento correcto y como se casó la esposa también le dio apoyo para seguir con el proyecto y también le dio más ideas de incrementar con la crianza de animales, en la actualidad tiene media hectárea de siembra de moras. El crédito que solicita en Fundación Alternativa lo va invertir en la compra de plantas de mora para sembrar en el terreno que está listo para la siembra.
texts.en:
Luis is 42 years old, lives in the Quichinche community in the city of Otavalo, and lives with his wife and their 4 children. He graduated primary school and couldn't continue studying because his parents did not have the financial resources. 

Currently he makes his living in agriculture, the farming of blackberries, which he sells in nearby street markets and nurseries of the community. The blackberries that he cultivates don't need to be fertilized with chemicals; they are 100% natural products. Because of this he has customers that go to his home to purchase blackberries. 

In addition, he raises animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs, and with this business covers his home costs. 

Luis has 4 children to whom he is giving an education so that they are not subject to the same circumstances as he was. He doesn't want his children to have the same needs he had when he was a boy. 

He took the initiative to cultivate blackberries 22 years ago because at that time there wasn't anyone to guide him in proper entrepreneurship. As he married his wife she gave him support in continuing his project and also gave him ideas to increase with the raising of animals. 

Currently he has a half hectare for planting blackberries. He will invest the loan he is requesting with Fundacion Alternativa in the purchase of blackberry plants to plant in the land that is ready for seeding.

loans.use: to purchase blackberry plants and plant them on his land

loans.name: Messiah

texts.en:
Messiah is 38 years old. She is a hard-working mother of three. All her children go to school. 

Messiah recently started running her own business. Her business is based in the southern province of Zambia, in a town called Choma. Messiah's business allows people to send and receive money when they need to most. This helps her community since it gives them access to cheaper financial services. A large number of people in Zambia do not have bank accounts. 

Messiah has requested her first Kiva loan, so that she can have the funds to service more people who need to access her financial services. She is hopeful that the increase in her working capital will result in more profits. 

The profits will go towards educating her children and providing for their basic needs.

loans.use: to grow her business by providing the funds needed to serve her customers.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy  tiene la edad  de 38 años, está casado, vive con la esposa  y cuatro hijos   que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia .  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Roy, 38, is married and lives with his wife and four children.  He is applying for a loan, part of which he will use to pay for the labor and supplies he needs for his coffee business and the rest to plant almacigo trees.  Investing in more almacigo trees will increase the vegetation cover on his farm before the coming rains.  The improvements will increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.  This is Roy's first FUDECOSUR loan.  He has never borrowed from a state-run bank before, but FUDECOSUR combines low interest rates and a straight-forward loan process.

loans.use: to pay for labor and supplies for his coffee and almacigo farming business.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: Isaac tiene la edad de 42 años, está casado y vive con la esposa  actualmente. El  crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para hacer un gallinero y además comprar los pollos de engorde  y el alimento. El desea venderlos   en algunos negocios y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Isaac, 42, is married and lives with his wife.  He is applying for a loan, part of which he will use to build a chicken coop and the rest to buy chickens and feed for fattening them for market.  He plans to sell the chickens to local shops.  The investment will increase his income and provide his family with greater financial stability and a better quality of life.  He hopes too that the loan will help him to grow as a person and as a businessman.  This is Isaac's first FUDECOSUR loan.  He has never borrowed from a state-run bank before, but FUDECOSUR combines low interest rates and a straight-forward loan process.

loans.use: to buy chickens for his poultry business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 50 years old and she works selling and distributing dairy products such as yogurt. 

She started selling more than five years ago; she says that she has a mobile food stall that she uses for distribution and sales and also a refrigerator to keep the products fresh. 

She is asking for a loan to buy inventory. Her neighbors describe her as very responsible.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her food stall.

loans.name: Leo's School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! 

Leonard is the director of Leo's Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Nyendo in Masaka with 2,000 students. Leo's School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 liter tank, which is big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Leo's Primary School will repay their loan from school fees, which they collect each term. Leonard hopes that having access to safe drinking water will not only improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases but also increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq, 34, lives with his wife and one child in Ramallah. He is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. He has some experience in electronic maintenance and software.

Tareq has received a 1,930 USD Murabaha loan (a type of credit sale acceptable under Sharia law) from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a special program for software and electronic programming which will enable him to work extra hours and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a special program for software and electronic programming

loans.name: Blanca Aurora

texts.es:
La señora BLANCA AURORA  de 57  años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos que dependen de ella, radica en la comunidad de el jícaro, Nacaome, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace unos 15 años  a la venta de abarrotería como ser: café, huevos, granos básicos, carnes, frescos, ropa  y mas, doña blanca  es una mujer bien trabajadora con muchos deseos de sacar adelante a su familia también en su negocio ella vende ropa nueva y cosméticos.
Doña Blanca está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de más productos como café, huevos, granos básicos, carnes, frescos, ropa  y para su negocio ya que desea surtirlo porque la demanda es bastante fuerte para el mes de Marzo y Abril, está muy contenta por el apoyo de Prisma a su negocio.
Doña Blanca su sueño es tener una buena pulpería bien surtida que sea la mejor de la zona.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2015.
texts.en:
Blanca Aurora, age 57, lives with her two children, who depend on her. She resides in the community of El Jícaro, Nacamoe, a valley in the south of Honduras.  She has her own house, and she was worked for some 15 years in the sales of groceries, such as coffee, eggs, staple grains, meet, soft drinks, clothing, and more.  Blanca is a very hard-working woman, who greatly desires to help her family get ahead.  She also sells new clothing and cosmetics in her business.

Blanca is requesting a loan to buy more products, such as coffee, eggs, staple grains, meat, soft drinks, and clothing for her business.  She wants to stock it up since the demand is very strong during the months of March and April.  She is very happy for Prisma’s support of her business.

Blanca’s dream is to have a good, well-stocked small grocery store that is the best in the zone.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March 2015

loans.use: to buy more products, such as coffee, eggs, staple grains, meat, soft drinks, and clothing, for her business.

loans.name: Justa Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia Justa Beatriz  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas, blusas y pantalones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Justa Beatriz, a member, is still selling clothes. She is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead with the help of this business.

She is requesting a loan to buy coats, blouses and pants.

This loan makes her feel happy. She promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy coats, blouses and pants to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as faithful and openminded. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood. Her business goal is to open another business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: buy more stock of firewood

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.es: Giovanni  tiene la edad de 40 años, está casado y vive con la esposa actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Giovanni is 40 years old, married and living with his wife. He would like this loan so he can buy seedlings to help with a coffee plantation that they wish to start. He wants to cultivate the plantation with the care necessary to increase its yield and so have greater income. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to keep growing as a person and as a producer. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't had other loans from state banks before. However, FUDECOSUR has provided the loan on better terms and at a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco tiene la edad  de 27 años, está divorciado, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Marco, 27, is divorced and lives with his parents, brothers and sisters.  He is applying for a loan, part of which he will use to pay for labor and supplies for his coffee farming business and the rest for planting almacigo trees.
