Almacigo trees are a good investment for coffee farmers because they add needed vegetation for protecting the soil and moderating the climate, important considerations for growing coffee here.  The loan will increase his income and help him to provide for his family.  He also wants to buy more land.  This is Marco's first FUDECOSUR loan.  He has never borrowed from a state-run bank before, but FUDECOSUR combines low interest rates and a straight-forward loan process.

loans.use: to pay for labor and supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Mwihoko Tosheka 11 Widows Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Virginia, a mother of ten children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training on Enterprise Development and Financial Management.

She does mixed farming to earn a living. She is taking out a Kiva loan to buy a calf and fertilizer in order to increase her productivity. She hopes this will increase her income and improve her standard of living.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a calf and fertilizer that will boost farming productivity.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is 36 years old. He owns book shop and he has been in a business for 3 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan, he would like to buy more books for sell and addition to that he is a money agent. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, he wishes to earn at least 150,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more books for sell and addition to that he is a money agent.

loans.name: Rondro

texts.fr:
Rondro est une femme de 35 ans. Elle élève son fils unique avec son mari dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe sur les hauts plateaux malgaches. Elle tient une boutique d’articles de beauté au petit marché de la ville. Elle a commencé cette activité dès l’âge de 20 ans et a donc une solide expérience dans ce domaine. Elle vend aujourd’hui de nombreux articles et offre à sa clientèle un important choix de produits (mercerie, produits de beauté, bijoux fantaisies…).
Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 3 ans et ce nouveau prêt va lui permettre de renouveler son stock de marchandises. Elle compte acheter des produits de maquillage ainsi que des articles de mariage (bouquets, accessoires..).
Grâce aux bénéfices de son activité, elle a déjà réussi à acquérir un terrain. Elle espère pouvoir un jour y construire sa propre maison. En effet, la priorité pour cette maman est de garantir l’avenir de son fils unique, elle souhaite lui apporter les meilleures conditions possibles pour son épanouissement et sa réussite.
texts.en:
Rondro is a 35 year old woman. She is raising her only son with her husband in the urban commune of Antsirabe on the high Malagasy plateaux. She has a boutique with beauty products at the little market in the city. She started this business at the age of 20 and so she has a solid experience in this domain. Today, she sells numerous articles and offers her clientele a significant variety of products (sewing articles, beauty products, costume jewelery...).

She has been a partner of Vahatra for 3 years and this new loan will allow her to renew her supply of merchandise. She plans to buy cosmetic products as well as marriage items (bouquets, accessories...).

Thanks to the profits of her business, she has already succeeded in acquiring land. She hopes to be able to build her own house there one day. Currently, this mother's priority is to guarantee the future of her only son. She wishes to provide him with the best conditions possible for his development and his success.

loans.use: to buy a reserve of beauty products

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Alice, who is married and the mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in June 2014.

Alice does vegetable farming which she supplies to her customers, she also keeps poultry. She is grateful to HiH EA for enterprise training and inculcating in her a culture of saving. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and organic fertilizer. She hopes to capitalize on the upcoming rain season and grow enough vegetables to satisfy her customers demand. Through the income, she will cater for her family needs such as food, medical care and education for her children.

Alice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and organic fertilizer, which will help improve farming.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
El río Zavaleta cruza una comunidad oaxaqueña dedicada al cultivo y procesamiento de caña. Los habitantes frecuentan sus aguas para refrescarse y pasar momentos agradables en familia. 
   En dicha localidad hay amaneceres muy bellos por lo que un grupo de nueve personas decidieron nombrarse así; Sol Naciente. El grupo lo integra: Martha que maneja un tienda de abarrotes; Antonia, una estética; Fidela, un taxi. Alejandra por su parte vende tamales; Emilia, productos naturistas; José, refrescos; Maricela, limones, mientras que Dulce y Paula son criadoras de cerdos.
   Alejandra es una señora amigable que siempre desea aportar lo mejor de sí en el cuidado de la familia. Lleva un feliz matrimonio con Don Telésforo cuyo fruto son cuatro hijos de los cuales ya sólo uno depende de ellos quien con doce años, estudia la secundaria. 
    Ale, como es conocida en la comunidad, vende ricos tamales desde hace tres años. El proceso es arduo pero vale el esfuerzo por el resultado. Desde comprar los ingredientes, hasta preparar la harina y dar forma a cada uno de los tamales es un proceso que dura aproximadamente un día entero; una vez listo el producto sale a vender a las calles de su localidad hasta terminarlo todo. Los clientes están muy satisfechos por su gran sazón y excelente trato.
   En ocasiones, sus clientes le hacen pedidos especiales lo que la hace contenta “He llegado a hacer hasta 1000 tamales de elote, 500 bollitos y 1500 tamales rancheros”. Ahora su esposo sembrará el maíz con lo que ayudará a mejorar sus precios ya que es la materia principal de su actividad. 
   La oportunidad del crédito le servirá para comprar manteca, carne de puerco, pechugas de pollo, chiles y leña. El negocio va muy bien por lo que Alejandra planea a futuro comprar un molino de nixtamal y así mejorar sus ingresos. 
   *La fotografía fue tomada en  casa de doña Emilia, doña Ale es quien tiene en las manos una cubeta azul donde trasporta los tamales.
texts.en:
The Zavaleta River crosses through a Oaxacan community dedicated to the cultivation and processing of sugar cane. The inhabitants frequent its water to cool off and to spend enjoyable time with family.

In that town, there are very beautiful sunrises, which is why a group of nine people decided to name themselves that way: Sol Naciente (Rising Sun).  The group is made up of: Martha, who manages a grocery store; Antonia, a beautician; Fidela, a taxi driver; Alejandra sells tamales; Emilia, natural products; Jose, soft drinks; Maricela, limes; while Dulce and Paula farm pigs. 

Alejandra is a friendly woman who always wants to give the best of herself in taking care of her family. She is in a happy marriage with Telesforo, which has produced four children, of whom only one depends on them: a 12-year-old who is in secondary school. 

Ale, as she is known in her community, has been selling delicious tamales for three years.  The process is arduous, but the result is worth the effort. From buying the ingredients to preparing the flour to giving form to each tamal, it is a process that takes approximately a whole day. Once the product is ready, she goes out to sell in the streets near her place until everything is gone. The customers are very satisfied by the great seasoning and the excellent treatment. 

On occasion, her customers make special orders, which makes her happy. She has made as many as 1,000 corn tamales, 500 dumplings, and 1500 ranch-style tamales.  Now her husband will plant corn with which she can improve her prices, since it is the main ingredient of her business.

The loan opportunity will help her to purchase lard, pork, chicken breasts, chili peppers, and firewood. The business is going really well, which is why Alejandra plans to buy a corn mill in the future.  That way she can improve her revenue.

*The picture was taken in Emilia's home. Ale is the one who has a blue bucket in her hands, where she carries the tamales.

loans.use: to purchase lard, pork, chicken breasts, chili peppers, and firewood.

location.town: Las Maravillas,Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Thắng is a 29-year-old farmer who is married and has one child. He lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. He has been farming for ten years. The main hardship that Thắng’s family faces is not having a hygienic latrine.

This will be Thắng’s first loan with Kiva’s field partner Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. He is requesting a 15,000,000 VND loan to buy sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. Thắng hopes not only to be able to provide for his children and be a successful farmer, but also and especially for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.fr:
Yvonne est une femme courageuse de 37 ans. Abandonnée par son mari, elle a élevée seule sa fille aujourd’hui âgée de 18 ans. Elle tient une boucherie dans le grand marché de la ville sur les hauts plateaux malgaches.
Cela fait 6 ans qu’elle est partenaire chez Vahatra. Ce 11éme prêt va lui permettre d’acheter de nouveaux bœufs et cochons et ainsi de renforcer le capital de l’activité.
Grâce aux bénéfices, Yvonne a pu assurer l’éducation de sa fille qui poursuit aujourd’hui encore ses études. Elle a également déjà démarré la construction de sa propre maison et espère très bientôt pouvoir en achever les finitions.
texts.en:
Yvonne is a brave 37 year old woman. Left by her husband, she raised her daughter alone, now 18 years old. She has a butcher's shop in the large market of the city on the high Malagasy plateaux. 

Yvonne has been a partner at Vahatra for 6 years. This eleventh loan will allow her to buy new oxes and pigs and also to bolster the business' capital. 

Thanks to the profits, Yvonne has been able to ensure the education of her daughter who is still pursuing her studies today. Additionally, she has already begun the construction of her own house and hopes to be able to complete the finishing touches very soon.

loans.use: to buy an ox and some pork.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Thank you so much for your kindness and generosity. Because of the recent PHP 15,000 loan that you lent her, Virginia was able to add more grocery items to sell in her store, thus giving her more chances to earn a profit. This has greatly helped her and her household survive, covering everyday necessities. 

If you would allow, she would like to access a new loan worth PHP 50,000. Ever since, she has wanted to expand her business. And with this amount, she can now start her dream. She will use this to buy more merchandise products to sell in he store. She is truly hoping that you will reach out to her with your helping hands. 

Virginia wishes to succeed in her business so that someday, her children will also have their own businesses where they can have a stable income. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey is a 24-year-old entrepreneur who runs a business in Choma that provides financial services to people in his community. He has been running his service for nine months and is happy with his progress so far. 

Humphrey is requesting a loan to improve his working capital float so that he can service more customers and pay for his trading booth. The business of mobile money is highly dependent on how much money one has in the business, and currently Humphrey only has $700 to serve his customers. This is not enough for him to satisfy the demand and he ends up asking customers to go to the next Zoona trading booth, causing him to lose out on valuable profits.

Humphrey is hopeful that by injecting more working capital in his business, he will be able to serve more customers and earn more profits, profits that will help him to take care of his five-month-old baby. He thanks Kiva for the opportunity to raise capital.

loans.use: To pay for the booth that he currently uses and provide the funds needed for him to serve more customers

loans.name: Intwarane Group

texts.en:
INTWARANE is a group led by Noella, who is 38 years old. The group name means “High Heroes” in English. She is married with four children aged between 8 and 16 years. She sells food stuffs and has been doing in a business for the past seven years. 

The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more Cassava, banana and Irish potatoes for sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more Cassasva,banana and Irish potatoes for sell.

loans.name: Ramarumo

texts.en: Ramarumo is applying for a third loan to support his studies through to his graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the second loan: “Since receiving a Kiva loan my studies have improved and I don't worry about the transport expenses anymore.Thanks to Kiva!

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Lebu

texts.en: Lebu is applying for a third loan to support her studies through to her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving her second loan: “My studies have improved since my first and second loans due to the fact that my fees are been paid for and I am able to come to school everyday without the stress of thinking about it. I am very grateful that I have been given the opportunity to study at the Maharishi Institute and also to get a study loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for one years tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Agée de 41 ans, Adjovi est une femme divorcée qui habite à Adamavo avec un enfant à sa charge. Adjovi est une commerçante de friperies qui vend ses tenues dans son quartier pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Cette activité lui permet d’avoir une bonne épargne pour investir dans la vie éducative de son enfant. Adjovi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Adjovi demande ce crédit pour commander des habits et des slips. Grâce au bénéfice, Adjovi souhaite améliorer ses prestations et bien s’occuper de sa famille
texts.en:
Adjovi is a 41 year old divorced woman, who lives in Adamavo with one child in her care. Adjovi is a second-hand clothing retailer, who sells her clothing in her area to positively satisfy her clients. 

This business allows her to maintain a good savings to invest in the education of her child. Adjovi resupplies three times per month at the market. Adjovi is requesting this loan to order clothing and underwear. 

Thanks to the profit, Adjovi wishes to improve her service and to take good care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 40 articles of clothing and 10 dozen underwear.

loans.name: Swarbala

texts.en:
Swarbala is a 42-year-old woman from Falakata.  She is a mother of three sons.  She is married to Jatin, a 52-year-old farmer.  They live in the small village of Mukul Danga in the district of Alipurduar.  Swarbala is illiterate and can sign her name only, while her husband attended school till grade 4.  Their one son is in B.A.1st Year (Bachelor of Arts) but the others are engaged in working as a mason. 

As Swarbala is a homemaker, her first priority is her children. She works dawn to dusk to fulfill their needs, including food, health, clothing and education.  After managing household work, she assists her husband in agricultural works. They grow different types of crops and sell them in the local market.  To cope with the growing price of essential goods, they need to cultivate more crops to generate more income.  They have decided to cultivate paddy on their farmland as the crop has a high demand in the present market.

In order to purchase paddy seeds, insecticides and pesticides, Swarbala applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). This would help her to grow paddy, which will ultimately help in generating more income.

Swarbala appreciates the help of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: increase his capital and buy a large quantity of cassava root, banana beer, and soap that he'll resell to earn more.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.pt:
Senhora Fernanda tem 47 anos de idade, viúva, mãe de 3 filhos que já não estão na sua responsabilidade, é negociante, vive em casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado vai aplicar para a compra de cimento, varões, chapas, para dar continuidade a construção da casa onde mora visto que ainda está inacabada e em péssimas condições para ser habitada.
No futuro pretende mobilar a casa e construir muro de vedação.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir financiamentos subsequentes para engrandecer os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Fernanda, 47, is a widow. She has three children who are no longer dependent on her, and she runs her own business. She lives in her own home and does not support anyone else.
She will use the financing to buy cement, rebar, and sheet metal to continue the construction on her home, since it remains unfinished and nearly uninhabitable.
In the future she wants to furnish her house and build a wall around it.
Her biggest goal is to pay back this loan promptly so she can secure financing in the future to expand her projects.

loans.use: to buy cement, rebar, and sheet metal to continue the construction on her home.

loans.name: Artur

texts.pt:
O senhor Artur de 36 anos de idade é casado, trabalhador  pai de 4 filhos dos quais 2 são menores  e  2  frequentam o ensino secundário, vive em casa própria.

Pretende com o valor do empréstimo comprar: uma geleira para aumentar os bens na sua casa, e pretendem também fazer o uso da mesma para pequenos negócios para aumentar a renda familiar.

O cliente tem como sonho , concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família e virar um grande empresário para abrir novos postos de emprego aumentar a renda familiar, tem como principais desafios financeiros, tem recorrido ao empréstimo para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Artur is 36 years old and married. He is a worker and has four children, two of whom are in high school and two of whom are not yet of school age. He lives in his own home.
He plans to use this loan to buy a refrigerator for his home. He also intends to use it in his businesses to increase his family's income.
His dream is to finish his home to offer his family a better place to live and become a successful businessman so he can increase his earnings. His main challenges are financial in nature. He needs this loan to overcome his difficulties and achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
La sonrisa amable de José, hace que en sus cinco años de tener su pulpería los clientes se sientan a gusto de llegar a comprar. A sus 46 años de edad ha trabajado en varios lugares que le permitieron ahorrar y montar su propio negocio, que ahora con la ayuda de su esposa, lo han llevado adelante. Este hombre luchador, además de ser comerciante es guarda de seguridad, con el propósito de llevar más ingresos al hogar que puedan sustentar los estudios de su hijo de ocho años de edad, para que este pueda ser un profesional exitoso.
José sueña con crecer y mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, para así seguir ofreciendo cada vez mejor atención. Por esta razón es que primero solicita un préstamo para invertir en su pulpería, comprar arroz, azúcar, caramelos, gaseosas, entre otros productos de alta demanda. Con esto podrá diversificar sus productos y obtener más ganancias para poder ahorrar y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
José's friendly smile makes it so that, in the five years of having his grocery store, his customers feel pleased to come to shop. At 46 years old, he has worked in various places that have permitted him to save up and undertake his own business, which now, with the help of his wife, he has been carrying out. This determined man, in addition to being a businessman, is a security guard with the goal of bringing more income to the household which can support his 8-year-old son's education so that he can be a successful professional. 

José dreams of growing and improving the infrastructure of his business so that in this way he can offer better and better service. For this reason, he first asked for a loan to invest in his grocery store to purchase rice, sugar, sweets, soft drinks and other high-demand products. With this, he will be able to diversify his products and get more income to be able to save and realize his goals.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, sweets, soft drinks and other products.

loans.name: Kaindu

texts.en:
Kaindu is 38 years old. He is married and is the main provider for his family. Kaindu has completed secondary school and college.

He is the owner of his own business and provides Zoona services to his community. Kaindu attributes the success of his business to hard work and determination; he has faced challenges but has worked to overcome them.

Kaindu is requesting a loan in order to increase the funds that he uses to serve customers so that he can better serve his customers and doesn’t have to turn anybody away. This loan would allow Kaindu to create more foot traffic by purchasing some paints so that his shop can become more visible to customers and help him grow his business, while simultaneously providing the community with needed financial services.

loans.use: to provide the funds needed to serve people who need to access financial services in his community, and to purchase some paint for his shop.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Âgée de 32 ans, Afi est une femme mariée et vit à Tokoin avec ses quatre enfants. Pour contribuer aux besoins  quotidiens de la famille, Afi vend de la poudre de Javel dans son quartier afin de trouver son revenu nécessaire. Afi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché local. Afi demande ce crédit pour commander des bidons de poudre de Javel afin de disposer d’un stock nécessaire pour satisfaire ses clients et promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants grâce au bénéfice tiré.
texts.en:
Afi, age 32, is a married mother of four who lives in Tokoin. To help meet the family’s day-to-day needs, Afi earns a living by selling Javel powder around her neighborhood. She stocks up once a month at the local market. 

Afi is seeking this loan to buy cans of Javel powder so that she may have enough to meet customer demand. She will use her profits to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy two cans of Javel powder.

loans.name: Amparo De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Amparo es una mujer trabajadora, entusiasta y soñadora. Tiene más de 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa, perfumes, zapatos, sabanas y gracias a las ganancias de su negocio ha podido apoyar los gastos económicos de su hogar.  Ella se esfuerza a diario para poder ofrecer mejores oportunidades de crecimiento a sus hijos.

Por ello, solicita un crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, perfumes, zapatos, cremas, etc. Que le servirá para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus productos. Amparo  planea iniciar una comidería con las ganancias de sus ventas y continuar ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Amparo is a hard-working, enthusiastic and visionary woman. For the last 4 years she has been selling clothing, perfume, shoes and sheets, and thanks to the earnings of her business has been able to contribute to the household expenses. She does her best each day to be able to offer better growth opportunities to her children. This is why she is requesting a loan in order to buy pants, shirts, underwear, perfumes, shoes, creams, etc., which will help her to offer a greater variety of products. 

Amparo intends to open an eatery with the earnings from her sales, and to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, underwear, perfumes, shoes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: A 41 ans, Célestine est une femme veuve. Avec quatre enfants à sa charge, Célestine vit dans le quartier de Djidjolé. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Célestine vend de la bouillie préparée à l’aide du maïs dans le quartier. Célestine s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Célestine nécessite ce crédit pour acheter quelques sacs de maïs et de sucre afin de préparer sa bouillie et gagner assez de bénéfices pour venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Célestine is a 41-year-old widow with four dependent children.  She lives in the district of Djidjolé. 

Célestine makes a living by selling a maize-based porridge around the neighborhood. She buys ingredients twice a month at the market. 

Célestine needs this loan to buy a few sacks of maize and sugar to prepare the porridge. Her goal is to earn enough to support her children’s academic education

loans.use: to buy a few sacks of maize and sugar

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 26-year-old from a family of four. She first stumbled upon Junior Achievement Kenya in her secondary school, Kenya High, where she was actively involved in the company program and nurtured her entrepreneurial skills.

She has been exposed to the photography industry for six years and has been working with Nairobi's leading studios as head of photography. She also has a wealth of knowledge in both candid and posed photography. After encountering a lot of clients who showed interest in her work, her zeal and desire to venture out on her own grew, and she started her business, in 2013. Lillian’s photography business has been growing steadily after she received a loan from Kiva and managed to buy a laptop to increase her efficiency and productivity. She has worked on projects ranging from weddings, studio photo shoots, model portfolios and property interiors.

In October 2014 she entered into partnership with a like-minded person and opened a studio.With this second loan, Lilian is looking forward to acquiring more equipment to cater for increased outdoor events including weddings and corporate events.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for her studio to increase coverage for outdoor events

loans.name: Hisdayatur

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Hisdayatur, who lives in Pekalongan, a city located in central Java about two hours from Jakarta by plane.

Hisdayatur owns a stall where he sells mobile airtime credits to his community members. He is known as a friendly person, so it is very easy for him to attract customers. He decided to join Ruma, one of Kiva’s field partners, because he wanted to learn more about how to improve his business using technology.

As his business is growing, Hisdayatur is applying for a 7,000,000 IDR loan to use toward providing more mobile payment services to his community. Your loan will be very useful not only to help Hisdayatur improve his business but also to help his community members who need access to such services.

Hisdayatur’s goal is to provide e-commerce service to his community. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: provide more mobile payment services to his community.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old and blessed with 3 children who are all attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

Jane is a mixed farmer and also operates a tailoring shop. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more tailoring clothes for her tailoring shop, hence be able to meet her customers' demands. 

She is grateful to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring clothes for her tailoring shop, hence be able to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is 50 years old and single with 6 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 2 years. Litia has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, paint brushes, rollers, stencils, material and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, paint brushes, rollers, stencils, material and plastic bags

loans.name: Guilhermina

texts.pt:
A senhora Guilhermina é operaria agricola tem 50 anos, mae de 6 filhos dos quais 2 a frequentar o ensino primário e 3 secundário. 
Com o valor do empréstimo diz que vai comprar chapas, barrotes, areia, cimento para dar continuidade a construção de sua casa.
O projecto para o futuro ampliar sua casa para garntir melhor acomodção a sua familia.
O seu maior desafio e a insuficiência de fundos mas diz que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para tal vai pagar pontualmente.
texts.en:
Guilhermina is a farm worker. She's 50 years old and has six children, 2 of whom attend primary school and 3 of whom attend secondary school.
She states that with the amount of the loan she'll purchase metal plates, beams, sand and cement so she can continue building her house.
Her project for the future is to enlarge her house so she can provide a better home for her family.
Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds. However, she states that she'll apply for more loans, and to that end she'll repay this loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase metal plates, beams, sand and cement.

loans.name: Regina

texts.pt:
A senhora Regina é pensionista tem 64 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 08 filhos dos quais 07 já maiores de idade com suas casas, 01 ainda na sua responsabilidade e vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo vai comprar um congelador, cimento, varrões, areia para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projecto para o futuro terminar a obra, mobilar para dar maior conforto a sua família.
Diz que tem como desafios a insuficiencia de fundos  e que ira solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar este plano .
texts.en:
Regina is a pensioner. She's 64 years old and married. She has eight children, seven of whom are already adults and have their own homes, and one is still under her responsibility. She lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase cement, rods, sand, and a freezer so she can continue the construction work.
Her project for the future is to finish the construction work and furnish her house so she can provide more comfort for her family.
She states that her challenge is the lack of funds. She also states that she'll apply for more loans in order to achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, sand, and a freezer.

loans.name: José

texts.pt:
De 28 anos de idade, pai solteiro de 02 filhos menores frequentando ensino primário e vivem com a mãe, sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele na casa que herdou de seus avos maternos já falecidos.
Diz que valor financiado será aplicado na  compra de roupas diversas e  acessórios de vestuario para revender no mercado nacional.
Para o futuro pretende voltar a estudar, casar se oficialmente, construir casa própria, liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora e solicitar mais.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old and single. He has two underage children who attend primary school and live with their mother. He supports a nephew who lives with him in a house that he inherited from his late maternal grandparents.
He states that the amount of the loan will be used to purchase various garments and apparel for re-selling at the national market.
In the future he intends to go back to school, get officially married, and build a house of his own. He'll also repay the loan without delinquency and apply for more.

loans.use: to purchase various garments and apparel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees for this semester

loans.name: Familia R Group

texts.es:
Como la mayoría de los habitantes de una comunidad del Estado de México Don Gregorio y Doña Zenaida se dedican a la cría y engorda de animales de corral, de igual modo al cultivo y cosecha de maíz, habas, frijoles y calabazas. 
   Sin embargo ellos también se dedican a realizar artesanías con resina, este oficio lo aprendió Don Gregorio. De los nueve hijos que tienen, seis se ocupan de tiempo completo a esta actividad familiar, Doña Zenaida comenta orgullosa: “Hijos y nueras ahora forman parte de la actividad económica que algún día inicio mi esposo”. 
   En el taller todos los días se trabaja formando distintas figuras con base en moldes traídos desde la ciudad, de esta manera se crean elefantes, búhos para graduaciones, lapiceros, sólo por mencionar algunas piezas. Cuando la mercancía está lista Don Gregorio y sus hijos viajan a distintas partes de la república para ampliar su mercado, regresan sólo cuando terminar de vender todas las figuras. 
   Lo que motiva a la pareja de Zenaida y Gregorio es poder apoyar a sus hijos en la realización de sus metas ya que de esta manera podrán brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus nietos. 
   Con las ganancias y anteriores préstamos han adquirido herramientas indispensables para su negocio. Esta con vez con la oportunidad que les brinda VisionFund México planean comprar más materia prima para acrecentar su venta y así solventar los gastos de la casa. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio,  Doña Zenaida se encuentra de pie entre Juana y Gregorio*
texts.en:
Like the majority of the inhabitants in a community in Mexico, Gegorio and Zenaida work raising and fattening small animals, and also they grow and harvest corn, broad beans, beans and squash. 

However, they also work making resin crafts, which Gregorio learned how to do. Of the nine children that they have, six work full-time in this family business. Zenaida says proudly, "Sons and daughters-in-laws now are part of this economic activity that one day my husband began."

In the shop every day, they make different figures based on molds brought from the city. In this way, they make elephants, owls for graduation, and pencil holders, just to mention a few. When the merchandise is ready. Gregorio and his children travel to different places of the country to expand their market; they come back only when they have sold all of the figure. 

What motivates Zenaida and Gegorio is to be able to support their children in realizing their dreams since in this way they will be able to offer a better quality of life to their grandchildren. 

With the earnings and the previous loans they have acquired indispensable tools for their business. This time with the opportunity that VisionFund México offers them, they plan to purchase more raw material to increase their sales and in this way cover the household expenses.

*The photo was taken in the municipal garden. Zenaida is standing between Juana and Gregorio.*

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make crafts.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 32 years married with 3 children, living in Kasese Uganda. 

Pascal operates a textile shop for new clothes; he has been in that business for 5 years. He has a dream of having the best model shop of new designer clothes to suit the latest fashions and designs, which customers are demanding. However,he is faced with the challenge of market competition and limited capital.

Pascal wants money to buy ladies trousers, skirts, shoes and many others for selling.
He intends to add in ladies wear that customers are demanding for.

loans.use: to buy ladies trousers, skirts, shoes and many others for selling.

loans.name: S  Eva United Women Group

texts.en:
Robert sells salted fish and has been in business for 10 years. He is married with 3 children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is a member of St Eva United Women Group. 

The group mainly practices farming growing coffee, cotton, maize and others. Robert has a dream of educating his children and learning modern methods of farming. 

Robert requests a loan to buy salted fish for selling for a daily income.

The group was basically for women but after sometime they also included men and could not change the group name.

loans.use: to buy salted fish for selling as a daily income and to help pay for his children's education

loans.name: Sonny

texts.en:
Sonny is 34 years old and married with two children. Sonny works very hard to provide for her family.

Sonny runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Sonny has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, and soft drinks. 

In the future, Sonny would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour and soap for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of paddy (unhulled rice) for resale.

loans.name: Wamunyima

texts.en:
Wamunyima is a mother of four children who are 18, 15, five and two years of age and all in school. Wamunyima runs her own business that provides mobile money transfer services to people in her community. She earns a profit every time a customer goes to her shop and transacts with her. 

Wamunyima currently suffers the challenge of a low working capital float, which means that she does not have enough funds in her business to serve many customers. She has therefore requested a loan to better serve customers who come to her shop.  

Wamunyima is hopeful that once she receives her Kiva loan, she will be able to serve more customers and earn more profits, profits that will go towards taking care of her children.

loans.use: To serve customers who need access to financial services in Sesheke, Zambia

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is 43 years old and married. He lives in Khelvachauri district with his wife and daughter, a student. The family's source of income is agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and nut trees. Roman sells wine and harvests nuts seasonally. 
Roman wants to start a stable business and requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,500 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase a car and will start a taxi business. Roman will be able to generate daily income. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Olova

texts.en:
Olova is 42 years old and married with 7 children.  She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Olova needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. 

Olova will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose

loans.name: Theara

texts.en:
Theara is a 19-year-old single student, and she is from the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting, and is in her second year at a university in the city.

She is fatherless and her mother is a businesswoman at home. Because Theara is short of finances to cover her tuition fees from the second to the fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully.

Her dream is to have a proper job in an institution with a decent salary, so that she will be able to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to cover her tuition fees from the second to the fourth year

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 27 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He has no children. For the past three years, Jimmy has been working hard to manage his stationary shop. 

To help expand his business, Jimmy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stationary items and will help Jimmy to generate greater profits and increase his standard of living. Jimmy hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stationary items

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 29 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has 0 children. 

For the past four years, Paul has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells drinks. 

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase his stock of drinks. This will help Paul to generate greater profits and construct a residential house. 

Paul hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to increase his stock of drinks

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 37 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Isaac has been working hard to manage his stationary shop. 

To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stationary items, and will help Isaac to generate greater profits and increase his standard of living. Isaac hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stationary items

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 30 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He has no children. For the past 10 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy juice, sugar, bread, sodas, detergent, and water, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and add capital to the business. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his stock.

loans.use: to buy juice, sugar, bread, sodas, detergent, and water.

loans.name: Yousra Group
loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics and make-up.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella posee una panadería donde elabora pan francés y pan dulce, tiene 7 años de tener el negocio en el cual su esposo le ayuda, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere remodelar el lugar donde tiene la panadería pero como no tiene de suficiente capital esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra y asi pode tener un mejor lugar para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and three children. She has a bakery where she makes french bread as well as sweet bread. She has had this business for the past 7 years, and her husband helps her with it. With the sales that she makes, she is able to cover some household expenses. 

She wishes to remodel the local where she has her bakery. Since she does not have enough capital, she is requesting a loan to buy brick, cement, sand, and iron and to pay laborers in order to have an improved local so that she can serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, and iron and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Nueva Creación Group

texts.es:
En el Estado de México aún existen comunidades que mantienen sus raíces culturales, una en especial de origen mazahua se dedica a elaborar artesanías y ropa tradicional tejida. Dentro de esta comunidad se formó el grupo Nueva Creación que tiene la meta de crecer económicamente. Los cuatro integrantes son: Jesús y Eligio quienes quieren invertir en la renta de madera, Elizabet que se dedica a crear artesanías, y Reginaldo que maneja un taxi en la comunidad.
   Don Reginaldo es un hombre totalmente alegre y dedicado tanto a su trabajo como a su familia. Está casado con Doña Esperanza y mantienen su matrimonio desde hace cuarenta y tres años, tienen tres hijos que ya son independientes. Reginaldo ha dedicado su vida al mundo del automóvil, en un inicio como vendedor de autopartes y posteriormente como chofer de taxi. Con las ganancias que obtuvo siendo empleado del taxi pudo ahorrar y desde hace cuatro años el taxi que maneja en completamente suyo.
   La jornada de Don Reginaldo es de domingo a domingo de seis de la mañana y hasta las ocho de la noche, y aunque parezca ser complicada él comenta: “Me gusta tener mi propio negocio pero más que nada conducir mi propio taxi para trabajar”.
   Con la oportunidad del préstamo podrá comprar llantas nuevas y además le dará mantenimiento a su vehículo con el objetivo de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, su meta a futuro es poder comprar otro taxi. 
*En la imagen aparecen los integrantes del grupo Nueva Creación junto al taxi de Don Reginaldo, a un lado de la iglesia municipal*
texts.en:
In the state of México, there are still some communities that maintain their cultural roots, one in particular of Mazahua origin works to make crafts and traditional woven clothing. Within this community, the group Nueva Creación was formed, which has the goal to grow economically. The four members are Jesún y Eligio who want to invest in timber rent, Elizabet who works making crafts, and Reginaldo who drives a taxi in the community.

Reginaldo is a man who is completely happy and is as dedicated to his work as he is to his family. He is married to Esperanza and they have been married for forty-three years; they have three children who are now independent. Reginaldo has dedicated his life to the world of the automobile, at first selling car parts and later as a taxi driver. With the earnings that he got as a taxi employee he could save up and four years ago the taxi that he drives became completely his own.

Reginaldo's work schedule is from Sunday to Sunday from six in the morning to eight at night and, although it seems difficult, he says "I like to have my own business but above all to drive my own taxi as my job."

With the opportunity of the loan, he will be able to purchase new tires and in addition, to do some maintenance on his vehicle with the objective of offering better customer service. His goal for the future is to be able to purchase another taxi. 

*The members of the Nueva Creación group appear in the photo with Reginaldo's taxi next to the municipal church.*

loans.use: to purchase tires and do some maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Atenidora

texts.en:
Atenidora has mastered her skills in making bread. She has her own unique bread recipe and she is known of her homemade sweet bread for which she sells around her neighborhood. This has kept her business going for more than 5 years now. 

Recently, Atenidora requested a loan to buy more kilos of flour, sugar and margarine for bread production. Atenidora hopes to expand her business by displaying in more store outlets.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita faces considerable preparation for the post-harvest operations of her palay (rice) farm in Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. 

She presented her loan proposal to Paglaum MPC. Merlita hopes to see all her grand children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post rice harvest operations and to pay for her grand children's higher education

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 50 years old, married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Sonia has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from a fish pond and farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase flour and palm oil

loans.name: Augstine

texts.en:
Augstine is a 47-year-old married man with seven children. He used the previous loan to buy second-hand shoes to sell. He lives in Kasese, Uganda.

He has maintained a second-hand shoe business since 2012. He also does farming to supplement his income. Augstine has a dream of expanding his business. However, limited capital and high transport costs to different markets are challenges hindering his business growth.

Augstine will use the loan to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his banana plantation by mulching it.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single mother of one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her (major) monthly expense is food. 

Alice has operated a secondhand clothing business at the market and for the local community women. She mentioned transportation as her major challenge in her place of operation. With the loan of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rose operates a grocery and vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy G-nut to cultivate on the farm

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Akpéné est une femme mariée âgée de 36 ans qui vit à Mayakopé avec ses trois enfants. Pour contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille, Akpéné vend de la bouillie qu’elle prépare à l’aide du sorgho et du blé dans son quartier. Akpéné s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès des fournisseurs du quartier pour disposer en permanence ses ingrédients. Pour acheter des bols de sorgho et de farine de blé, Akpéné demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et développer favorablement son activité pour avoir plus de rentabilité.
texts.en:
Akpéné is a married woman aged 36 who lives in Mayakopé with her three children. In order to contribute to the well-being of her family, Akpéné sells porridge that she prepares with sorghum and wheat flour in her neighborhood. 

Akpéné stocks up once a month from the suppliers in her area so that she always has the necessary ingredients. In order to buy some bowlfuls of sorghum and wheat flour,  Akpéné is requesting this loan to cover her purchase and develop her activity so that it brings in more profit.

loans.use: to buy 22 bowls of sorghum and 10 bowls of wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell to customers

loans.name: Odete

texts.pt:
De 33 anos de idade, mãe solteira de 1 filha a frequentar o ensino, primário sustenta a sua mae que vive com ela na casa própria.

Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar chapas de zinco, barrotes, aros, cimento para reabilitar o seu estabelecimento ( salao de cabeleireiro) na sua casa.

Projectos para o futuro crescer no seu negocio, empregar duas pessoas para ajudarem no salao ,e futuramente ter uma boutique respondendo as necessidades de seus clientes.

A insuficiência de fundos e doenças são os desafios que tem enfrentado no dia dia, 
diz que ira solicitar mais empréstimos e para tal compromete se a pagar pontualmente conforme o contrato.
texts.en:
Odete is 33 years old and the single mother of a daughter who is in primary school. She supports her mother who lives with her in a house that she owns.

With the amount of the loan she'll purchase zinc plates, beams, frames and cement in order to repair her place of business (beauty salon) located at her house.

Her projects for the future are to make her business grow, hire two people to help in the salon, and later on set up a store so she can meet her customers' needs.

Lack of funds and illness are the challenges she's been facing on a daily basis.
She states that she'll apply for more loans, and to that end she pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion and in accordance with the contract.

loans.use: to purchase zinc plates, beams, frames and cement.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past nine years, Charles has been working hard to manage his bar & lodges business. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beer and soda, and will help Charles to generate greater profits and increase his capital. Charles hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy food items and bedding for the lodge

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sofa set, cement and sand.

loans.name: Rose...

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her late 30's, is married with three children, who are still at school.  She has been a food vendor for two years now.  She works from 6am to 1pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Rose's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep increasing her food stocks and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is doing great with the loan, working for just a few hours but can manage to get a good profit.  

She appreciates Kiva for the support she has received. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment, bought a plot of land, started building her house, and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to replace the out of stock items in the food stock.  She dreams to finish building her house.

Rose will make sure she pays back the loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to replace the out of stock items for sale at her stall.

loans.name: Bugambilia Group

texts.es:
La venta de artículos para limpieza es una de las actividades que más se realizan en una comunidad del Estado de México. Los vendedores salen de su plácida localidad mazahua hacia otros Estados de la Republica para obtener mejores ingresos. 
   El grupo Bugambilia está formado por seis mujeres entusiastas y alegres que se dedican a vender distintos productos: Doña Laura vende vasos para licuadora; Felisa y Florina, artículos de fantasía y bisutería. Mientras que María Lourdes, Araceli y Alicia venden jarcieria. 
   Doña Florina es una mujer dedicada completamente a su familia y trabajo. Tiene cinco hijos, dos de ellos aún dependen de ella y de su esposo Javier con quien lleva veintitrés años de matrimonio. 
  Hoy Doña Florina cuenta con un puesto establecido dentro de su comunidad en donde ofrece los productos y adornos de fantasía; lo que más vende son moños y bolitas para cabello, barniz, limas y corta uñas. Ella recuerda que no siempre fue así ya que en un principio sólo vendía bolitas para cabello, las cuales ofrecía entre los dedos de sus manos y de manera ambulante.
  Está interesada en expandir su negocio por ello siempre invierte las ganancias en más mercancía. Con la oportunidad del préstamo podría mejorar su negocio y con esto la calidad de vida de su familia. 
   Agradece a VisionFund pues comenta que “Realmente es un gran apoyo para mi negocio porque poco a poco crece y esto ayuda a lograr que mis hijos tengan una carrera profesional”.
 Los integrantes del grupo son Laura  quien invertirá vasos de licuadora, Maria de Lourdes, Araceli y Alicia, en productos de limpieza y Felisa, en productos de fantasía. 
  
*En la fotografía aparecen en las integrantes en el reloj principal del municipio, Doña Florina es quien tiene el suéter color rosa*
texts.en:
The sale of cleaning products is one of the activities that is done the most in one community in the state of México. The salespeople leave from their peaceful Mazahua locality to go to other states of the republic to get more income.

The Bugambilia group is made up of six enthusiastic and happy women who work selling various products: Laura sells blender glasses, Felisa and Florina sell novelties and costume jewelry while María Lourdes, Araceli and Alecia sell cleaning products.

Florina is a woman completely dedicated to her family and work. She has five children, two of them still dependent on her and her husband Javier to whom she has been married for twenty-three years.

Today, Florina has an established stand within her community where she offers the products and novelties. The products she sells the most are bows and hair ties with beads, nail polish, nail files and nail clippers. She remembers that it wasn't always this way because at first she only sold hair ties with beads, which she held on her fingers and sold as a street vendor.  

She is interested in expanding her business, so she always invests the earnings in more merchandise. With the opportunity of the loan, she will be able to improve her business and, with this, her family's quality of life. 

She is grateful to VisionFund because she says "Really, it is a great help for my business because little by little I grew and this is helping to make it possible for my children to have professional degrees."

The members of the group are Laura who will invest in blender glasses, María Lourdes, Araceli and Alecia in cleaning products, and Felisa in novelties.

*In the photo, the members are by the main municipal clock. Florina is the one who has a pink sweater.*

loans.use: to purchase cloths, kitchen rags, spoons, etc.

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec,San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Daina has been working hard to manage her bar.  

To help expand her business, Daina has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beer and soda, and will help Diana to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Diana hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy beer and soda

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 20-year-old single man from Rafah city. His father father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. 

Kamal is a student in the university where he studies accounting. He wants to complete his study and find a job in the future to help his family with part of their expenses.

Kamal took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will him to buy a new laptop for his study. by taking this loan, Kamal will be able to do his home work and write the reports easily.   Kamal appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university education in accounting

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Sharon works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling purified water. Sharon is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell for her herbal medicine business.

Sharon has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 39 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Judy works very hard to provide for them.

Judy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Judy has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drink, nooldes, spices and other groceries. 

In the future Judy would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Chinnie

texts.en:
Chinnie is 38 years old and is married with five children. Two of her children are sent to school.

Chinnie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her store.

Chinnie has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and raising livestock.

Chinnie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a married man with three kids who are currently in school. He runs a small business in the informal settlements of Nairobi. The hardships of life have enabled him to venture into different businesses trying to make ends meet. In the process of daily hassles he stumbled upon a Fresh Life toilet and really tried to understand how it works. 

He decided to venture into the franchise and thought that having one toilet for a start could help him understand more of the franchise and later he would add another one in a different area. He plans to use the proceeds from the toilet to pay for the loan and educate his kids.

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Moonlight

texts.en: Moonlight, who lives in Wamala in the outskirts of the city, is a single mother of two children who are both in school. She sells used clothing to support herself and children as the sole breadwinner.She at times gets challenged by limited income but thanks UGAFODE for providing financial solutions. She has applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to pay for bales of clothing to sell to increase her income. She plans to repay her loan on time if given the financial boost. Moonllight is hard working and honest.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothing to sell

loans.name: Los Arbolitos Group

texts.es:
El Estado de México es uno de las entidades con mayor riqueza cultural indígena, en una localidad en específico se mantienen los usos y costumbres mazahuas, la lengua también es común entre sus habitantes, que la consideran un rasgo distintivo. 
   En dicha comunidad se integró el grupo Los Arbolitos cuyos integrantes son Magdalena dedicada a la venta de cosméticos; Doña Ángela, bordados. Por su parte Doña Julia se dedica a la cría y venta de aves de corral y Maximino maneja una tienda de abarrotes. 
   Claro ejemplo de la conservación de tradiciones indígenas es Doña Julia quien habla completamente la lengua mazahua, si bien se le dificulta dominar el idioma español esto no le ha impedido salir adelante gracias a su trabajo. Está casada con Cesario y juntos han mantenido a su familia desde hace dieciocho años, seis de sus diez hijos aún viven con ellos y dos continúan con sus estudios. 
   Con la finalidad de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, Doña Julia decidió iniciar con la actividad de la cría de aves de corral. Los pollos, gallinas y pavos que cría los consigue desde muy pequeños y cuida de ellos con gran dedicación para poder venderlos en un lapso menor de tiempo. “He llegado a tener entre treinta y cincuenta pollos y hasta veinticinco pavos, esto me ha servido para solventar los gastos de mis familia, además para el consumo propio” comenta con entusiasmo Doña Julia. Ahora con su préstamo comprara mas pollos, alimento y algunos metros de malla.
   En un inicio no contaba con un lugar adecuado para mantener a todas las aves, actualmente tiene un lugar totalmente acondicionado para llevar de manera óptima su actividad. Que sus hijos tengan un futuro prometedor es el sueño de Doña Julia y para lo cual trabaja todos los días. 
 Don Maximino invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes, Angela en sus bordados y Doña Magdalena en sus productos de belleza.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de Don Maximino, Doña Julia es quien tiene la bolsa en su mano*
texts.en:
The state of México is one of the entities with the greatest richness of indigenous culture. In one place in particular they maintain the Mazahua traditions; the language is also common among the inhabitants which they consider to be a distinctive characteristic. 

In this community, the group Los Arbolitos was formed, whose members are Magdalena who works selling cosmetics and Ángela, embroidery. For their part, Julia works raising and selling poultry and Maximino runs a grocery store. 

A clear example of the conservation of indigenous traditions is Julia who speaks the Mazahua language completely, it was difficult for her to master the Spanish language but this has not prevented her from getting ahead thanks to her work. She is married to Cesario and together they have supported their family for eighteen years. Six of their ten children still live with them and two are continuing their education. 

With the end of supporting her husband with the household expenses, Julia decided to undertake raising poultry. She gets the chicks, hens, and turkeys that she raises when they are very small and she cares for them with great dedication to be able to sell them in the shortest amount of time. "I have come to have between thirty and fifty chickens and up to twenty-five turkeys. This has served to pay some of my family's expenses, in addition to providing food for them," says Julia enthusiastically. Now, with her loan, she will purchase more chickens, feed, and some meters of mesh. 
  
At the beginning, she didn't have an appropriate place to keep all the birds. Currently, she has a place completely fit for carrying out her business in the optimal way. That her children have a promising future is Julia's dream and for which she works every day. 

Maximino will invest in his grocery store, Ángela in her embroidery, and Magdalena in her beauty products. 

*The photo was taken at Maximino's store. Julia is the one who has a bag in her hand.*

loans.use: to purchase more chickens, feed, and some meters of mesh.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old, married and has three children to provide for. She helps her husband with his living and she is engaged in coconut production. Her nature of business is to sell coconuts in the market and also make charcoal out from the coconut shells. She also supply coconuts to vendors, who make coconut juice and also cater to restaurants.

It is a good business for the family because it helps them a lot with their finances. She has many orders for coconuts and to cater for them all, she needs financial assistance to pay the labor cost for harvesting the coconut.  That is why she taken a loan again amounting to P 5,000.00

Vilma plan for the future to buy a 4 wheel vehicle to deliver her coconuts to her customers.

loans.use: To pay the labor costs for the coconut harvest, in order to support her family

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Her name is Emelyn, 54, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Bienvenido, a driver and they have three children of which two are still students and the other one is already married. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her children to school. 

Emelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 25000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, sodas and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Emelyn hopes to maintain and grow her grocery store to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell, for the benefit of her family

loans.name: Susima

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Susima works hard to support her family.

She has a poultry raising business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Susima is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her checks.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Susima has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her chicks

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monica is a married lady and a mother of three. She operates a hardware business near her plots. She is a landlady and recently her plot toilet was demolished because it was in the road reserve. 

She now seeks a loan to install a fresh Life Toilet within the precincts of her plot.
She prefers the Fresh Life Toilet because of the hygiene and standards that it comes with and the after sale service that the Fresh Life Staff offers to the franchisees.  She will use the rental to pay for the loan.

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a construction worker from the town of Gyumri. He has been involved in that business for many years. Armen lives with his wife, and elder son, Hovhannes. Armen's second son works as a migrant worker and works hard to help his family financially. 
Armen is very professional in his work and works day and night to sustain his family's living. He has applied for this loan to purchase construction tools needed for providing construction services. The tools which he uses are old and not efficient for the work. 
He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for construction tools needed to provide construction services.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a married man with six kids. He runs a transport (boda boda) business.

He once used a Fresh Life toilet and developed some interest in installing one near his residential area. He seeks a loan to finance the toilet.

The toilet would generate a substantial amount of income which will enable him pay for the loan comfortably. The balance will be used to pay for his children education.

He says the toilet will bring hygiene and eliminate the 'flying toilets' in his area.

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the stock in his grocery business and serve more people.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 54 years old and married with one child. She has earned a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines for the past 34 years. Lydia earns additional income from operating a general store and raising livestock.

Lydia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her farm. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Adriana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Adriana es una mujer de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad, entregada a su trabajo. Ella decidió emprender un negocio de venta de ropa, para sacar adelante a  su familia. Antes ya había recurrido a Kiva y MiCrédito, con quienes está muy agradecida, porque gracias a este primer préstamo, logró aumentar su inventario de productos y obtener más, clientes lo que hizo que su negocio creciera notablemente. 
En estos momentos, ella cree de vital importancia para su negocio, invertir en más mercadería, como camisetas, pantalones, ropa interior, entre otros, es por eso que ella ha solicitado nuevamente la ayuda de Kiva y MiCrédito, mediante un préstamo que le permita comprar una variedad de productos. En un  futuro ella se ve teniendo más que de una tienda y espera ofrecer sus productos en distintos mercados.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 44-year-old woman who is dedicated to her work. She decided to establish a clothing sale business in order to move her family forward. She previously obtained a loan from Kiva and MiCredito, and she is very thankful. As a result of this first loan, she was able to increase her product inventory and attract more customers, which helped her business expand significantly.

At the moment, she believes that investing in more merchandise such as shirts, pants, and underwear, among other things, is of vital importance for her business. For this reason, she is requesting help through a loan from Kiva and MiCredito once again, which will allow her to buy an assortment of products. In the future, she hopes to have more than one store, offering her products in different marketplaces.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, and underwear, among other things.

loans.name: Yudi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet Yudi, one of Ruma's agents. Yudi lives in Lumajang, a regency located in East Java, about 19 hours' drive from Jakarta. He lives there with his wife and his two children (one daughter and one son). Yudi owns a stall that sells mobile phone air-time credit and stationery to members of his community. He learnt about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. Yudi decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn more about how to improve his business using technology. His community sees Yudi as a friendly person: that’s why it’s really easy for him to attract customers.
 
As the business is growing, Yudi is hoping to take out a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to purchase additional prepaid mobile phone air-time credit thus providing more mobile payment services to members of his community so they can call their loved ones. Your loan will be very important and useful in helping Yudi to improve both his business and his community which needs access to such services. Yudi’s goal in the near future through Ruma is to provide an e-commerce service for his community. Yudi is shown sitting in the photo. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid mobile phone air-time credit to sell to community members

loans.name: Mumen

texts.en:
Mumen is a 21-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. Mumen works in transferring goods using his rickshaw. It is a good business and provides a good income to support his family.

Mumen is taking out a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy goods from wholesalers and resell them to local traders. By taking out this loan, Mumen will be able to increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions.

Mumen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy goods from wholesalers and resell them to local traders

loans.name: Racha

texts.en:
Racha, aged 23, is a Lebanese married woman living with her husband. After facing difficult circumstances with her husband being the main income provider in the family, she started to work at her home as a beautician and hairdresser. Racha is a talented person and a hard worker who is always trying her best to please her customers. 

Racha is now requesting a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to buy hairdressing tools in order to expand and develop her work.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing tools

loans.name: Vui

texts.en:
Mr. Vui works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Vui is 21 years old and he is married with two children.
He lives in Hoang Hoa, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Vui's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Vui faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Vui hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for his kids.
