loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en: Khoder is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children who are still attending school. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2001. He is very experienced and has been able to build a good business reputation over the years because of his proficiency. Today, Khoder is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay for his children’s educational fees. He states that this loan will help him secure a good education for his children.

loans.use: to pay his children’s educational fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, aged 39, is married and has two children who are in school. She has been in the agricultural business for 19 years, farming crops of root vegetables in the Philippines.

Maria has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Domingo  Bonifacio

texts.es: Domingo de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de sorbetes desde hace mas de 10 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cajas de sorbetes, paletas, conos, chocolate, etc. y así poder seguir con sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Domingo, 56, lives in his own home with his wife and his three children.

He has earned a living selling sorbet for more than 10 years.  His business is located in his home and he has a lot of customers.

Domingo's requesting a loan to buy boxes of sorbet, ice pops, cones, chocolate, and so on.  That way he can continue to make sales, earn more income, and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy boxes of sorbet, ice pops, cones, chocolate, etc.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Don luis de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, anteriormente tenia un taller de artesanías pero con los meses su negocio fue creciendo y hoy posee una taller de estructuras metálicas donde elabora balcones, puertas, canales y adornes de metales, tiene mas de 6 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales como todo tipo de láminas, tortillos, clavos, hierro, etc. todo por mayor y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is 58 years old and lives in his own house with his spouse. In the past, he had a craftwork shop, but over the months, his business grew and today he has a metal workshop where he makes balconies, doors, gutters, and metal adornments.

He has done this for a living for more than 6 years. Through his sales, he earns enough to cover some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy materials such as various types of sheet metal, screws, nails, iron, etc. wholesale. This way he can continue in his work, in order to earn a better income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, screws, nails, iron, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is from Sindangan, Philippines and is 33 years old. She and her husband have three children. She joined Paglaum MPC in 2012, and appreciates the co-op's programs and services. For a living, she runs a grocery store, enabling her to support her family's needs in addition to her husband's income. This source of income has existed for 4 years now. To be even more productive, Nenita plans to expand her resources and business. Nenita needed additional working capital for this expansion, and requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in an amount of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). The loan will be used to purchase more stock of assorted grocery items, vegetables, and dried fish for resale, and pay for light materials to expand the business space. Through this purchase, she hopes to increase her income so she is able to provide for her family's daily needs. In the future, she hopes to provide  a decent house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of assorted grocery items, vegetables, and dried fish for resale, and pay for light materials to expand the business space.

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su compañera de vida, el clientes se dedica a la venta de lácteos y su esposa vende tortilla, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante,  el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro en ele lugar que muestra la fotografía pero como no tiene de suficiente capital esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de arena, cemento, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra asi el su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 54 years old and lives in his own home with his mother and his life partner.

He makes a living selling dairy products, and his wife sells tortillas. With the money they earn, they are able to keep moving forward.

He wants to improve his house by constructing a wall in the location shown in the photo. Since he doesn't have enough capital, he is requesting a loan to buy sand, cement, bricks, and iron, and to pay for labor, so that he and his family can live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, brick, and iron, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlinda is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Merlinda has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy reusable bottles.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 24-year-old single man. Three years ago, he decided to start a business in the field he loves; thus, he started raising and training dogs, and then selling them. Rami believes that dogs are good friends for humans, and they have the right to be trained in a professional way, as he is always keen to sell them to friendly owners.

Today, Rami is acquiring a Youth loan to buy special dogs from different breeds to train and then sell to friendly owners or families.

Rami hopes to expand his business more in the future to stay capable of taking care of dogs and providing them with suitable homes.

loans.use: to buy special dogs from different breeds to train and then sell to friendly owners or families.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build rickshaws.

loans.name: Hermelita

texts.en:
This is Hermelita, 37, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Perfecto, a payroll master, and has two children. One is in high school, and the other one is in elementary school. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their daily expenses.

Hermelita buys and sells various gadgets such as cell phones, tablets and laptops, which she buys from wholesalers and sells in her community.  Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy the latest models and styles of cell phones, laptops and tablets to expand her product inventory. This will definitely boost her earnings as she expands her business.
 
Hermelita hopes to rent a stall in their town's commercial area. She prays that God will prosper her business to meet her family's growing needs. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for various gadgets such as cell phones, tablets and lap tops to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: sugar, beans, rice, eggs, sweet bread, coffee, milk, candy, soap, and salt in order to improve his sales.

loans.name: Jose  Orlando

texts.es: Don Jose de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, tomate y pepino, tiene mas de 30 años de dedicarse a cultivar la tierra, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder tener una mejor cosecha y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
48-year-old Jose lives in his own house with his life companion and his two children. 

He makes a living growing corn, beans, tomatoes, and cucumbers. He has made a living farming the earth for more than 30 years. He sells his products in the areas nearby.

He is requesting a loan to purchase manure and fertilizers, and to improve the land that he is showing in the photo. In this way, he can have a better harvest and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers and improve the soil

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a buy and sell of dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Guguli

texts.en: Guguli, 59 years old, is from Khelvachauri district. Guguli is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has family-owned agricultural land where she grows fruit to sell. As the income is only seasonal, she decided to start a stable business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,100 GEL. With the received credit, she will open a car wash, as there is high demand for this service. She will rent it out and will have a stable monthly income. The Start Up program will significantly improve the income for Guguli.

loans.use: to open a car wash

loans.name: Adelante Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Nataly  tiene 30  años de edad es  soltera con dos hijos dependientes. Ella posee una bodega en su domicilio hace varios años.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más productos como arroz azúcar aceite menestras.  Ella participa en el grupo “ADELANTE COCACHACRA”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Nataly es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Nataly is 30 years old, single, and has two dependent children. She has had a grocery store in her residence for many years. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more products such as rice, sugar, oil and legumes. 

She participates in the "Adelante Cocachacra" ["Cocachacra Forward"] group. The group thanks KIVA investors for offering the loan. Nataly is the first on the left side.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar, oil and legumes.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is 47 years old, married and has four children. To earn a living, she is engaged in banana farming and able to help her husband. Her business is having a banana farm and selling the bananas to the market to earn an income. She aims for a better income and to have more bananas to sell during the harvest. She decided to avail a loan to buy fertilizer for the banana plants and to have a good result during the banana harvest.

Cherryl's plan for the future is to save money from her business to sustain the needs of her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the banana plants.

loans.name: Mario Isabel

texts.es:
Mario Isabel es un pequeño productor de café de la zona Norte de Nicaragua. Cuenta con un préstamo actualmente, con el que ha logrado incrementar su área de café de 3.5 a 4.2 hectáreas, proyectando cancelar este crédito en el plazo establecido. 

En el último año, su producción aumentó en un 30%, lo cual es parte de la visión que se ha propuesto, siendo su meta para este año, continuar incrementando los rendimientos productivos de su plantación de café, mediante procesos de recepo y un adecuado manejo de nutrición. Para ello, está solicitando otro financiamiento para la adquisición de insumos agrícolas que le permita asegurar la nutrición de sus plantas.

Mario Isabel, está seguro que con las inversiones que está realizando, contribuirá a mejorar los ingresos de su finca y con ello la estabilidad económica de su familia. Anímate a apoyar a este visionario productor, en el logro de sus metas.
texts.en:
Mario Isabel is a small coffee producer in the north of Nicaragua.  He currently has a loan, with which he has been able to increase his coffee area from 3.5 to 4.2 hectares.  He projects repaying the loan by the established deadline.

His production increased 30 percent in the last year, which is part of his vision for himself.  His goal for this year is to keep on increasing his coffee farm's production capacity through pruning and appropriate nutritional management.
 
To achieve that, he's requesting another loan to acquire agricultural inputs that will allow him to ensure good nutrition for his plants.

Mario Isabel is sure that with these investments he'll be able to improve the income from his farm and, as a result, his family's economic stability.  Support this visionary grower so he can achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for his coffee farm and to have a good harvest

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 22-year-old single man from Khanyounis city. He has a store for selling mobile phones, which has been open for the past year. Sami would like to improve his business and expand it.
 
Sami took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will him to buy a new laptop to transfer mobile credit units. By taking this loan, Sami will be able to improve his business and expand it. 

Sami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to sell mobile airtime credit units

loans.name: Rosida

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Rosida. Rosida lives in Lumajang, a city located in East Java, about a 19-hour drive from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her three children. Rosida owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income so they can save more money for their children’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. 

As the business grows, Rosida needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Rosida’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community using Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Rosida is the one who is smiling. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in threads of all colors to make cloth in his workshop.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 15 años vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has been selling clothing for 15 years as a street vendor in the different subdivisions that are near her home. With the income she receives she is able to pay some of the household expenses. She is seeking a loan to buy clothing at wholesale and in this way be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de frutas el cual inicio con capital propio tiene 15 años de dedicarse a las ventas con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más frutas por mayor para continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Fidel lives in his own home with his two children. He sells fruit, a business he began with his own capital 15 years ago. With the income he receives he is able to get ahead. He seeks a loan to buy more fruit at wholesale to continue his sales as this is his only source of income and in this way be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca es viuda vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de medicina popular desde hace 15 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de su producto, gracias a sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina popular por mayor ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos y asi podrá seguirle dando a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Blanca is a widow and lives in her own home with her son. She has been selling popular medicines for 15 years. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers for the quality of her product. Thanks to her sales she is able to get ahead. She is seeking a loan to buy more popular medicine at wholesale as this is her only source of income and in this way she will be able to continue giving her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more popular medicine at wholesale.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada is a 50 year old married Lebanese woman living only with her husband. Four years ago, in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own work as a farmer. She cooperates with her husband who works as a sanitary worker to fulfill their family needs. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase agricultural tools. She states that the loan will surely help her to increase her business productivity by a fair percentage which will give her higher profits. Ghada is eager to borrow this loan from Kiva to improve her work.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural tools

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
La socia María Belén pertenece al banco comunal SAN JOSE, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua con su  negocio de venta de verduras en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo zanahorias, cebollas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cebollas entre otros.
Las  socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron  permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The member María Belén belongs to the communal bank San Jose. The bank is located in the department of Cusco.

She continues with her business selling vegetables in one of the markets in the city of Cusco. She is grateful for the loan she was given and is committed to making her required payments. She continues to sell carrots and onions, among other things. She is a responsible and diligent person and because of this she is able to get her family ahead. She is requesting the loan to buy onions among other things.

The members who appear in the attached photos asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy onions, among other things

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es:
Luis Armando vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, en su pequeña finca que se ubica en una comunidad rural de Nicaragua, donde las actividades agrícolas son la principal fuente de ingresos para sus habitantes.

La caficultura es la fuente de ingresos  más importante para este pequeño productor, que se ha venido esforzando por implementar medidas amigables con el medio ambiente, consciente de la importancia que esto tiene para la sostenibilidad de sus actividades.

Para mejorar sus ingresos este ciclo, Luis Armando se ha propuesto incrementar la productividad de su cafetal, para ello está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita asegurar la compra y aplicación oportuna de los insumos que requiere su cultivo, a fin de lograr la meta que se ha propuesto. Su sueño es aumentar las áreas de su finca, así como la productividad de sus cultivos para asegurar a su familia mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Luis Armando lives with his wife and his four children on his small farm in a rural community in Nicaragua where farming activities are the main source of income for the residents.  Coffee production is this small producer's most important source of income.  He has been working hard to implement environmentally friendly measures and is aware of the importance of this for the sustainability of his work.

To improve his income this season, Luis Armando has decided to increase his coffee production.  He's requesting a loan for the purchase and timely application of the inputs his crops need.  That way he can achieve his goal.

His dream is to increase the size of his farm and the productivity of his plants so he can improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to guarantee maintenance for his coffee farm and, as a result, a good crop this year

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en: Carlito is a hardworking father of eight children.  He has cultivated his rice land in Landing, Baliangao and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, Carlito applied for a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, and to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Carlito knows that he has to get things right to yield more income in this cropping season. In the future, Carlito hopes to buy a rice thresher and farm tractor for additional earnings for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, and to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 8 años en su lugar de residencia lo inicio a causa del desempleo, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her two children. She has had a beauty salon business in her home for 8 years. She began the business because she was unemployed. With the earnings that she makes, she is able to cover the expenses of her home. 

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more products for her beauty salon, such as lotions, shampoo, hairpins, and scissors, among other necessary items. This will allow her to increase her earnings, which will help her to have improved financial stability.

loans.use: to buy lotions, shampoo, hairpins, and scissors, among other things.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don juan de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el cliente se dedica a vender bolis (helados de sabores) posee más de 15 años de dedicarse a esa actividad de la cual ha logrado salir adelante, vende en diferentes tiendas y escuelas, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más materia prima como frutas, leche, colorantes de sabores, entre otras cosas para continuar con su trabajo y así mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Juan, 50, lives in his own house with his life partner.

He earns a living selling "bolis" (flavored ice cream).  He has more than 15 years of experience in this line of work and has managed to get ahead.  He sells in a variety of stores and schools.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients such as fruit, milk, colorings for different flavors, and other items so he can keep working and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as fruit, milk, colorings for different flavors, and other items

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-years-old single man from Deir El-balah. He lives with his family in a small house. Ahmad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs.
Ahmad took a 2,500 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar panel system to heat water for the family house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
Existen algunas comunidades en Oaxaca en donde las tradiciones se conservan y celebran con gran ahínco. Una localidad en específico tiene muy presentes dos festividades; el día de San Vicente de Paul y el término de la zafra o cosecha de caña. Se realizan bailes y ceremonias en donde todo el pueblo participa. 
   En dicha comunidad se conformó el grupo Prosperidad debido a que todos  los integrantes buscan prosperar en su actividad, los integrantes del grupo son: Erika y Araceli dedicadas a la venta de ropa; Carolina, a la venta de comida; Rosalia, a la venta de pollo; Valeria, a la venta de calzado y Miguel quien maneja un consultorio médico. 
    El Doctor Miguel sufrió un accidente hace veinticinco años y perdió la movilidad de ambas piernas, pero sus tres hijos y su esposa lo motivaron a continuar ejerciendo su profesión. “El mayor reto fue comprender que no podría caminar nuevamente, pero eso no me impidió salir adelante” comenta con entusiasmo. Después de recibir la rehabilitación adecuada, estableció su consultorio en el centro de la comunidad donde hasta el día de hoy brinda servicio las veinticuatro horas del día; su propósito es brindar el mejor servicio y el mejor tratamiento por lo que también abrió una farmacia.
    Gracias a las ganancias obtenidas pudo dar estudios a sus dos hijas y a su hijo, quienes ya lo convirtieron en abuelo; en total tiene seis nietos quienes alegran de diferente manera sus días, de igual manera con las ganancias obtenidas reinvierte en la farmacia.
Con los préstamos y ganancias ha comprado medicamentos e instrumentos médicos, ha dado mantenimiento a su equipo de trabajo y, con el apoyo de sus hijos, ha comprado un automóvil para facilitar su traslado para asistir a las actualizaciones académicas que sigue cursando. Esta vez el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de termómetros, gasas, antibióticos, bisturí, anestesia, jeringas, catéter y sueros para continuar con la actividad. Miguel no pierde la esperanza de que uno de sus nietos sea doctor al igual que él.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el consultorio, Miguel es el único hombre integrante del grupo.
texts.en:
There are some communities in Oaxaca where traditions are preserved and celebrated with great zeal. One specific location has two important festivals: Day of St. Vincent de Paul and the end of the harvest or cane harvest. Dances and ceremonies are performed, involving everyone.

In this community you will find the Prosperity group and all its members are striving to thrive in their respective business. The group members are: Araceli and Erika sell clothes; Carolina, the sale of food; Rosalia, selling chicken; Valeria, sale of footwear and Miguel who runs a medical practice.

Dr. Miguel crashed twenty five years ago and lost the use of both legs, but his three children and his wife encouraged him to continue with his work. "The biggest challenge was to understand that might not walk again, but that did not stop me from succeed," he stated. After receiving proper rehabilitation, he set up his office in the center of the community where even today provides service 24 hours per day; its purpose is to provide the best service and the best treatment so he also opened a pharmacy.

Thanks to the income he could give his two daughters and his son and education; his children have already made him a grandfather. In total he has six grandchildren who brighten his days in different ways, just as with the proceeds reinvested in the pharmacy.

With loans and profits he purchased medications and medical devices, and has been taking care of his medical equipment. And with the support of his children, he has bought a car for easy transportation to attend academic seminars, maintaining his training. This time the loan will be invested in the purchase of thermometers, gauze, antibiotics, scalpel, anesthesia, syringes, catheter and intravenous serum to continue his work. Miguel has not lost hope that one of his grandsons will become a doctor like him.

loans.use: to buy thermometers, antibiotics, scalpel, anesthesia, gases, syringes, catheters, and intravenous serums.

loans.name: Los Cuates Group

texts.es:
Un cerro puede ser el epicentro en donde una comunidad encuentra su identidad. La Pedrera es el lugar del cual se extraían las rocas empleadas por los albañiles para construir las casas de la región. Los habitantes también solían ir al mismo punto a buscar ramas secas para elaborar sus escobas, los pastores llevaban ahí a sus animales, y los niños solían nadar en el pequeño arroyo que adornaba el paisaje. Aunque ahora es un lugar poco concurrido, al subir a la cima del cerro se puede apreciar una gran panorámica y una excelente puesta del sol.
   A unos cuantos kilómetros de dicho cerro se formó un grupo llamado Los Cuates los integrantes del grupo son: Bernardin y José quienes venden refrescos; Cristina, pan; Raquel y Obdulia, pollo. Por su parte Arlenne maneja una carnicería e Irán se dedica a la albañilería. 
   Irán es uno de los integrantes más jóvenes del grupo, vive con sus padres y dos hermanos. Desde pequeño  se familiarizó con la albañilería pues es el oficio de su padre. Desde hace siete años decidió dedicarse de lleno al oficio, éste se ha convertido en el mejor regalo para él y sus hermanos ya que con las ganancias, ellos pueden continuar con sus estudios. 
   La gran inspiración de Irán es precisamente su familia; hace tres años recibió un trasplante de riñón de su madre quien lo ha dado todo por él, y como muestra de gratitud le ha hecho realidad el sueño de construirle una casa. Otro estímulo para Irán es el hecho de poder ayudar a la gente a mejorar sus condiciones de vida con una mejor vivienda. 
   Los préstamos y ganancias los ha invertido en herramienta necesaria para continuar con su oficio, esta vez necesita comprar madera que sirve para la construcción de los castillos, bases y loza de las casas.
   El grupo Los Cuates agradece la oportunidad del préstamo ya que éste les ayudará a generar más ganancias.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa donde se realizan las reuniones, Irán es quien viste playera azul cielo.
texts.en:
A hill may be the epicenter where a community finds its identity. La Pedrera is the place from which the rocks used by masons to build the houses in the region were extracted. The people also used to go to the same spot to find dry branches to make brooms, shepherds took their animals there, and the kids used to swim in the small creek that adorned the landscape. Although it is now a rather busy place, upon climbing to the top of the hill you can see a great panoramic and excellent sunset.

   A few kilometers from this hill, a group called The Friends group formed: It's members are: Joseph Bernardin who sell refreshments; Cristina, bread; Rachel and Obdulia, chicken. Meanwhile Arlenne runs a butcher and Iran is engaged in masonry.

   Iran is one of the youngest members of the group, he lives with his parents and two brothers. During his childhood he became familiar with masonry as a trade from his father. For seven years he decided to devote himself to the work. It has become the best gift for him and his brothers since they can use the profits to continue their studies.

   Iran's great inspiration is his family; three years ago he received a kidney transplant from his mother, who has given everything for him, and to show his gratitude he made the dream of building a house come true. Another incentive for Iran is being able to help people improve their living conditions with better housing.

   Loans and profits invested in the tools needed to continue his job. This time he needs to buy wood used to build decks, bases and siding for houses.

   The Friends group welcomes the opportunity present in the loan as this will help them generate more profit.

* The photograph was taken in the house where the meetings are held, Iran is wearing blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
Una comunidad cañera del estado de Oaxaca encierra también un patrimonio cultural e histórico muy importante; mayormente por las pirámides erigidas en la localidad. El mes de abril es muy importante para los habitantes ya que celebran la fiesta del santo patrono con bailables y diversos actos religiosos.
   El grupo Estrellitas proviene de dicha comunidad, el nombre lo eligieron los integrantes debido a que por la noche, gracias a la poca luminosidad, son apreciables estos astros en el cielo. Los integrantes actuales del grupo son: Cesarea quien vende ropa; Transita, dulces; Brisa, cosméticos; Rosario, refrescos; Rosa, antojitos típicos. Mientras que Inés y Zacarías manejan una tienda de abarrotes, éste último también tiene un molino de nixtamal. 
   Don Zacarías está felizmente casado con doña Hipólita con quien procreó cinco hijos quienes hoy en día son mayores de edad. Vive en una de las zonas más retiradas de la comunidad, lo que aprovecha para trabajar en el campo: siembra y cosecha de maíz desde hace diez años. Anteriormente para moler su producto debía ir en bicicleta a un molino hasta el centro del municipio, fue por eso que decidió comprar su propio equipo, así ahorra tiempo y puede rentar el molino a sus vecinos. Actualmente, al día, el molino de Don Zacarías trabaja de treinta a cuarenta veces. 
   Con las ganancias obtenidas da mantenimiento al negocio, por ejemplo, manda a picar las piedras que logran dar mayor fuerza al molino para que la masa quede más fina, que a su vez resulta en la satisfacción de sus clientes. Esta vez ha solicitado un préstamo ya que necesita invertir en arroz, frijol, sopa, aceite, huevos y papel higiénico para iniciar una nueva actividad: su propia tienda de abarrotes “Las tiendas quedan muy lejos, por eso abriré la mía en casa, así ya no tendrán que ir tan lejos a comprar” comenta entusiasmado. Don Zacarías espera mantener un crecimiento en ambas actividades.
   
*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de doña Rosa, don Zacarías es el único hombre en el grupo.
texts.en:
This is a sugar cane producing community in the state of Oaxaca. It also has a very important cultural and historic heritage, as exemplified by the pyramids that stand in the area. The month of April is very important for the inhabitants of the area because this is when they celebrate their patron saint with dances and various religious acts.

The group “Estrellitas” is from this community. The members chose the name because at night, due to the low levels of light, the stars are visible in the sky. The current members of the group are: Cesarea, who sells clothing; Transita, who sells sweets; Brisa, who sells cosmetics; Rosario, who sells soft drinks; and Rosa, who sells typical snacks. Inés and Zacarías run a small grocery store, and Zacarías also has a corn dough grinding mill. 

Zacarías is happily married to Hipólita, with whom he has five children, who are all now grown. He lives in one of the neighborhoods farthest from the center of town, so he takes advantage of being able to work in the fields. He has been cultivating and harvesting corn for ten years. Previously, in order to grind his corn, he had to ride his bicycle to a corn grinding mill all the way in the center of town; this is why he decided to buy his own equipment. In this way, he saves time and he can rent the grinding mill to his neighbors. Now, Zacarías’ mill gets used thirty to forty times per day.

With the profits from his business, for example, he has someone break up the rocks that make his mill stronger so that the corn dough comes out with a finer texture. This, in turn, results in happy clients. This time he has requested a loan because he needs to invest in rice, beans, soups, cooking oil, eggs, and toilet paper in order to start a new business—his own small grocery store. “The stores are very far away. So, I’ll open one in my house, and that way people won’t have to go so far to buy,” he explains enthusiastically. Zacarías hopes to keep both businesses growing. 

* The photograph was taken in Rosa’s house. Zacarías is the only man in the group.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, soups, cooking oil, eggs, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Flordelis is 35 years old and two of her children are in school.

Flordelis has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Flordelis requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of charcoal to resell.

Flordelis has been in this business for four years. In the future, Flordelis would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 38-year-old repeat customer who is so appreciative of the previous financial support that enabled her to increase her sales and repay well. Since her clientele increased, the demand inevitably is much higher, and to meet the customers' needs, she requested more money to fund the business. This will increase her sales and profit. She appreciates the support. She is hardworking and honest. She hopes to come for more loans to grow the business further.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan de 62 años de edad vive solo en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol cuenta con mas de 40 años de dedicarse a la agricultura y gracias a su trabajo es como ha logrado salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas (controles de plagas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, etc.) y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para empezar con la siembra y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Juan, 62, lives alone in his own house. He grows corn and beans. He has worked in agriculture for more than 40 years and thanks to his job, he has managed to get ahead. Juan is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies such as pest applications, herbicides, and fertilizer, etc., and to improve the land shown in the above photograph. This will allow him to start planting and thus earn more income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as pest applications, herbicides, and fertilizer, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
El camino entre los cañales que se debe recorrer para poder llegar hasta la comunidad veracruzana donde se ha formado el grupo Las Estrellas parece un laberinto. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron las integrantes pues en la localidad pueden apreciar hermosas puestas del sol y, por la noche, las estrellas que brillan intensamente.
   Las estrellas y sus actividades son: Isidra que vende cerdos; Soledad, pollo; Dora y Antolina, antojitos típicos y Humberta quien maneja una tienda de abarrotes. 
   Doña Humberta está casada con  Roque quien trabaja en el campo, específicamente en el cultivo de la caña de azúcar, tiene dos hijas de ocho y doce años. Beta, como es mejor conocida, lleva cuatro años dedicada a la venta de abarrotes en un local establecido en su casa donde exhibe su mercancía. La tienda brinda su servicio a partir de las 7:00 am y hasta las 8:00 pm , los productos más solicitados son los de la canasta básica, refrescos y pan. 
   Además de la tienda de abarrotes, Beta se dedica a la venta de antojitos todos los sábados. El negocio lo maneja junto con su cuñada y cada quince días prepara ricos tamales rancheros. El obtener sus propios ingresos, estar al cuidado de su familia y sentirse productiva son su motivación principal.
   Anteriormente, Beta ha invertido préstamos y ganancias en arroz, frijol, sopa, azúcar, huevos, galletas, botanas y refrescos pues son los productos con mayor demanda en su tienda. Esta vez invertirá en queso, salchichas, jamón y pan, y con las ganancias obtenidas siempre seguirá mostrando su apoyo a su esposo.
   
El grupo Las Estrellas agradece se les haya otorgado la confianza de un préstamo para continuar con su desarrollo económico y social.
	
*En la fotografía Doña Humberta viste blusa color verde pistache.
texts.en:
The road through the cane fields that has to be traveled to reach the Veracruz community is like a maze. Here is where the Stars group formed. The group's name was selected because the members in the town enjoy beautiful sunsets and at night, the glowing stars.

   The stars and their businesses are: Isidra selling pigs; Soledad, chicken; Dora and Antolina, typical snacks and Humberta runs a grocery store.

   Doña Humberta is married to Roque who works in the field, specifically in the cultivation of sugarcane. She has two daughters ages eight and twelve. Beta, as she is better known, has been selling groceries for four years from her home where she displays her merchandise. The store is open from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm, and the most popular products are the basic food, soft drinks and bread.

   In addition to the grocery store, Beta is sells snacks every Saturday. The business is run with her sister and every 15 days she prepares delicious tamales rancheros. Earning her own income, caring for her family and feeling productive are her main motivations.

   Previously, Beta has invested loans and profits in rice, beans, soup, sugar, eggs, cookies, snacks and soft drinks as they are the products most in demand in her store. This time she will buy cheese, hot dogs, ham and bread, and with the proceeds continue to show her support for her husband.

The Stars group appreciates have been granted a loan with confidence to continue with its economic and social development.


* Pictured Doña Humberta is wearing the pistachio green blouse.

loans.use: to buy cheese, hot dogs, ham and bread.

location.town: COL. PALMA SOLA MUNICIPIO OMEALCA VERACRUZ

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 37 años de edad, es soltera vive con sus tres hijos de las edades entre 14 y 19 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Catarina con el objetivo de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica al tejido de güipiles típicos de su región, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica al cultivo de café.
Pero Catarina es una mujer optimista que lucha día a día para poder prosperar, ella ahora se ha visto a la necesidad de comprar un pedazo de terreno donde pueda seguir aumentando su cultivo, pero lamentablemente ella no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar su terreno, por tal  razón solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra.
El gran anhelo de Catarina es poder construir su casa, y luego instalar una tienda de compraventa de abarrotes en el centro de su comunidad para poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Catarina is a 37 year old woman. She is single and lives with her three children, who are between the ages of 14 and 19, in the community of Sololá. Catarina wants to increase her earnings and get her family ahead, which is why she works weaving traditional blouses from her region. However, in order to improve her earnings, she also grows coffee. Catarina is an optimistic woman who strives daily in order to prosper. She now is in need of purchasing a plot of land so that she can continue to expand her crops.  Unfortunately, she does not have enough capital to purchase the land, which is why she is seeking a loan to make the purchase.

Catarina's goal is to build a home and later open a grocery store in the town center so that sh can improve her income.

loans.use: purchase land to farm on.

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es: Rosa es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 9 años,  con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de huevos, granos básicos, azúcar, leche, sopas, etc. todo por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa is a single mother who lives in her own house with her son. She has had a small store located in her home for 9 years. She manages to cover some household expenses with the money she earns. She is requesting a loan to buy eggs, staple grains, sugar, milk, soup, etc., at wholesale and, in turn, earn more income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy eggs, staple grains, sugar, milk, soup, etc., at wholesale.

loans.name: Las Abejas De Qquehuña Grande Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS ABEJAS DE QQUEHUÑA GRANDE II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huancarani, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Simeona ella es casada y tiene 27 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz,papa y trigo, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de ganaderia.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Las Abejas Qquehuña Grande 2" communal bank. This lending group is located in the Huancarani district in the Province of Paucartambo in Cusco. Simeona is a member of the group. She is married, 27 years old and has two children. She works as a farmer. She has a plot of land where she grows corn, potatoes and wheat. She works from 8am to 6pm, and she has many years of experience in the business, which has gone very well for her.  Simon's dream is to expand her agriculture business. Simeona is seeking a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

The member who is in the inset photo had her picture taken after the meeting because she had prior work commitments on the day of the meeting. The other members of the group work in businesses that include: animal sales, farming, grocery stores and livestock. The members are grateful for those who are taking part in making their dream come true. They are are committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a single mother of eight. She does pig farming and she is also a landlady. She lives in an informal settlement where there are no toilets. When she learned of the Fresh Life Toilet through a friend, she developed some interest and now she is seeking a loan to finance one Fresh Life Toilet for her tenants.

She believes that with the installation of the toilet, her rental units will become competitive and she will be able to retain her tenants longer. She plans to increase the rent once the toilet is installed. The increased rent will go towards the repayment of the loan. She also believes the toilet will improve the hygienic standards within her residential area.

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 41 years old and married with five children.  With five children in school, Perlita works very hard to provide for them.

Perlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Perlita has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, biscuit, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Perlita would like to save enough to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en:
Ferial is a 49-year-old married mother of four. Her husband left home to seek better work opportunities abroad and Ferial quit school at an intermediate level. She established a year ago her own housewares shop, a profession she learned when she lived in Africa. She was a little underwhelmed by the profit margin she was making when she first started her business, but now her business is doing well.
 
Ferial is working hard to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions, thus today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Ferial hopes to expand her shop more in the future so she can increase her sales and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees, with the hope of expanding her shop

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia previously accessed an 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, needles, and other clothing products needed in her tailoring business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. Aside from her tailoring business, she also operates a sari-sari store where she gets additional income.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her sari-sari store business. She would use the amount to purchase more grocery items and other relative products to sell in her store. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purcase more grocery items and other relative products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hut

texts.en:
Hut, 62, lives in a small community of Battambang Province, Cambodia. He is a father of seven children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he has been in this type of business for around twenty years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 7.00 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the health of his family

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is a 23-years-old single man from Rafah city. He works as an employee in a furniture store where he gets a low income. 

Yaser is also a student in the university where he studies Business Administration. He wants to complete his studies and find a better job in the future to improve his family living conditions. 

Yaser took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will him to buy a new laptop for his studies.   By taking this loan, Yaser will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily.   Yaser appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to help with his university studies in Business Administration

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish, cooking oil, salt, and charcoal to use for frying fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bedsheets and clothes (polo t-shirts, sweaters and jeans), orders that have been requested by his customers.

loans.name: Lb28125 Group

texts.en: Married with nine children, Eunice, aged 52, owns a grocery in which she sells assorted commodities such as sugar, salt, and soft drinks. The profits from her business help her to financially support her family by providing for her children's basic needs. She will use the loan to buy more commodities in order to increase her products, thus also increasing her profits. She will also use the loan to pay medical bills for  her children. Eunice plans to construct a descent house for her family. The profits she made from her previous loans have helped Eunice to be able to provide food and shelter for her family members.

loans.use: To buy assorted items to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming vegetables for 12 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 30-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Husam is also a student in the university where he studies Business Administration. He wants to complete his studies and find a better job in the future to improve his family's living conditions.
 
Husam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Husam will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. Husam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Jimarie

texts.en:
Jimarie is a 30 years old, married and has two children. She owns and manages a coconut production business to earn a living and be able to help her husband for their children needs. Jimarie wants to increase their family income out from her business. 

She decided to take a loan to pay the labor cost for the coconut harvest to cater for all the orders of her customers.

Jimarie wants for the future to save money from her business to sustain the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: To pay the labor costs for the coconut harvest to save for her children's education

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for several years, and she repaid her previous loan used for inventory. Thank you for your great help, lenders. 

Related to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 24,000 to pay for merchandise such as uniforms, t-shirts, shorts, toiletries frozen food, and soft drinks to sell. This will be a big help for her family, especially for their children's basic needs. 

In the future, with an optimistic heart, she wants to make improvements in their living conditions and be happy. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group consists of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise such as uniforms, t-shirts, shorts, toiletries, frozen food, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is a married man with four kids. He is a landlord in the informal settlement. He learned about Fresh Life Toilet through an outreach programme. He developed some interest to install one fresh life toilet on his plot.

He is seeking a loan to finance the installation of one fresh life toilet.
The toilet will enable him increase the rent as the hygiene would improve. The increased rent will be used to pay for the loan. The other businesses that he runs would also enable him pay for the loan just in case the toilet income is not sufficient enough to pay for the loan.

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen aged, 50, she is a responsible mother of nine children and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her repeat loan with the BRAC and Kiva. 

Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with the scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sell it to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses he does not have amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for getting money.

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan for her husband, so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 
She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the repayment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's scrap metal and plastics business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 50-year-old mother of five children living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of vegetables. Therefore, Amina asked for a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

Amina is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables for her husband's vegetable shop

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 25-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. His brother works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Husam is a student in the university where he studies Media and Press. He wants to complete his studies and find a job in the future to improve his family's living conditions. 

Husam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Husam will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. Husam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a toilet and bathroom since she currently uses a latrine and it is unsanitary and unsafe for her 5-year-old son and her grandma.

loans.name: Fakhri

texts.en:
Fakhri is a 20-years-old single man from a village near Nablus city. His father works as an employee in a local firm. 

Fakhri is a student in the university where he studies Business Administration. He wants to complete his studies and find a job in the future to improve his family living conditions. 

Fakhri took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Fakhri will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily.  Fakhri appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to help with his university course in Business Administration.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell for her business for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Cristina has been in this business for 6 years. She earns more income from general store and raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell for her business and to save for her children's education

loans.name: Ngoan

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoan is a hardworking woman, 52 years old. There are five people in her family. 

The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family's living standards. Her family’s income is mainly from fishing and small business, so she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Nancy Rocío

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo, el mismo cuenta con varios sitios de descanso que son  visitados por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha muy cercano al mismo en el km.83 se encuentra el Recinto Pueblo Nuevo,  las tradiciones  del Recinto son las festividades que cada año se realizan en el mes de diciembre en honor a la Virgen de los Remedios. 
En este Recinto vive y tiene el negocio la señora Nancy una mujer luchadora de 34 años ella es madre soltera tiene tres hijos  por los que cada día lucha y se supera para darles todo lo necesario para su preparación, ella como muchas mujeres es cabeza de hogar y tiene que trabajar  sola para que nada les falte a sus  hijos. 
Se dedica a la producción de cerdos  aprendió de este negocio por iniciativa propia al mismo le dedica un promedio de 4 horas diarias, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de los papas, solicita este préstamo para invertir en el negocio, en la ampliación y arreglo de las chancheras con esta nueva inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y la calidad de vida de sus hijos 
La señora Nancy agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas ya que es la única institución que se preocupa por las personas que desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a canton of love. It has a warm humid climate and many rest sites that are visited by national and foreign tourists.  It is located in the northwest of the Pichincha province.  Very nearby, within the same .83 km, is the New Town area.  The traditions of this area are the festivities carried out every year in December in honor of the Virgin of Los Remedios [the Virgin Mary].

This area is where Señora Nancy lives and has a business.  She is a hard-working woman who is 34 years old and a single mother of three children for whom she fights every day and betters herself in order to give them everything necessary for their preparation.  Like many women, she is the head of the household and has to work alone so that her children lack nothing.

She makes a living raising pigs.  She learned this business on her own initiative, and spends an average of four hours a day doing this job.  On occasion she receives help from her parents.  She is asking for a loan so that she can invest in this business by enlarging and repairing the pigpens.  This new investment will improve her income and the quality of life for her children.

Señora Nancy is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and the opportunities they have offered her since it is the only institution that cares about the people who want to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to enlarge and repair the pigpens.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Mrs. Ha is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to support her family. 

She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve the health of her family members, and also for environmental protection.

With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly from shrimp farming.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 58 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 12 y 24 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuel con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, el desde hace 20 años trabaja como guardia de un chalet que se encuentra en su comunidad.
Manuel ahora ha tomado la decisión de cambiar las puertas y ventanas de su casa, porque ya se encuentran en mal estado, y ya le da a su casa una mala apariencia, pero lamentablemente Manuel no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar las puertas y ventas, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo.
El gran anhelo de Manuel es poder darle a su familia una casa digna de ellos.
texts.en:
Manuel, 58, is married and has a lovely family of 7 children between the ages of 12 and 24. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá. In an effort to obtain income and to support his family, Manuel has worked as a guard of a chalet located in his community for 20 years. 

Manuel has made the decision to change the doors and windows of his house because they are in poor condition and they give his house a bad appearance. Unfortunately Manuel doesn't have enough money to buy the doors and windows. For this reason, he is requesting a loan. Manuel's main desire is to give his family a decent house.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows for his house.

loans.name: Tac

texts.en:
Mrs. Tac is 56 years old. There are four people in her family. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to the improvement of the health for her family, as well as for environmental protection.

Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and a salary, so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Quynh

texts.en:
Mrs. Quynh is a hardworking woman, 24 years old. She is married and has a baby. 

Her family’s income is mainly from a salary and husbandry. 

She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. 

With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyen is 54 years old. She is married and has three children, so she works very hard to provide for them.

Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and a small business. 

She is interested to improve the living standard for her family so she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Tham

texts.en:
Mrs. Tham is a hardworking woman, 50 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in a small house and without a hygienic latrine. 

The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family's living standards.

She is able to repay the loan from husbandry and small business.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 19 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Roselyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Vien

texts.en:
Mrs. Vien is 65 years old. She is married and has three children; all of them have a job. 

She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living conditions and health for her family. 

Her income is mainly from salary, fishing and husbandry so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Marynel

texts.es: Empecinada en su deseo de iniciar su propio negocio,  Marynel una joven de 20 años de edad en compañía de su madre, quienes desde la comodidad de su hogar en agosto de 2001 dieron su primer paso, para lo que hoy en día es una Droguería y Miscelánea.  Empezaron con una estantería en la que ofrecían artículos de papelería y útiles es colares,  su tío observó el potencial que tenía el negocio y les propuso hacer parte de la sociedad, con lo que compraron vitrinas mostradoras y estanterías, así mismo su madre viajó al vecino país de Venezuela a comprar artículos para surtir el negocio; lociones corporales, shampoos, jabones, paños húmedos, y demás productos para comercializar en éste formato de negocio.  El negocio tiene un amplio surtido, los clientes tienen a la mano artículos de aseo como pañales, jabones cosméticos y medicados, paños húmedos, drogas y helados, todos los días en el horario de 6:30 a.m. a 10:00 p.m.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, capital que invertirá en la compra de medicamentos y adecuaciones para mejorar el aspecto del negocio.  Marynel considera que esta inversión mejorará el servicio al cliente, y por eso seguirán siendo de preferencia de sus clientes. Su meta de negocio es cada día estar más consolidada y como meta personal desea continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Determined in her desire to start her own business, Marynel- a young woman who is 20-years old- and her mother took their first step in August 2001 from the comfort of their own home.  Today they have a Drug Store.  
They started out with a shelf, from which they sold paper goods and school supplies.  Marynel's uncle saw the business's potential and proposed joining their company.  With that, they purchased display cases and shelves.  And her mother traveled to a neighboring country, Venezuela, to purchase items to stock up their business: body lotions, shampoos, wet wipes, medications and ice cream.  The business now has a large stock, and their customers have access to cleaning supplies, diapers, cosmetic and medicated soaps, wet wipes, medications and ice cream.  The shop is open every day from 6:30 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  
Marynel is currently requesting a "credikiva," her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will invest the capital in the purchase of medications and improving her business's appearance.  Marynel feels that this investment will improve the service she is able to offer her customers, and allow they to remain as a favorite among their customers.  Marynel's business goal is to strengthen her business each day, and her personal goal is to keep going to school.

loans.use: to purchase medications and make improvements to improve her business's appearance.

loans.name: Thuyet

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuyet is 52 years old. There are three people in her family. She can cover the family’s daily costs and education from pig raising income, fishing and small business. 

With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family members, especially the kids.  

She has daily income from a vegetable garden, chickens and pigs.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu is a hardworking woman, 32 years old. She is married and has a baby. Her family’s income is mainly from fishing  and husbandry. 

She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. 

With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia Lucia se sigue dedicando al negocio de siembra y cosecha de verduras,la socia es una persona emprendedoras y trabajadora que por medio de estos negocios quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia esta feliz ocn el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lucia is still making her living planting and harvesting vegetables.  She is an enterprising and hard-working person who wants to get ahead through her business.  She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. 

Lucia is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Thuyet

texts.en: Mrs. Thuyet is a hardworking woman who is 44 years old. She is married and has three children. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and fishing. She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Doai

texts.en:
Mrs. Doai is a hardworking woman, 53 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house and without a hygienic latrine. 

She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. 

She is able to repay the loan monthly from salary and husbandry.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong is 41 years old, married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially for her children, but she lacks capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine. She is able to repay the loan by selling chicken, ducks, pigs and vegetables.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van is 39 years old. There are four people in her family. Fishing is the main income source of her family. She can cover the family’s daily costs and education from selling fish, which her husband catches. 

With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa is a hardworking woman, 38 years old. She is married and has two children. She has also daily income from a vegetable garden and chickens and ducks. 

With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family. 

She is able to repay the loan monthly with support from her husband.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: To

texts.en:
Mrs. To is 49 years old, married, and has four children; three of them have a job. She would like to improve her family’s living standard but lacks capital. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, and she is able to repay the loan from husbandry.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Vien

texts.en:
Mrs. Vien is 40 years old. She is married and has three children; all of them have jobs. 

She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living conditions and health of her family. 

Her income is mainly from business, so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
La socia Purificacion se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura y crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas y la socia tambien siembra verduras como repollo,choclos,zanahorias y zapallos,la socia por medio de estos pequeños negocio quiere salir adelante,la socia ahora tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de maiz.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los animales.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Purificacion continues making her living in agriculture and raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She also plants vegetables like cabbage, corn, carrots and squash.  Purificacion wants to get ahead through these small businesses.  She now also earns money selling maize.  She is requesting the loan to purchase guinea pigs, hens and animal feed for them. 

Purificacion is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and hens and animal feed for them.

loans.name: Rossi

texts.es:
La socia Rossi  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia quiere salir adelante por medio de este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, cebollas y zapallos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
