texts.en:
Rossi continues making her living selling vegetables.  She wants to get ahead through her business, and it is going very well for her.  Rossi's dream is to expand her vegetable sales business.  She is requesting the loan to purchase tomatoes, onions and squash. 

Rossi is happy about the loan and promises to comply with her repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions and squash.

loans.name: Crisales

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Crisales works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Crisales is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of dried fish to sell for her buy-and-sell dried fish business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Crisales has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy is a hard working woman, 31 years old. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine in order to improve her living standard. 

Husbandry and fishing are the main income sources of her family, so she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity  and selling fish, which her husband catches.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Thiet

texts.en:
Mrs. Thiet is a hardworking woman, 56 years old. There are three people in her family. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can improve the health of her family members, especially her children. 

She has daily income from pig raising activity and salary so she is able to repay the loan monthly as scheduled.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is the age of 45, living with her husband and two daughters in the area of Lahore.

Her husband is a catering services provider for ceremonies; he provides the decoration lights, wedding tents for weddings, birthday and engagement ceremonies. He does not consider it a profitable business because this is a seasonal business. 

Now the marriage season is going at its peak, but most of his tents have become clumsy due to long time use. He wants to buy new wedding tents to provide better services to his customers. 

Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new tents and decoration lights to provide the catering services. 

Shehnaz thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new tents and decoration lights for her husband's catering services

loans.name: The

texts.en:
Mrs. The is 53 years old. She is married and has three children, so she works very hard to provide for them. Husbandry and cultivation are the main sources of income in her family. 

With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family's living standard, as well as environmental protection.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Sy

texts.en: Mrs. Sy is 65 years old, married and has two children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially that of her children, but she lacks capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine. She is able to repay the loan from cultivation and husbandry.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
With a dream to have their own house and have a better life for her family, Amelia is indeed working very hard to provide for the daily needs of the household and to help her husband the very best she can. She is married to Ricardo, and they are blessed with three sons. She is currently focused on handling a stall of fruits and vegetables in the market within their area in Caloocan City, Philippines. 

However, the income she generates from the business is not really enough for all the expenses. This is why she is planning to expand her business to become a better source of income. If you would allow, Amelia would like to take out a PHP 30,000 loan that she will use to buy more supplies of fruits and vegetables for her stall. 

What you will lend will become a great help indeed, not just to Amelia, but also to her family. She is really hopeful that through you, she can be able to start giving her children a more affordable kind of living. 

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of fruits and vegetables for her stall.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry (pictured) is 54 years, and lives at Kean Svay district, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been married since 1980. She has one daughter and two sons. Two are married and the last one is a technician.

Ry has been a farmer for 20 years, while her husband has been a taxi driver for 10 years. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizer, gasoline and materials to support her farming. 

She said that she tries to farm to support the market's needs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, gasoline and materials to support her farming.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia es una mujer amable, perseverante que día con día se esfuerza por llevar en su casa el pan de cada día, ella tiene 42 años de edad es casada y tiene nueve hermosos hijos de las edades entre 2 y 20 años que viven en una comunidad de Suchitepequez.
Para Amalia su familia es lo más importante es por eso que trabaja de sol a sol para darles lo mejor, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos y patos criollos, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace 12 años. 
Ella ahora se ve a la necesidad de terminar la construcción de su casa, pues desde hace algún tiempo no habían terminado la construcción, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, por  tal motivo solicita un crédito que lo utilizara para comprar sus puertas de láminas.
Amalia tiene las esperanzas de conseguir este crédito para terminar la construcción de su casa y darles a sus hijos una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Amalia is a friendly, persistent woman who works hard day after day to support her family.  She is 42-years old, married and has nine beautiful children between the ages of 2 and 20.  She lives in a Suchitepequez community.
For Amalia, her family is the most important thing.  She works from sun to sun to give them the best.  She makes her living selling chickens and Muscovy ducks, which she has done for the last twelve years. 
Amalia now needs to finish construction on her house.  It's been needing to get done for a while, but one of her difficulties is not having enough money to do so.  That is why Amalia is requesting a loan- she will use it to purchase metal-sheeted doors. 
Amalia hopes to obtain the loan she needs to finish construction on her house and give her children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase metal-sheeted doors for her house.

loans.name: Mutansar

texts.en: Mutansar, age 38, is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including thread, needles, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Mutansar, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needed things with the help of the loan amount. Mutansar is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring material for her husband's tailoring shop

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: Pedro de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres, el se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pedro, 30 years old, lives in his own house together with his parents. He works in agriculture, growing corn and beans. He sells his products in the different markets near his house, and with the money from these sales he is able to pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control products, and herbicides, and to improve the land shown in the photo, so he can continue with his work in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control products, and herbicides, and to improve the land

loans.name: Reina Cecilia

texts.es: Reina de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la confeccion de ropa desde hace mas de 25 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora la ropa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima como variedad de tela, botones, zippers, elásticos, hilos de colores, entre otras cosas y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Reina, 39 years old, lives in her own house with her two children. She has been making clothes for more than 25 years. She has many clients because of the quality of her work, and with the money she makes she is able to get ahead. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more materials, including a variety of fabrics, buttons, zippers, elastics, colored thread, and other items. This will allow her to continue with her work in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics, buttons, zippers, elastics, colored thread, and other items

loans.name: La Esquina Group

texts.es:
En Veracruz se encuentra una comunidad cuyo significado es “lugar donde se junta la cañada” debido a la gran producción de este producto en la región. Una característica sobresaliente de la comunidad es el silbido que produce el ingenio cuando anuncia el cambio de turno. En dicho lugar se consolidó un grupo de nombre La Esquina pues el lugar en donde se reúnen sus integrantes; ellas son: Alma quien vende regalos y dulces; Catalina,  Paula, Paola, y Rogelia, ropa; Cecilia, ropa y antojitos; Margarita, calzado; María Isabel, comida; María Teresa, pollo.  Por otro lado María maneja una tienda de abarrotes y Rosalba un club nutricional. 
   Alma está casada con Martín, tienen dos pequeños hijos; una niña de siete años y un niño de tres. Con el firme propósito de brindar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos y apoyar a su esposo, Alma decidió iniciar a vender dulces. Aunque al principio solo vendía diversos tipos de caramelos, actualmente también ofrece bisutería, muñecos de peluche, tazas, porta retratos, ropa para niños y bolsas de regalo. Alma sabe que su negocio es una buena idea ya que para encontrar cualesquiera de estos productos, sus vecinos deben recorrer largas distancias, pero con ella además encuentran excelentes precios.
   Por ahora vende toda la mercancía en el mismo lugar, pero su meta es rentar un local separado o incluso construirlo para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con las ganancias obtenidas solventa el gasto de la guardería a la que asiste su pequeño y cubre parte de los gastos corrientes. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de gomitas, lunetas, huevitos de chocolate, cacahuates enchilados, salados, japoneses, habas y garbanzos.
   El grupo La Esquina envía un mensaje muy importante a quienes hacen posible su préstamo: “gracias por creer en nosotros, gracias por la oportunidad del préstamo”.
   
*La fotografía fue tomada en el club de doña Rosa, Alma es quien viste blusa color lila.
texts.en:
In Veracruz, there is a community whose name means "the place where the sugarcane is gathered" due to the great production of this product in the region. One outstanding characteristic of the community is the whistling sound produced by the sugar factory when the shift change is announced. In this place, a group was formed called La Esquina [The Corner], after the place where its members meet. They are: Alma, who sells gifts and sweets; Catalina, Paula, Paola and Rogelia, who sell clothing; Cecilia, who sells clothing and snacks; Margarita, who sells shoes; María Isabel, who sells food; and María Theresa, who sells chicken. Additionally, María manages a grocery store and Rosalba runs a nutrition club.

Alma is married to Martín and they have two small children; a daughter who is seven years old and a son who is three. With the firm intention of providing a good quality of life for her children and to support her husband, Alma decided to start selling sweets. Although in the beginning, she only sold various types of candy, she now offers jewelry, stuffed animals, cups, picture frames, children's clothing and gift bags. Alma knows that her business is a good idea and that to find any of these products, her neighbors must travel long distances, but with her they find excellent prices.

For now, she sells all her merchandise in the same place, but her goal is to rent a separate space or even to build one in order to give her customers better service. With her earnings, she covers the costs of daycare for her youngest child and part of her current expenses. She will invest the loan to purchase gummy candies, crescent rolls, chocolate eggs, spicy peanuts, salty peanuts, Japanese peanuts, lima beans and chickpeas.

The group La Esquina [The Corner] sends a very important message to those who make their loan possible: "Thank you for believing in us, thank you for the opportunity of the loan."

*The photo was taken in Doña Rosa's nutrition club; Alma is the woman in the light purple-colored blouse.

loans.use: to purchase gummy candies, crescent rolls, chocolate eggs, spicy peanuts, salty peanuts, Japanese peanuts, lima beans and chickpeas.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own food stall for years now, from which she earns a good income. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. She has to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her children with better education. 

To improve her sales, Ligaya would like to apply for a new loan to pay for ingredients and products for her variety store. With PHP 35,000, she could enhance her business and provide better for her family. She sincerely passes on her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

For now, Ligaya wants to have more customers and then save money for the education of her children, because she wants to pursue them to complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients and products for her variety store.

loans.name: Fiel

texts.en:
Fiel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Fiel earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs.

She is borrowing through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell at her general store.

Fiel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Ayaba vit à Adamavo et est âgée de 38 ans. Mariée, Ayaba est mère de six enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Ayaba vend de la bouillie accompagnée de beignets pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Ayaba s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bols de maïs et des beignets pour préparer la bouillie, Ayaba demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en:
Ayaba lives in Adamavo and is 38 years old. She is a married mother of six children and strives with dynamism to support their education.

Ayaba sells porridge with fritters as an income-generating activity to ensure their livelihood. She resupplies four times monthly at the market.

To order the fritters and bowls of maize to prepare the mush, Ayaba is requesting this loan so she can make the purchase and obtain the needed profits.

loans.use: buy 40 bowls of maize and 48 fritters

loans.name: Crisencio

texts.en:
Crisencio is thankful that he was granted a 30,000 PHP loan that he used for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of his jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan to pay for tools, and the maintenance and registration of his jeepney. His income from his transportation business will definitely cover his family's everyday needs and the educational expenses of his children. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.

Crisencio hopes to buy one more jeepney and look for other means of income. He aims to send his children to college to allow them better opportunities in life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tools and the registration and maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr: A 35 ans, Sophie est une femme mariée et avec ses deux enfants, elle vit dans le quartier d’Adamavo. Sophie est une marchande de bijoux en perles qui se promène dans les rues de son quartier afin de bien vendre. Sophie s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un marché local. Sophie nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des chaines en perles et des boucles d’oreille afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sophie is a 35-year-old married mother of two children, who lives in the Adamavo neighborhood.

Sophie is a street vendor of beaded jewelry who walks the streets of her neighborhood to make good sales. She resupplies twice a month at a local market.

Sophie is requesting this loan to buy beaded necklaces and earrings, so she can earn profits and assist in her children's education.

loans.use: buy 20 necklaces and ten dozen earrings

loans.name: Ma. Novie

texts.en:
Ma. Novie, 41, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Ma. Novie has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 15 years. 

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

In the future, Ma. Novie would like to save enough money to provide and support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée qui est âgée de 27 ans et vit à Adamavo avec deux enfants à sa charge. Akossiwa est une couturière qui vend des habits fait de pagnes à ses clients afin d’avoir le bénéfice et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Akossiwa s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché. Pour  commander des pièces de pagne et faire de nouvelles tenues, Akossiwa demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour réaliser ses attentes et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Adamavo with two dependent children.

Akossiwa is a seamstress who sells clothes made from pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) to her customers so she can generate profits and provide for her children. She resupplies five times a month at the market.

Akossiwa is requesting this loan to order and purchase lengths of pagnes so she can make new outfits. This will enable her to generate good profit margins, and achieve her expectations in providing a good education for her children.

loans.use: buy five lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 50-year-old married woman who decided a year ago to start a new business selling party supplies, and decorating party halls with flowers. 

Najah has good taste in choosing her products and decorations, thus she gained her customers' trust and she is now well-known among her region. 

Today Najah is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to develop her business through buying a new collection of decorative products and party supplies for the upcoming summer season. She is working hard to manage as many parties as possible because summer is the season of occasions.
 
Najah hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of decorative products and party supplies for the summer season.

loans.name: Wadad

texts.en:
Wadad is a 45-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. 

Due to their bad circumstances, she decided to support her husband and she has been working days and nights to be able to manage her expenses and business operations as well. She has worked as a farmer since 2012. 

Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to purchase needed agriculture supplies. In this way, she will be able to increase her revenues and thus improve her way of living.

loans.use: to purchase needed agriculture supplies.

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Thouk (pictured here) is 36 years old. He lives in the Angsnoul district, Kandal province, Cambodia. He has been married since 2000. He has one son and one daughter. They are attending school.
 
Thouk has been a farmer for nine years, while his wife has been raising pigs for two years. He would like to apply for a loan to buy more pigs to raise. He wants to increase his profit so he can then support his family.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Daisy is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell through her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afiwa est une femme mariée et âgée de 48 ans. Afiwa habite dans le quartier d’Adamavo et s’active dynamiquement pour subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve. Afiwa vend des sachets plastiques en se promenant dans son quartier et arrive à gagner son profit grâce à cette activité. Afiwa achète ses provisions huit fois par mois et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sachets. Afiwa désire augmenter son bénéfice et améliorer ses prestations.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 48 year old married woman. She lives in the Adamavo district and works hard to cover her daily living expenses. 
Afiwa is a mobile seller of plastic bags in her neighbourhood and she earns her income from this. She buys her stock eight times a month and is seeking this loan to order some bags.
Afiwa wants to increase her profits and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fifty packets of plastic bags.
